loans.use: to buy ingredients such as sacks of sugar, flavoring, and other items.

location.town: Salvacion - Manu - Manu - Madre de Dios

loans.name: Jessica

texts.es: Jessica es una persona muy alegre y emprendedora que a pesar de las adversidades sale adelante y vive en la ciudad de Salvación, ella nació en la ciudad de Lima y tiene 27 años de edad actualmente ella trabaja en una entidad del estado pero en sus horas libres se dedica a la venta de carne y pollo y le va muy bien en vista que el negocio creció una vecinas le invitaron a participar en el banco comunal “Tesoritos del Manu” y en esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar una congeladora pues es importante para el negocio. Agradece y valora el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas mensuales.
texts.en:
Jessica is a very cheerful and self-starting person who, in spite of adversity, is moving forward. She lives in the city of Salvación and was born in the city of Lima. She is 27 years old and currently works for a government agency, but in her free time she works selling meat and chicken. It is going very well for her. Seeing that her business grew, some neighbors invited her to become part of the communal bank ''Tesoritos del Manu'' and, at this opportunity, she needs a loan to buy a freezer as it is important for her business.

She is grateful for and values the loan, and promises to make her monthly payments.

loans.use: to buy a freezer

location.town: Salvacion - Manu - Manu - Madre de Dios

loans.name: Akiba Group

texts.fr: La cliente Maseka est une conseillère de l’association  d’affaire « Akiba», jeune entrepreneur expérimentée, dynamique, âgée de 27 ans, célibataire, sans aucun enfant. La cliente est une vendeuse de bassins plastics. Elle installe ses marchandises au marché public. Elle commença ses affaires avec l’assistance de ses parents.  Plus tard, elle bénéficia le prêt de l’IMF Hekima. Il y a 4 ans qu’elle exerce cette activité. Ce nouveau prêt va la servir d’acheter 48 bassins plastics. Ainsi, elle souhaite  étendre son projet de commerce et soutenir ses parents dans les projets de constriction d’une maison. L’insécurité dans la province est un défi pour l’avancement de ses affaires. Au finish, elle remercie fortement Hekima pour l’autonomisation des femmes entrepreneurs non bancables, surtout ; pendant ce moment critique de guerre à l’Est du pays.
texts.en:
Maseka, age 27, is a counselor for Akiba Group. She's an experimented and energetic entrepreneur, unmarried, and without children, She sells plastic basins at the public market. 

She started her business with her parent's help. Later on, she obtained a loan from Kiva's partner, the MFI Hekima. She's been running this business for four years.

This new loan will be used to buy 48 plastic basins. Thusly, she wishes to expand her business and help her parents build a house. Insecurity in the province is a challenge to the development of her business.

In the end, she strongly thanks Hekima for its contribution to make women who are excluded by traditional banks self-supporting, especially during this critical time of war in the East of the country.

loans.use: to buy 48 plastic basins

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a solar power system to have energy in his house.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy PVC pipes, glue, cement, sand, a toilet, a shower, and accessories.

loans.name: Maria Consuelo

texts.es:
La socia se sigue dedicando al negocio de crianza de animales como gallinas,cuyes y chanchos,la socia los hace negordar y luego los vende en las diferentes ferias,la socia ya tiene 8 años en este negocio y le va muy bien,el sueño de la socia es tener un local donde pueda vender loa animales.La socia solicita el credito para comprar pollos,cuyes y chanchos y tambien para comprar alimentos para los animales.


La socia se encuentra agradecida por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
This member is still working raising animals such as chickens, guinea pigs and pigs. She fattens them up and later sells them in different markets. This member has now been working in this field for eight years and it is going really well for her. Her dream is to have a store where she can sell her animals from. 

This member is requesting a loan to buy chickens, guinea pigs and pigs as well as feed for the animals. She is grateful for the opportunity she has been provided and promises to make her repayments on time.

loans.use: to buy chickens, guinea pigs and pigs as well as feed for the animals

loans.name: Bernardino

texts.es: El señor Bernardino es de araní tiene 47 años, estudio hasta nivel primario porque sus padres eran de escasos recursos económicos y no pudo continuar con sus estudios, hace 2 años falleció su pareja y actualmente vive con sus 3 hijos a los que educa y mantiene económicamente,  Llego al Trópico hace 22 años  y se compró un parcela para poder trabajar en la agricultura y mantener a su familia, tenía cultivos anuales como ser yuca y arroz, pero hace 10 años que emprendió la producción de banano con la ayuda de sus hijos, comercializa en el mercado local pero como quiere exportar necesita tener banano de buena calidad,  por ello solicita un crédito para realizar un mantenimiento de banano y  mejorar su producción.
texts.en:
Bernardino is from Araní and is 47 years old. After primary school, he could not continue his studies because his parents had little economic resources. Two years ago his partner died, and at present he lives with his three children. He raises the children and provides for them economically.

He arrived in Trópico 22 yeras ago and bought a plot in order to be able to work in farming and to provide for his family. He used to have annual plants like yucca and rice, but 10 years ago he started to plant bananas with the help of his children. He sells the bananas in the local market, but he also wants to export and therefore needs to have bananas of a good quality.

Thus he is asking for a loan to maintain his crop and improve the quality of his bananas.

loans.use: to maintain his banana crop.

loans.name: Rosenda

texts.en:
Rosenda is a 44-year-old woman from the town of Ubay, Bohol. She is married with five grown children. She goes fishing and sells fish to help augment the income of their household. Aside from fishing, she also engages in a food-vending business as an additional source of income. Her business started more than 20 years ago. She is asking for a loan to buy additional pigs and more fish to continue her business activities.

In the future, Rosenda hopes to expand her business and increase her profitability for a sustainable livelihood.

loans.use: to buy additional pigs and more fish.

loans.name: Doylita Lus

texts.es:
Doylita tiene 37 años de edad, vive en la ciudad de Pucallpa al lado de sus 3 hijos a quienes quiere mucho y por los cuales lucha cada día para salir adelante; es por ello que Doylita se dedica a la agricultura desde hace 17 años, Doylita le gusta mucho lo que hace, es por ello que cree que le va bien en su labor.

Doylita esta agradecida con los prestamistas kiva ya que gracias a la ayuda que le han brindado ella podrá comprar fertilizantes, abono, entre otros, así como también poder solventar los gasto de regadío de su cultivo de yuca, de esta manera podrá seguir luchando para poder hacer realidad su gran sueño:” Tener una mejor vivienda”.
texts.en:
Doylita is 37 years old. She lives in the city of Pucallpa with her three children whom she loves very much and for whom she strives every day to get ahead. This is also why Doylita has been working in farming for 17 years. Doylita loves what she does and thinks that this is the reason why she is doing well in her work.

Doylita is grateful to the Kiva lenders, as thanks to the help they have provided she can buy fertilizers and manure, among others, and she will also be able to cover the expenses for the irrigation of her yucca crop. By this she will be able to continue striving to realize her great dream: "To have a better home".

loans.use: to buy manure, fertilizers, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy corn

loans.name: Judy Betty

texts.es:
Judy Betty tiene 41 años de edad, vive junto a su esposo e hijos en el distrito de Oyotun, su población se dedica a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería a dos horas del la ciudad de Chiclayo, costa norte del Perú.

Ella se dedica a la crianza y venta de animales menores en su domicilio, nos comenta que se dedica a esta actividad para apoyar a su esposo con los gastos del colegio de sus hijos.

Betty ha solicitado un préstamo de 1 000 nuevos soles para la compra de alimentos balanceados y de esta manera tener una mejor producción para ofrecer a sus clientes, generándole mayores ingresos para su familia.
texts.en:
Judy Betty is 41 years old, she lives with her husband and her sons in the Oyotun district, two hours from Chiclayo, in the Northern coast of Peru, where the population primarily works in agriculture, commerce and livestock. 

Judy raises and sells small farm animals in her own home, in order to support her husband with the education expenses of the children’s school. 

Judy is requesting a loan of 1000 nuevos soles to buy feed, to improve her business productivity and offer a greater selection to her customers, increasing in this way the family income.

loans.use: to buy feed for her farm animals.

loans.name: Julli Ivonne

texts.es:
Julli Ivonne tiene 41 años de edad, vive junto a su esposo y sus hijos, en el distrito de Zaña, la principal fuente de económica de su población es la agricultura, gracias a los canales de regadío construido por la cultura Moche, también se dedican al comercio y ganadería, a una hora con cuarenta y cinco minutos de la ciudad de Chiclayo, costa norte del Perú.

Ella es conocida en la zona por su labor de preparación y venta de comida, arroz con pato, caldo de gallina, tallarines con pollo entre otros, su negocio está ubicado en su propio domicilio.

Ha solicitado un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 3 000 nuevos soles para la compra de una cocina de gas, mesas y sillas para equipar el local donde ofrece la venta de comida y de esta manera tener mayores ingresos para su familia.
texts.en:
Julli Ivonne  is 41 years old  and lives with her husband and children in the Zaña district. Her town is an hour and 45 minutes from the city of Chiclayo, on the northern coast of Peru. Its main source of income is agriculture, thanks to the irrigation channels built by the Moche civilization. They also work in trade and livestock. 

Julli Ivonne is known locally for the work she does preparing and selling food. She makes rice with duck, chicken broth, noodles with chicken, and other foods. Her business is located in her home.

She has requested a loan from Edpyme Alternativa of 3000 PEN to buy a gas stove, tables, and chiars to outfit the location where she sells the food. In this way she can make a better income for her family.
Ha solicitado un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 3 000 nuevos soles para la compra de una cocina de gas, mesas y sillas para equipar el local donde ofrece la venta de comida y de esta manera tener mayores ingresos para su familia.

loans.use: to buy a gas stove, tables, and chairs for her place of business

loans.name: Fraternite De Sondgo Group

texts.fr:
Mme DJENEBA est responsable du groupe FRATERNITE DE SONDGO. Mariée, elle est mère de 03enfants. Le plus âgé a 22ans et le moins âgé a 06ans. 03 vont à l’école. 
Mme vend des pagnes, chaussures, etc. depuis plus de 05ans. Elle s’approvisionne à Lomé, Mali et Bobo. Ses clients sont les villages environnants.
Elle veut s’acheter divers marchandises (20douzaines de chaussures, des sacs à main, etc.).
Mme veut épargner   ses bénéfices et réinvestir dans son activité. Elle ambitionne agrandir son activité et  assurer l’avenir de  ses enfants.
texts.en: Djeneba is the leader of the Fraternité De Sondgo group. She is married and the mother of 3 children, the eldest of whom is 22 years old and the youngest, 6. Three of her children attend school. Djeneba has been selling things like pagnes (highly colourful and decorative West African clothing) and shoes for over 5 years. She gets her supplies from Lomé, Mali and Bobo. Her customers are people from the surrounding villages. She would like to buy more merchandise, including 20 dozen pairs of shoes and handbags. She would like to save her profits and reinvest them in her business. Her aim is to expand her business and ensure a good future for her children.

loans.use: to buy merchandise (20 dozen pairs of shoes, handbags etc.).

loans.name: Jacquelin  Adriana

texts.es: Jacquelin es una joven muy emprendedora de 23 años de edad, originaria de la ciudad de Managua. Casada y madre de un hijo. Es de oficio comerciante, se dedica a la venta de verduras. Inicio este negocio a la edad de 16 años, vendiendo en uno de los mercados de la ciudad, siendo inculcada por su mamá. Ella a pesar de su corta edad, decide tener su propio negocio. Hoy en día, con mucho esfuerzo ha logrado salir adelante con su familia. Su meta es mejorar las condiciones de su vivienda. Solicita el crédito para comprar verduras tales como: papas, repollo, tomate, chiltomas, ayote, entre otros, con el fin de surtir su mercadería. Estima que este crédito le será de ayuda, ya que aumentara sus productos y podrá brindar diversidad de verduras a sus clientes. Su plan futuro es mejorar la infraestructura de su negocio.
texts.en: Jacquelin is a very entrepreneurial young woman who is 23. She is a native of the city of Managua. She is married and a mother to one child. She is a merchant dedicated to selling vegetables. She began this business at the age of 16, selling in one of the markets of the city, being taught by her mother. Despite her young age, she decided to have her own business. Today, with a lot of effort, she has managed to get her family ahead. Her goal is to improve the condition of her house. She requests the loan to buy vegetables like potatoes, cabbage, tomatoes, bell peppers, squash, among others, with the goal of stocking her merchandise. She believes this loan will be useful since it will expand her products and she will be able to provide a diversity of vegetables to her customers. Her future plan is to improve the infrastructure of her business.

loans.use: to buy vegetables like potatoes, cabbage, tomatoes, bell peppers, squash, among others.

loans.name: Ratamalgre Group

texts.fr:
Mr GILBERT est responsable du groupe RATAMALGRE. Marié, il est père de 02 enfants. Le plus âgé a 04ans et le moins âgé a 09mois. 01 va à l’école. Il a 03personnes en charge.
Mr est commerçant (gère une boutique) depuis 12ans. Il s’approvisionne dans  marchés de la ville. Ses clients sont les dames et hommes du quartier.
Il veut s’acheter plusieurs articles de boutique.
Mr veut réinvestir ses bénéfices dans sa boutique. Il ambitionne transformer sa boutique en magasin et s’acheter une parcelle pour sa famille.
texts.en:
Gilbert is the leader of the Ratamalgre group. He is married and the father of 2 children, the eldest of whom is 4 years old and the youngest, 9 months. He has 3 more dependents.

Gilbert is a retailer and has been running a shop for 12 years. He gets his supplies at the markets in town. His customer are local women and men. He would like to buy several items for his shop. He wishes to reinvest in his business. His ambition is to transform his shop into a warehouse and to buy a plot of land for his family.

loans.use: several items for his shop.

loans.name: Mugina Group

texts.fr:
Odette fait partie du groupe  Mugina  et  habite à Cibitoke. Elle a 22ans et est mariée à Daniel. Ensemble ils ont 1 enfant  de 3 ans.

Elle fait le commerce de  boutique (bassins, casseroles,riz,..)  depuis 3 ans. 

C’est son premier crédit à Turame. Avec le crédit KIVA qu’elle obtient, elle  va  augmenter son capital et acheter une douzaine de casseroles, une douzaine de bassins et 50kg de riz à revendre pour gagner plus. 

Dans les prochaines  années, elle voudrait acheter des terres cultivables, une parcelle pour construire une maison en matériaux durables et voir ses enfants continuer les études.
texts.en: Odette is a member of the Mugina group and lives in Cibitoke. She is 22 years old and married to Daniel. The couple have a 3-year-old child. Odette has been selling products in a shop for 3 years. This is her first loan from Turame. Her Kiva-sponsored loan will increase her working capital and allow her to buy a dozen casserole dishes, a dozen basins and 50 kilos of rice to resell, so that she can earn more money. In the coming years, she would like to buy some arable land, a plot of land on which to build a house made from durable materials and to see her children get an education.

loans.use: to buy a dozen casserole dishes, a dozen basins and 50 kilos of rice.

loans.name: Sreyoun

texts.en:
A mother of five children, Sreyoun is 40 years old and makes a living via rice farming in Takeo Province. To assist her in earning more income to support this large household, her husband works as a paid worker in Thailand. 

Including this loan, Sreyoun is a third-time borrower with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). The past loans, which she has repaid back with success, have helped her to pay the education costs for her one remaining daughter until the tertiary level. However, it is getting to be quite a burden to cover the school fees for her daughter. 

Hence, she decided to take an education loan with VisionFund (Kiva's partner). She hopes that she can support her daughter to achieve her dream of pursuing a bachelor's degree with a major in accounting.

loans.use: To cover the education cost for her daughter.

loans.name: Luis

texts.es:
Luis tiene 47 años de edad, vive junto a sus dos hijos, en el distrito de La Matanza, su población se dedica al comercio de animales menores, agricultura y ganadería a dos horas de la ciudad de Morropon, ubicado en la Región Piura, costa norte del Perú.

El se dedica a la venta de limón acido, desde hace 7 años, los distribuye en los restaurants de su distrito, es muy conocido en la zona por la labor a la que se dedica ha solicitado un préstamo de 4 000 nuevos soles para comprar una gran cantidad de limón para distribuirlo en los mercados de Chiclayo y de esta manera tener mayores ingresos para su familia.
texts.en:
Luis is 47 and lives with his two children in La Matanza district, which is two hours from Morropon city in the Piura region on the northern coast of Peru. Its population works in small animal commerce, agriculture and stock-breeding.

Luis has been selling acid lemons for 7 years. He sells the lemons in the restaurants of his district and is well known in the area for his work. He is asking for a loan of 4,000 nuevos soles [PEN] in order to buy a large number of lemons to sell in the markets of Chiclayo, and in this way to improve his family's income.

loans.use: to buy acid lemons to sell in the markets.

loans.name: Maria Guillermina

texts.es:
María Guillermina tiene 66 años de edad, vive junto a su esposo en el distrito de Oyotun, su población se dedica a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería a dos horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo, costa norte del Perú.

Ella se dedica a la crianza y venta de animales de corral, desde hace 6 años, su negocio se encuentra ubicado en su domicilio.

María ha solicitado un préstamo de 800 nuevos soles para la compra de alimentos balanceados y así tener una mejor producción, y una segunda parte para la compra de gallinas ponedoras y ofrecer los huevos en el mercado de la zona, generándole mayores ingresos para su familia.
texts.en:
María Guillermina is 66 years old and lives with her husband in Oyotun, a district where people works in agriculture, trade and livestock, located two hours away from Chiclayo, in the northern coast of Peru.

She works raising and selling farm animals. She has been doing this for six years now and works at home.

María has requested a loan of 800 nuevos soles [PEN] to buy animal feed in order to improve her production. She will also buy laying hens and start selling eggs at the local market with the intention to increase her family’s income.

loans.use: to buy animal feed and laying hens.

loans.name: Jhon Jairo

texts.es:
Jhon es un joven que tiene 20años y trabaja como operador de costura en una pequeña empresa textil de su ciudad, con lo cual puede tener ingresos para salir adelante.

Jhon agradece la ayuda que le brindan los prestamistas kiva ya que gracias a la ayuda que le han brindado ella podrá comprar una refrigeradora para su vivienda ya que actualmente no tienen donde conservar sus alimentos y de esta manera podra ir mejorando su calidad de vida y luchar por hacer realidad su gran sueño:”Tener una empresa textil”.
texts.en:
Jhon is a 20 year old young man who works as a sewing machine operator in a small textile business in the city, which provides him with an income to help him get ahead. 

Jhon is grateful for the help that Kiva lenders offer him. Thanks to their assistance, he will be able to buy a fridge for his home, since he has nowhere to keep his food at the moment. He will be able to improve his quality of life and strive to make his dream of having a textile business come true.

loans.use: to buy a fridge

loans.name: Fe Felicita

texts.es:
Fe Felicita tiene 54 años de edad, vive junto a su esposo y su menor hijo en el distrito de Oyotún, una zona rural, donde su población se dedica a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería, a dos horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo, costa norte del Perú.

Junto a su familia tienen una bodeguita que ofrecen productos de primera necesidad, tiene buena clientela, por lo que ha solicitado un préstamo de 1 000 nuevos soles para la compra de frutas, verduras y golosinas para hacer crecer su negocio y de esta manera tener mayores ingresos para su familia.
texts.en:
Fe Felicita is 54 years old. She lives alongside her husband and their youngest son in the district of Oyotun, a rural area where the population is dedicated to farming, trade and livestock, two hours from the city of Chiclayo on the north coast of Peru.

Along with her family, she has a small shop that offers basic need products. She has good customers so she has requested a loan of 1000 PEN to buy fruit, vegetables, and candies to grow her business and have greater income for her family.

loans.use: to buy vegetables, fruits and candies to stock her little shop.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a solar system.

loans.name: Rizza

texts.en:
As a married parent of two children, Rizza works hard to support her family.

She has a bicycle transport business in the Philippines, and she also earns additional income from selling ready-to-wear clothing. Rizza is borrowing PHP 7,000 through NWTF to purchase spare parts for the maintenance of her bicycle for her bicycle transport business.

Rizza has been sustaining her business activities through her past three loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her to attain her dream of saving enough money to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase spare parts for the maintenance of her bicycle.

loans.name: Roman Antonio

texts.es: Don Ramón es originario de la ciudad de Managua, de 40 años de edad. Casado y padre de dos hijos. Es de oficio comerciante, se dedica al negocio de pulpería.  Inicio este negocio hace muchos años, como un legado de su mama, quien fundo la pulpería. Actualmente, ha logrado un crecimiento en su negocio, sobre todo mantiene una pulpería rentable y con mucha demanda de clientes. Su meta es mejorar las condiciones de su vivienda e incrementar aun su negocio. Solicita el crédito para la compra de productos como: arroz, frijoles, pan, lácteos entre otros, con el fin de surtir su negocio. Estima que el crédito le será de mucha ayuda ya que obtendrá un nivel de ganancia considerado y aumentar la mercadería de su pulpería. Su plan futuro es seguir creciendo cada vez más su negocio hasta que se convierta en una miscelánea, donde no falte ningún tipo de producto.
texts.en: Ramón is from the city of Managua. He is 40 years old, married and the father of two children. He is a merchant by trade, and works in his convenience store business. He got into this business several years ago as a legacy from his mother, who started the store. Now he has achieved growth in his business and above all maintains a profitable store with a lot of demand from customers. His goal is to improve his living conditions and grow his business more. He is asking for the loan to buy products such as rice, beans, dairy products and more, in order to stock his business. He thinks that the loan will be a big help, since he will obtain a considerable level of earnings and increase the merchandise in his store. His future plan is to keep growing his business more and more until it becomes a variety store that has every type of product.

loans.use: to buy products such as: rice, beans, bread, dairy products and more.

loans.name: Josefa Milagro

texts.es: Josefa es una humilde señora de 55 años de edad, originaria de la ciudad de Jinotega. Madre soltera de dos hijos ya independientes. Es de oficio comerciante, se dedica a la venta de ropa. Sus hijos la apoyan en todo lo que necesita. Este negocio inicio desde hace muchos años, cuando era pequeña y vendía comida en unos de los mercados de la ciudad. A raíz de eso, decidió tener su propio negocio en su vivienda lo cual considero que le generaba más ingresos. Su meta próxima es mejorar la infraestructura de su vivienda. Solicita el crédito para comprar mercadería variada como: camisas, pantalones, faldas entre otros, con el fin de brindar una diversidad de mercadería a sus clientes. Estima que este crédito le será beneficioso ya que tendrá suficiente mercadería para cumplir con la demanda de sus clientes, lo cual le generara un alto nivel de ventas. Su plan futuro extender más su negocio y lograr construir una pulpería.
texts.en: Josefa is a humble 55 year old woman. She is a native of the city of Jinotega. She is a single mother to two children who are independent. She is a merchant dedicated to selling clothing. Her children support her in everything she needs. She started this business many years ago when she was small and she sold food in one of the city's markets. Following that, she decided to have her own business in her house which she considered would generate more income. Her next goal is to improve the infrastructure of her house. She is requesting the loan to buy varied merchandise such as shirts, pants, skirts, among other items with the goal of providing diverse merchandise to her customers. She believes this loan will be beneficial since she will have enough merchandise to meet the demands of her customers which will generate a high level of sales. Her future plan is to extend her business more and complete construction of a grocery shop.

loans.use: to buy varied merchandise like shirts, pants, skirts, among other items.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy groceries to increase the selection of products in his store.

loans.name: Clotilde

texts.es:
Cleotilde tiene 52 años de edad, vive junto a su esposo y sus hijos en el distrito de La Matanza, su población se dedica a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería a dos horas de la ciudad de Piura, costa norte del Perú.

Ella se dedica a la venta de chicha de jora, cerveza y comida en su domicilio, es muy conocida en la zona por la labor que realiza, son una familia unida, su esposo brinda servicio de maestro de construcción.

Cleotilde ha solicitado un préstamo de 3 000 nuevos soles para comprar maíz por ocasión para posteriormente ofrecerlo a un mejor precio y de esta manera generar ingresos adicionales para su familia.
texts.en:
Cleotilde is 52 years old. She lives with her husband and children in the La Matanza district. Its residents work in farming, commerce and livestock. It is two hours from the city of Piura, on the northern coast of Peru.

She works selling chicha de jora, beer, and food from her home. She is well known in the area for her work. Her family is close and her husband works in construction. 

Cleotilde has asked for a loan of 3,000 nuevos soles to buy corn in order to offer a better price and in this way generate additional income for her family.

loans.use: to buy corn.

loans.name: Cate

texts.en:
Cate is 32 years old and lives in the town of Mukono in the Mukono region of Uganda. She has 3 children who are all currently in school.

For the past 3 years, Cate has been working hard to manage her restaurant, which sells snacks, food, and tea. 

To help expand her business, Cate has requested a loan of 2,000,000 Ugandan shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy missing items for outside catering, and will help Cate to generate greater profits and educate her children. Cate hopes that, in the future, she will be able to grow to a hotel level. 

Cate is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Cate who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to buy missing items for outside catering

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a flour mill.

loans.name: Marpatkhan

texts.ru: Марпатхан 53 года, вдова, одна воспитала 3 детей, дочери замужем и проживают отдельно, сыну 16 лет, проживает с мамой и помогает ей по хозяйству. У Марпатхан - среднее образование, в качестве основного дохода для своей семьи Марпатхан занимается животноводством, стартовав 23 года назад, с покупки скота на 3,000 сом KGS. Благодаря упорному труду Марпатхан и ее сына, в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется: 6 дойных коров, 30 овец. Марпатхан доит коров и сдает молоко реализаторам, сын занимается закупом сена и кормов для скота. Ежемесячный доход составляет 5,000 сом (KGS). Марпатхан входит в группу "Кызыл-Кыя", в эту группу входят еще 2 человека. Марпатхан является третьим членом группы. В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Марпатхан обратилась в Микрофинансовый банк «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 100,000 сом (KGS) на покупку нетелей для увеличения поголовья скота. Доходы от кредита Марпатхан планирует вложить в дальнейшее приумножение количества домашней скотины, и планирует накопить средства на ремонт дома, в котором проживает в настоящее время.
texts.en: Marpatkhan is 53 years old, widowed, and raised three children by herself. Her daughters are married and live seperately. Her son is 16 years old, lives with her and helps her with her farming. Marpatkhan has a secondary education. As the main source of income for her family, Marpatkhan practices livestock breeding. She started this business 23 years ago, with an initial purchase of cattle in the amount of 3,000 som (KGS). Thanks to the hard work of Marpatkhan and her son, she currently has 6 milk cows and 30 sheep on her farm. Marpatkhan milks the cows and sells the milk, while her son buys the hay and feeds the livestock. Her monthly income is 5,000 som (KGS). Marpatkhan is in the farming group "Kyzyl-Kiya." This group already has two members in it; Marpatkhan is the third member. For the purpose of further developing her business, Marpatkhan turned to Microfinance Bank "Bai Tushum and Partners." She is requesting a loan in the amount of 100,000 som (KGS) to buy heifers to increase the size of her herd. Marpatkhan plans to invest the earnings from the loan in the further acquisition of livestock. She also intends to save money to renovate the house she currently lives in.

loans.use: to buy heifers.

loans.name: Than

texts.en:
A local villager from the Bovel district of Battambang province, Than is 53 years old and blessed with five children.  Her entire household relies on a single business, rice farming on a one-and-a-half hectare area which has returned her about 75,000 KHR per day.

The main challenge for her business is the shortage of working capital to support her agribusiness. Hence, she applies for her first loan to pay for plowing fees, to buy fertilizer and rice seeds, and to pay for labor costs. She hopes that she can gain triple yield from her crop so that she can gain a good income.

loans.use: to pay for plowing fees, to buy fertilizer and rice seeds, and to pay for labor costs

loans.name: Rosalinda

texts.en:
Rosalinda works hard to support her family. She is married and has a fish vending business in the Philippines.

Rosalinda requested a 12,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy more fish to sell. She has been in this business for 10 years now.

In the future, Rosalinda would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to cover the tuition fee for her daughter

loans.name: Haimurot

texts.ru: Хаймурот 49-летний житель района Кубадиён. Он является главой дехканского хозяйства, который состоит из 3,60 га земельного участка. Из этого участка только 3,24 га является орошаемым, 0,23 га пастбищем,а остальные части находятся под водой. Хаймурот вместе с четырьмя рабочими выращивает на 3,24 га земли овощи, хлопок и пшеницу. В данный момент Хаймурот собирается параллельно начать бизнес по откорму и продаже скота, так как в его дехканском хозяйстве имеется большой участок пастбища. Это означает что у него не будет проблем с кормом и на зиму он уже запасся огромным количеством корма. Хаймурот обратился за кредитом, чтобы купить крупнорогатый скот. Он планирует каждый месяц покупать по трех голов бычков с рынка Кубадиён, откармливать в течение 25-30 дней и продавать с наценкой на том же рынке. Если он начнет этот бизнес, у него будет дополнительный стабильный доход, что позволит его семье жить лучше.
texts.en: Haimurot is a 49-year-old resident of the Qubadiyon District. He is the head of a communal farm which is made up of a 3.6 hectare plot of land. Of this whole plot, only 3.24 hectares are irrigated, 0.23 hectares are grazing pastures and the remaining parts are under water. Haimurot, along with four other field hands, grow vegetables, cotton and wheat on 3.24 hectares of land. Currently, Haimurot is planning to simultaneously start his own business fattening up and reselling cattle as his communal farm has a big plot for grazing. This means that there will not be a problem with feeding them. He has already been storing up a huge amount of feed for them for winter. Haimurot is requesting a loan to buy cattle. He plans to buy three bulls every month from the Qubadiyon market, fatten them up over the course of 25-30 days, and resell them at a mark-up at the very same market. If he is able to start this business, he will have an additional, stabile income which will allow his family to live better.

loans.use: to buy three bulls in order to start his business of fattening up and reselling cattle.

loans.name: Dariko

texts.en:
Dariko, age 41, is from the Khelvachauri District. She is married with two grown sons. The family runs a small-scale agricultural business to earn a living. Specifically, Dariko grows citrus in her own garden and sells seasonally to local retailers.  Moreover, Dariko breeds milk cows and sells the received milk from her house. Her earnings are hardly enough to cover the food and household costs for the family of four.

In order to generate income, Dariko and her husband plan to start an additional business. With the loan amount, she will purchase a mini-bus which will mainly be used by Dariko’s husband on a mini-bus line. He will transport passengers from his district to a neighboring town and earn a daily income. Now is the high season for citrus harvest, so Dariko and her spouse will also use the mini-bus for making citrus deliveries. They will save on transportation costs and generate good income from the agricultural business as well.

Dariko hopes this family initiative will be lucrative and be able to increase their funds. Dariko and her family members are waiting for your generosity.

loans.use: to buy a mini-bus for her husband to start working on a mini-bus line

loans.name: Hukminiso

texts.ru: Хукминисо трудолюбивая женщина. Она родилась в 1960 года. Она замужем и имеет 3 детей. Дети совершеннолетние. Ее муж мастер по ремонту дома. Хукминисо занимается шитьем женской одежды. Она покупает ткани с рынка, шьёт женские платья и продает своим клиентам. Она также предоставляет услугу швеи. Ее клиенты довольны ее услугами. Хукминисо и ее семья живут в маленьком доме, который имеет плохое состояние. Она обратилась в ИМОН с целью получения займа. Она запрашивает займ на сумму 7000 сомони для покупки строительных материалов как цемент, древесина, краски и т.п. для ремонта дома. Она ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en: Hukminiso is a hardworking woman. She was born in 1960. She is married and has 3 children. Her children are all grown up. Her husband is an expert in home repair. Hukminiso sews women's clothing. She buys fabric at the market, sews women's dresses and sells them to her clients. She also offers seamstress services. Her clients are happy with her work. Hukminiso and her family live in a small house which is in a state of disrepair. She turned to IMON to obtain a loan. She is requesting a loan in the amount of 7000 somoni to buy construction materials such as cement, lumber, paint, etc. to repair her house. She awaits your kindness.

loans.use: To buy building materials as cement, lumber and paint for repairing her house.

loans.name: Leonor

texts.es: Leonor es una mujer alegre, entusiasta y perseverante que está feliz y contenta con el anterior crédito que se prestó, ella sigue viviendo en la ciudad de Paucartambo y continua enseñando en uno de los colegio de la zona y le va muy bien gracias al empeño que pone en su trabajo. Ella agradece a todos los inversionistas por el apoyo brindado y va continuar participando en el banco comunal “Santa Ana” y esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para el mantenimiento de su casa pues va refaccionar el techo ya que se están acercando las lluvias y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas mensuales con mucha responsabilidad.
texts.en:
Leonor is a cheerful, enthusiastic and persevering woman who is happy and content with the previous loan she took out. She still lives in the city of Paucartambo, continues to teach at a local school and is doing very well thanks to the efforts she puts into her work.

She thanks all lenders for their support and will continue to participate in the "Santa Ana" communal bank. On this occasion she needs a loan in order to maintain her house. She wants to repair her roof because the rains are approaching.

She commits to make her monthly payments very responsibly.

loans.use: to maintain her house because she wants to repair the roof.

loans.name: Herman

texts.es:
Hernan vive en la ciudad de Pucallpa y trabaja en su parcela como agricultor, a Hernan le gusta mucho lo que hace es por ello que le dedica a su cultivo alrededor de 9 horas, ya que con el fruto de su trabajo puede sacar adelante a su familia.

Hernan agradece el apoyo de los prestamistas kiva a que gracias a la ayuda que le han brindado el podrá comprar abono, fertilizantes, entre otros para poder dar sostenimiento a su cultivo y de esta manera tener una mejor cosecha y poder mejorar sus ingresos, así seguirá luchando por hacer realidad su gran sueño:” Tener un fundo agrícola”.
texts.en:
Hernan lives in the city of Pucallpa and works as a farmer on his plot. Hernan likes his work very much and therefore spends about 9 hours every day on his crop, because with the earnings from his labor he can get his family ahead.

Hernan thanks the Kiva lenders for their help. Thanks to the help they have given, he will be able to buy manure, fertilizers and other things to use for his crop and therefore have a better harvest and improve his income. By this he can continue to strive to realize his great dream: "To have a farm."

loans.use: to buy manure, fertilizers, and more.

loans.name: Heidi

texts.en:
This is Heidi, 43, a resident of Malibay, Pasay, Philippines. She is married to Chuck, a referee, and they have children. She and her husband are managing their household, as they both work hard to provide for their everyday needs. 

Heidi operates a salon business. She offers hair styling, hair grooming, manicure and pedicure, and the like. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community.  She earns a minimum of Php 1,000 in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a Php 25,000 loan. She will be using the loan to buy supplies for her salon like shampoo, hair treatment creams and oils, and other things needed for her business. 

Heidi hopes to be successful in her business, and dreams that her children will finish their studies. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work and life every week. This is also where she finds strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To pay for beauty and hair products needed in her salon.

loans.name: Shelca

texts.en:
Shelca works hard to support her family. She is married, and has a food vending business in the Philippines. Shelca has been in this business for one year.

Shelca requested a PHP 6,000 loan through NWTF to buy ingredients like meat, seasonings, bamboo sticks, etc. for her food vending business.

Shelca would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy ingredients like meat, seasonings, bamboo sticks, etc. for her food vending business

loans.name: Nshan

texts.en:
Nshan lives in Yerevan with his wife and two school-age children. He has been engaged in a shoe sewing business for over 20 years. As a very skilled shoemaker, Nshan has a lot of clients who are ordering new shoes from him. Due to his hard work and nice attitude toward people, Nshan manages to gather enough income for sustaining his family.

Because of new orders, Nshan is having difficulty purchasing materials to sewing shoes and complete orders from his clients. He has applied for this loan for financial support. The loan will greatly assist him in purchasing materials to use in sewing new shoes.

Nshan has now been approved for a loan within the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF international. The start-up loan program provides business start-up loans with soft conditions to informal businesses that do not have access to credit products. 

Nshan hopes for lenders support.

loans.use: to pay for materials for sewing shoes

loans.name: Isabel Cristina

texts.es:
Doña Isabel es una señora de 40 años de edad, que estudió hasta el nivel primario de educación básica, es viuda desde hace 12 años. Tiene 3 hijos, la mayor de sus hijos no vive con ella y ya terminó los estudios de bachillerato, el varón está próximo a cumplir 18 años de edad  y el próximo año iniciará los estudios de bachillerato, tiene una muchacha de 14 años de edad y ha terminado sus estudios de séptimo año. También vive con ella un niño de 2 años, que es sobrino de ella y lo está criando como hijo suyo; pues se lo dejaron  en el patio de su casa. Doña Isabel tiene que velar y cubrir con todos los gastos de los miembros anteriormente mencionados.

Doña Isabel se ha dedicado al comercio desde su niñez, cuando aprendió de su madre a trabajar arduamente en esta actividad, principalmente se dedica a la venta de ropa para dama y caballero (camisas, blusas, pantalones, faldas, ropa interior etc.). El producto lo compra por docena y lo vende de forma ambulante en toda la comunidad. Tiene que caminar largos trayectos, para lograr ofrecer sus productos a los clientes potenciales, es una mujer trabajadora y muy responsable. En algunas ocasiones su hija la acompaña a vender, pero la mayor parte del tiempo trabaja sola desde las primeras horas de la mañana hasta el atardecer, también vende lociones y cosméticos de revista.

El préstamo solicitado, es para comprar  mercadería que le hará aumentar sus ventas (ropa y cosmeticos)y por lo tanto tendrá mayores ingresos, esto le servirá para cubrir con los gastos de la casa y proporcionarles a sus hijos sus necesidades básicas y con esto se cubrirá la necesidad de capital de trabajo, ya que en esta época de verano las ventas son mayores y puede tener mejores ingresos.  

En el futuro, ella planea estabilizarse económicamente de manera que pueda tener una mejor calidad de vida y lograr ver que sus hijos se superen y estudien en la universidad,  para que lleguen a ser buenos ciudadanos.
texts.en:
Isabel is a forty year old woman who studied until elementary school in basic education. She has been a widow for twelve years. She has three children: the oldest already graduated from high school and no longer lives with her; the son is nearing his eighteenth birthday, and next year he will begin high school; the girl is fourteen years old and has completed seventh grade. Also living with her is a two year old child who is her nephew. She is raising him as her own son since he was left on her patio. Isabel has to watch over all of the previously mentioned family members as well as cover all of the expenses. 

Isabel has been working in trade since her childhood when she first learned from her mother to work arduously at this activity. She mainly sells clothing for women and men (shirts, blouses, pants, skirts, underwear, and so on). She buys her products by the dozen and sells them as a mobile street vendor throughout the entire community. She has to walk long distances in order to manage to show her products to potential customers. She is a hardworking and very responsible woman. On some occasions, her daughter sells with her, but most of the time she works alone from the first hours of the morning until the evening. She also sells lotions and cosmetics through catalogs.

The requested loan is to buy merchandise that will increase her sales (clothing and cosmetics) and so as to have a greater income. This will help her to cover home expenses and provide her children with their basic necessities. This loan will also cover the need for working capital since during the summer sales are at their highest and she can have more income. 

In the future, she plans to become financially stable so that she could have a better quality of life and succeed in seeing her children excel and attend universities so that they could become good citizens.

loans.use: to buy merchandise that will increase her sales (clothing and cosmetics).

loans.name: Lory

texts.en:
Lory is 63 years old and widowed with one child. She works very hard to provide for them.

Lory runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell.

She has been in this business for ten years, and sells a variety of items such as sugar, soap, noodles, and other groceries. 

In the future, Lory would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Ny

texts.en:
A mother in early 50s residing in the Kampong Cham province, Ny is a farmer who grows cassava and vegetables as the main business source of income. She has been involved in her current business for three years, and nowadays it has returned her almost US $10 per day. 

This is not the first loan for Ny with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). The past loan, which she has fully repaid back, has enabled her to keep her child in school until grade 12. 

Since her daughter needs to pursue her studies to the bachelor degree level, she decided to take out an education loan to cover the school fee and to buy study materials for her daughter. 

She hopes that this financial support will help her daughter to focus on her studies, and get good grades in school so she can find a good job after graduation.

loans.use: To cover the school fee and to buy study materials for her daughter

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Tbaung Khmum district

loans.name: Alicia

texts.en: Alicia is married with five children and runs a general store in Tangub City for a living. She has been selling grocery goods for five years, earning well for the needs of the family. She was photographed with her motorcycle used for carrying her stock from town to her store. Sometimes, she lets her neighbor rent her motorcycle for additional income. She joined GDMPC recently and requested a loan to purchase grocery items for sale to boost her store. She is hopeful to sustain her store for a stable source of income in the future.

loans.use: to purchase grocery items for sale

loans.name: Perry

texts.en:
In 2008, Art, an architectural façade specialist and Lithuanian native, started Lavada Inc. Two years later he invited his close friend Perry, a fellow architectural façade specialist, to work alongside him. The two not only share a passion for architecture but they also have a combined 20 years of experience in construction and architecture, and it is this experience and passion that allows them to successfully create facades for dozens of buildings each year.

This dynamic duo is also extremely resilient. Their warehouse, located in Red Hook, Brooklyn, was significantly affected by last fall’s Hurricane Sandy. Left with a lot of damaged equipment and no power , they were forced to close for several weeks, but with help from family and friends, Perry and Art were able to pull themselves up by their bootstraps, clean up their work space, and continue serving clients.

Now that they are back up and running and ready to grow, Perry and Art need your help. This loan will allow them to purchase new materials and new equipment, including a forklift that will allow them to more efficiently transport materials. 

Help Perry and Art purchase new equipment and build upon their dream.

loans.use: to purchase new materials and new equipment, including a forklift.

loans.name: Saumu

texts.en:
Saumu is a married woman with four children, three of whom attend school and one underage. She owns a house that neither has electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees. 

For the past two years, she has operated a shop kiosk business, selling to her neighbors and passersby. She mentioned seasonality and theft as her major challenges. She dreams of establishing a wholesale shop in the future.

With the KES 20,000, she wants to purchase mangoes, sweets, biscuits, oranges, beans, and bananas. She joined Yehu to get financial support.

loans.use: to purchase mangoes, sweets, biscuits, oranges, beans, and bananas.

loans.name: Vanny

texts.en: Vanny, originally from the Srey Santhor district of Kampong Cham province, is 41 years old. She is one of the breadwinners in her family consisting of six children. Nowadays, she needs to support only three kids who are in school. For her family, the main sources of income are from rice farming and the salary from her husband's job at a construction site. She can get $10 USD per day to cover the primary basic needs in her household. Vanny is quite new to VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). She is now seeking an education loan in order to pay for her son's tuition fees. He wants to study economics as his major. She hopes that she can support her son in a timely manner so her son can pay more attention to his studies.

loans.use: to pay for her son's tuition fees.

loans.name: Tita

texts.en:
Tita is 59 years old and married with five children. With one child still in school, Tita works very hard to provide for them.

Tita runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 5000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional stock like canned goods, snack foods, soft drinks, noodles, eggs and other groceries to sell.

Tita has been in this business for two years and sells a variety of grocery items. She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock like canned goods, snack foods, soft drinks, noodles, eggs and other groceries to sell

loans.name: Uktamjon

texts.ru: Уктамчон работает продавцом в продуктовом магазине. Он доволен своей работой. Он считает, что его работа зависит он него, сколько он будет работать, столько и будет получать. Поэтому почти 20 лет Уктамчон работает в сфере торговли. Он выбрал эту деятельность, потому что когда то его отец тоже работал в этой сфере. На сегодняшний день Уктамчон торгует продуктами питания в маленьком ассортименте. Уктамчон решился взять кредит и на сумму от займа приобрести больше продуктов и увеличить различность товара. Он уверен, что таким образом он сможет привлечь больше клиентов, в том числе приобрести и постоянных покупателей.
texts.en: Uktamchon sells food at a grocery store. He is satisfied with his job. He figures that what he receives depends on how much he puts into his work. He chose this business because his father also worked in this field. Currently Uktamchon sells a small variety of food products. He has decided to take out a loan to purchase more products and expand his product selection. He is certain that this will enable him to attract more customers, as well as to get keep customers coming back.

loans.use: To purchase food products to increase his product  selection

loans.name: Lola

texts.ru: Лола добросовестная женщина. Ей 43 года. Она вдова и имеет 3 детей. Двое ее детей несовершеннолетние и учатся в средней школе. Лола обеспечивает своих детей одной зарплатой и поэтому они живут крайне бедно. Лола работает в средней школе учительницей. Она преподает историю. У Лолы хорошие знания и она имеет педагогический опыт. Лола работает более 21 лет в школе. Она серьёзно заболела и ей срочно надо лечиться. Она не имеет денег для покупки лекарства для лечения своей болезни. Она запрашивает займ на сумму 5000 сомони. Она ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en: Lola is an honest woman. She is 43 years old. She is a widow and has three children. Two of her children are not yet grown-up and study at secondary school. Lola provides for her children on one salary and that is why they live on the edge of poverty. Lola works in a secondary school as a teacher. She teaches history. Lola has an in-depth knowledge and pedagogical experience. Lola has worked in a school for more than 21 years. She is seriously ill and urgently needs to get treatment. She does not have the money to buy the medication needed to treat her illness. She is requesting a loan in the amount of 5000 somoni. She awaits your kindness.

loans.use: To buy medicine for her medical treatment.

loans.name: Mauricia

texts.en:
Mauricia is 45 years old, married, and has seven children who attend school. She is from Ubay, Bohol. She operates a variety store, selling various items such as cooking oil, toiletries, sugar, canned goods, and  beverages,  to help augment the income of their household.

Mauricia is requesting a loan, which she will use to buy more stocks of beverages, canned goods, noodles, rice, and soap. The loan will enable her to cater to the needs of her customers. In the future, Mauricia  hopes to expand her business and increase business profitability for her children’s education.

loans.use: to purchase beverages, canned goods, noodles, rice, and soap

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to build a new wire fence for her land.

loans.name: Versil

texts.en:
Versil is married and works hard to support her family. She operates a general store business in the Philippines, which she has been doing for two years.

Versil is requesting a loan from NWTF for 5,000 PHP, which she will use to buy more stocks to sell in her general store. In the future, she would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more items to sell

loans.name: Godfrey

texts.en:
Godfrey is 47 years old and lives in the town of Kayunga in the  region of Mukono in Uganda. He is married and has five children with four of them currently in school. For the past two years, Godfrey has been working hard to manage his motor spare parts business, which sells tyres, oil, and lubricant, etc.. 

To help expand his business, Godfrey has requested a loan of 2,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more goods, and will help Godfrey to generate greater profits and Increased income. Godfrey hopes that in the future he will be able to have more products for the customer base. 

Godfrey is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Godfrey who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to buy more goods

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy construction materials.

loans.name: Tatyana

texts.ru: Татьяна родилась в 1981 года. Она не замужем и не имеет детей. Татьяна живет одна. Ей не на кого надеется и поэтому для того, чтобы зарабатывать деньги, она открыла свой бизнес 3 месяца назад. Она открыла салон красоты. Татьяна предоставляет услуги парикмахера. Она делает красивые прически, модные стрижки и стильные миникьюр. Татьяна в течение 3 месяцев привлекла достаточно клиентов. Она старается предоставить свои услуги на высшем уровне. Татьяна хочет отремонтировать свой салон красоты. Таким образом, она улучшит условия салона и будет привлекать больше клиентов. Она запрашивает займ на сумму 1500 сомони для покупки строительных материалов для ремонта салона, чтобы развевать новый бизнес. Она ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en: Tatiana was born in 1981. She is single, has no children, and lives by herself. She relies only on herself, and to earn a living, opened a business three months ago. She is a hairdresser. She does beautiful hair-dos, stylish haircuts, and manicures. Within three months she has attracted plenty of clients. She is trying to offer the highest level of service. Tatiana would like to repair her beauty salon. In this way she can improve her salon and will attract more customers. She is requesting a loan in the amount of 1500 somoni to buy building materials to fix up her salon so she can develop her business. She awaits your kind assistance.

loans.use: To repair her beauty salon for developing her new business

loans.name: Liberty

texts.en: Liberty helps her husband working in their fishing business for a living. She is the one who sells fish in the market while her husband does the fishing. She joined GDMPC to gain access to micro finance services. She requests a loan to buy fishing nets used for the business. She plans to use her revenue generated to buy a brand new fishing boat for expansion.

loans.use: to buy fishing nets

loans.name: Mihriniso

texts.ru: Михринисо опытная портниха и шьет красивые таджикские национальные платья. Ей   46 лет. Она разведена и на воспитании имеет  3 детей. С целью обеспечения семьи со всеми необходимыми средствами 9 лет назад она начала свой бизнес шитьем женской одежды. Она предоставляет свои услуги у себя дома. Ее дом имеет плохое состояние и Михринисо срочно надо отремонтировать дом. Она не имеет денег, так как она использует свой доход для покупки строительных материалов. Она запрашивает займ на сумму 1000 сомони для покупки строительных материалов для ремонта дома. Она ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en: Mikhriniso is an experienced tailor and makes beautiful traditional Tajik dresses. She is 46 years old. She is divorced and has three children. To provide for her family she started her own tailoring business 9 years ago. She runs the business out of her home. Mikhriniso's house is in poor condition and she needs to repair her house as soon as possible. She does not have any money; she is using her income to buy building materials. She is asking for a loan in the amount of 1000 somoni to buy building materials to repair her house. She awaits your kind assistance.

loans.use: To buy building materials for repairing her house

loans.name: Henrry Paul

texts.es:
Henrry Paul tiene 29 años de edad, vive junto a su esposa y sus hijos en el distrito de Cayalti, su población se dedica a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería a dos horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo, costa norte del Perú.

El brinda el servicio de transporte público en su propia mototaxi, trasladando a sus pasajeros a las comunidades aledañas a su distrito, es muy conocido en la zona, ha solicitado un préstamo de 2 000 nuevos soles para darle mantenimiento a su vehículo para seguir brindando un servicio seguro a sus clientes y al mismo también percibiendo ingresos para su familia.
texts.en:
Henrry Paul, 29, lives with his wife and children in the Cayalti district, two hours from the city of Chiclayo on the northern coast of Peru.  The people there make a living in farming, commerce, and ranching.

Henrry Paul provides public transportation service in his own motorcycle taxi taking passengers to the communities near his district, and he's very well known in the area.

He has requested a loan for 2,000 nuevos soles [PEN] to perform maintenance on his vehicle.  This way he'll continue offering his customers safe service and earning an income for his family.

loans.use: to maintain his vehicle

loans.name: Ulfridis

texts.es:
Ulfridis es un hombre de 46 años de edad, muy dedicado a su familia  y a su trabajo  como albañil. Aprendió a trabajar la albañilería con un tío, además trabaja la agricultura que lo aprendió al lado de su padre, esta actividad le ha permitido defenderse a lo largo  de su vida. Está casado, con quien ha procreado 5 hijos  de los cuales  2 están bajo su responsabilidad, tres están acompañados  y viven en la casa con ellos.  

En la agricultura, Ulfridis cuenta con 30 años de experiencia, hace 5 años comenzó a trabajar con cerdos y ha ido tomando experiencia en este rubro, la albañilería la ha trabajado desde hace 20 años y cuenta con la experiencia.

Este Crédito, el cliente lo quiere para la compra de 3 cerdos pequeños, para engordarlos  y venderlos destazados en el mes de diciembre, para esto él comprara una parte de concentrado de engorde los cerditos de 1 mes de nacidos.  

En el futuro,  piensa dedicarse más a la crianza de cerdos, por que observa que se tiene futuro en este trabajo, desea establecer las instalaciones en buenas condiciones, para tener más cerdos  y durante todo el año.
texts.en:
Ulfridis is a 46 year-old man. He is very dedicated to his family and to his job as a construction worker.  He learned to do construction from his uncle. He also works in agriculture, which he learned at his father’s side.  This job has allowed him to hold his own his entire life.  He is married, and with his wife he has had five children, two of whom are still under his care.  Three of them have significant others and live in the house with them.

Ulfridis has thirty years of experience in agriculture.  Five years ago he began to work with pigs, and he has been gaining experience in this area.  He has worked in construction for 20 years and is very experienced. 

The client wants this loan for the purchase of three small pigs, to fatten them and sell them, butchered, in the month of December.  For this he will buy a portion of fattening feed. The piglets are one month old.

In the future, he plans to work more with pigs, because he sees that there is a future in this work.  He wants to build facilities in good condition, to have more pigs throughout the year.

loans.use: to buy three small pigs to fatten and sell, butchered, in the month of December. For this he will buy one portion of fattening feed. The piglets are one month old.

loans.name: Yoni Eudelmario

texts.es:
Yoni Eudelmario tiene 43 años de edad, vive junto a su esposa e hijo en el distrito de Nueva Arica, es una zona rural, su población se dedica al cultivo de frutales, arroz, maíz, comercio y agricultura, a dos horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo, costa norte del Perú.

Son una familia unida que se esfuerza por tener un mejor futuro con la ayudad de su esposa se dedican a la crianza y venta de animales menores cerdos, chivos y pavos, los ofrece en el mercado de la zona por kilos, Yoni trabaja como albañil elaborando adobes para construcciones de viviendas, ha solicitado un préstamo de 1 000 nuevos soles para colocar luz eléctrica en su domicilio y de esta manera tener una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en: Yoni Eudelmario is 43 and lives with his wife and child in the Nueva Arica district. Located two hours from the city of Chiclayo, on the north coast of Peru, it is a rural area where the people work in agriculture, cultivating and selling fruit, rice and corn. Yoni's family are united in their fight for a better future, and with the help of his wife he works rearing and selling pigs, goats and turkeys, which they sell by the kilo at market. Yoni also works as a builder, making bricks for houses. He is asking for a loan of 1,000 soles to connect his house with electricity and improve his quality of life.

loans.use: to connect his house with electricity

loans.name: Yovanna Del Rosario

texts.es:
Yovanna del Rosario tiene 32 años de edad, vive junto a sus padres en el distrito de Cayalti, su población se dedica al cultivo de arroz, caña y maíz, comercio y ganadería a dos horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo, costa norte del Perú.

Ella se dedica a la venta de ropa para niños, desde hace mas de 1 año, su negocio se encuentra en su domicilio, ha solicitado un préstamo de 2 000 nuevos soles para la compra de mercadería de temporada primavera – verano para ofrecer a sus clientes y de esta manera ofrecer mayor variedad para sus clientes.
texts.en:
Yovanna del Rosario is 32 years old.  She lives together with her parents in the district of Cayalti.  The people there work in trade, cattle, and growing rice, sugar cane, and corn.  It is two hours from the city of Chiclayo, on the north coast of Perú.

She works selling clothing for children.  For more than a year, her business has been out of her home.  She has asked for a loan of 2000 nuevos soles for the purchase of merchandise for the spring/summer season to offer to her customers.  In this way she will offer better variety to her customers.

loans.use: to buy seasonal garments for women, men, and children.

loans.name: Paulino

texts.es: El señor Paulino proviene de una familia pobre de escasos recursos, vive en concubinato y tiene 2 hijos  dependientes, es de la provincia carrasco, se dedicaba a la pesca, casa  y produccion de algunos cultivos estacionales, los cuales no generaban muchos ingresos economicos, razon por la que opto por dedicarse a la produccion de yuca, la misma que comercializa a los intermediarios que le vienen a comprar al lugar, el credito que solicita es para el mantenimiento de yuca con el cual mejorara la calidad y aumentara su produccion.
texts.en: Paulino comes from a poor family with limited resources. He lives with his partner and has two children who are dependent on him. He is from Carrasco province and he works as a fisherman and hunter, as well as growing some seasonal crops. These activities do not generate a lot of income, which is why he decided to start growing manioc, which he sells to intermediaries who approach him. The loan he is asking for is to maintain his manioc crops, improving their quality and increasing his production.

loans.use: to grow manioc.

loans.name: Sak

texts.en:
Sak is a mother of two little children residing in Ponhea Krek district of Kampong Cham province.  To earns a living, she grows cassava as her main source of income and raises pigs as her secondary source of income. It is the business that she has had for eight years, earning about 29,400 KHR per day.

 This is not the original loan for Sak with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). She has repaid her past loan completely and it has enabled her to improve her living conditions. For this cycle, she is seeking 2,400,000 KHR in order to buy a decent rice mill to support her business. She hopes that she can support her business in a timely manner and get more income.

loans.use: To buy a decent rice mill for her business

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Ponhea Krek district

loans.name: Cristeta

texts.en:
Cristeta previously requested a loan for 25,000 PHP, which she used to purchase more quantities and varieties of grocery items and products needed in her business. Her earnings were a big help for her children’s education and in their personal, household, and business expenditures.
 
Cristeta is requesting another loan for 25,000 PHP, which she will use to buy groceries, toiletries, beverages, and other products to add in her inventory. The more items displayed at the store the better; more items to sell will result in better profits, which will help sustain her family’s daily needs and children’s education expense. 

Cristeta hopes that her business will continue to be successful and hopes that her children will finish their studies.  She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and God she studies.

All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to purchase grocery items, toiletries, and beverages needed in her business.

loans.name: Burulkan

texts.ru: Бурулкан 33 года, замужем, вместе с супругом воспитывают 5 детей, из них 2 школьного и 3 дошкольного возраста. У Бурулкан - среднее образование, в качестве основного дохода для своей семьи Бурулкан занимается животноводством, стартовав 15 лет назад, с покупки скота на 8,000 сом KGS. Бурулкан на протяжении многих лет занимается животноводством, супруг активно помогает по хозяйству. Благодаря упорному труду Бурулкан, в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется: 4 дойные коровы и 40 овец. Ежемесячный доход составляет 7,000 сом (KGS). Бурулкан входит в группу "Кызыл-Кыя", в эту группу входят еще 2 человека. Бурулкан является вторым членом группы. В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Бурулкан обратилась в Микрофинансовый банк «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 65,000 сом (KGS) на покупку овец и коз для увеличения поголовья скота. Доходы от кредита Бурулкан планирует вложить в дальнейшее приумножение количества домашней скотины, и планирует накопить средства на строительство нового дома.
texts.en: Burulkan is 33 years old, married, and together with her husband, is raising five children. Of them, two are of school age and three are toddlers. Burulkan has a secondary education. As the main source of income for her family, Burulkan practices livestock breeding. She started this business 15 years ago, with an initial purchase of cattle in the amount of 8,000 som (KGS). Burulkan has practiced animal breeding over the course of many years. Her husband has actively helped her with this business. Thanks to Burulkan's hard work, she currently has 4 milk cows and 40 sheep on her farm. Her monthly income is 7,000 som (KGS). Burulkan is in the farming group "Kyzyl-Kiya." She is the second member of the group; There are two other members besides her. For the purpose of further developing her business, Burulkan turned to Microfinance Bank "Bai Tushum and Partners." She is requesting a loan in the amount of 65,000 som (KGS) to buy sheep and goats to increase the size of her herd. Burulkan plans to invest the earnings from the loan in the further acquisition of livestock. She also intends to save money to build a new house.

loans.use: to buy sheep and goats.

loans.name: Los Artesanos De Los Encuentros. Group

texts.es:
Doña Rosalva es  una señorita soltera de 38 años de edad, quien vive junto a sus padres en el Departamento de Sololá. Actualmente ella es la representante del Grupo Los Artesanos de los Encuentros y se encuentra ubicada en el centro de la fotografía.

Ella se dedica a la elaboración de pulseras, fajas y carteras,  que están fabricados  a base de mostacilla y lo realiza en el lugar de su domicilio. Eligió esta actividad porque no tuvo la oportunidad de estudiar por la falta de recursos económicos y es por ello que no puede obtar por un trabajo formal. Pero comenta que se siente feliz de realizar esta labor, ya que lleva cuatro años en esta actividad, en donde ha obtenido buenos ingresos y ganancias que le han ayudado a contribuir a la economía de su familia. 

Ahora ha decidió conformar un grupo para la elaboración de más artesanías,  con el fin de contribuir con sus familias en cuanto a su economía. Por lo cual están solicitando un préstamo para la compra de productos como mostacilla y otros artículos que se necesitan para la elaboración de la misma.

Su mayor sueño es incrementar sus ganancias a través de su negocio y así  tener un local en el mercado de su comunidad para que conozcan su trabajo y de esta  manera mejorar la economía de su familia.
texts.en:
Doña Rosalva is a single woman, age 38, who lives together with her parents in the Sololá district.  She is currently the representative of the Los Artesanos de los Encuentros group.  She can be seen in the center of the photo.

She works creating bracelets, belts, and wallets made with tiny beads.  She works from her home.  She chose this type of work because she didn’t have the opportunity to study, due to a lack of economic resources.  It is because of this that she can’t choose a conventional job. But she says that she is happy doing this work, because she has done it for four years, she earns a good income, and the earnings have helped her to contribute to the finances of her family.

Now she has decided to create a group to make more artisan crafts, with the goal of contributing to their families in terms of finances.  Because of this, they are asking for a loan for the purchase of products such as tiny beads and other items that are needed to make the crafts.

Her biggest dream is to increase her earnings through her business and thus to have a stand in the local market so that people get to know her work, and in this way to improve the finances of her family.

loans.use: to buy bead products for the production of artisan crafts.

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane is 32 years old and lives in the town of Kayunga in the region of Mukono in Uganda. She is married and has four children who are all currently in school. For the past 14 years, Jane has been working hard to manage her bar, which sells beer, soda, water, and local brew. 

To help expand her business, Jane has requested a loan of 2,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more goods, and it will help Jane to generate greater profits and expand her business. Jane hopes that in the future she will be able to produce quality products. 

Jane is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP). The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Jane who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to buy more goods.

loans.name: Victor Manuel

texts.es:
Víctor Manuel tiene 57 años de edad vive junto a su esposa e hija en el distrito de Zaña, su población se dedica a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería a dos horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo, costa norte del Perú.

Son una familia unida que se dedican a crianza y venta de animales menores, tienen una mototaxi que lo alquila para brindar servicio de transporte público, ha solicitado un préstamo de 2 000 nuevos soles para comprar una segunda moto para alquilarlo y de esta manera tener mayores ingresos para la familia.
texts.en:
Víctor Manuel, 27, lives with his wife and daughter in the Zaña district, two hours from the city of Chiclayo on the northern coast of Peru.  The people there make a living in agriculture, commerce, and ranching.

They're a close family that makes a living raising and selling small animals.  They have a motorcycle taxi they rent out to provide public transportation services.

Víctor Manuel has requested a loan for 2,000 nuevos soles [PEN] to buy a second motorcycle to rent out so he'll earn more income for the family.

loans.use: to buy a motorcycle taxi

loans.name: Luis Paulino

texts.es:
Luis Paulino tiene 52 años de edad, vive junto a su esposo en el distrito de Oyotun, su población se dedica a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería a dos horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo, costa norte del Perú.

Tiene un taller ubicado en su domicilio donde se dedica arreglar motores de vehículos, es conocido en la zona por la labor que realiza.

Ha solicitado un préstamo de 1 000 nuevos soles para comprar repuestos de motos, accesorios para vehículo y ofrecerlos a la venta en su taller y de esta manera generar mayores ingresos para su familia.
texts.en:
Luis Paulino is 52 years old.  He lives together with his wife in the Oyotun district. The people there work in agriculture, trade, and cattle.  It is two hours from the city of Chiclayo, on the north coast of Perú.

He has a workshop located in his home where he works fixing vehicle motors.  He is known throughout the area for the work that he does.

He has asked for a loan of 1000 nuevos soles to buy motorcycle parts and car accessories, to offer them for sale in his workshop.  In this way he can generate a larger income for his family.

loans.use: to buy spare parts for motorcycles and accessories for cars.

loans.name: Marcos

texts.es:
Marcos Es un hombre muy trabajador, todos los días trabaja como en su parcela de cultivo de yuca, ya que él se dedica a la agricultura ya que es su única fuente de ingresos para poder sacar adelante a sus familia, sobre porque es padre de 4 hijos de 13, 13, 9 y 1 añito.

Marcos esta agradecido con el apoyo que le han brindado el podrá comprar abono, fertilizantes, entre otros, de esta manera podrá mantener su cultivo y poder obtener una buena cosecha y poder hacer realidad su más grande sueño:” darle una profesión a sus hijos”.
texts.en:
Marcos is a very hardworking man.  Every day he works on his plot of land cultivating cassava. He works in agriculture because it is the only source of income to be able to get his family ahead, above all because he is the father of four children, ages 13, 13, 9 and 1.

Marcos is grateful for the support that has been given to him.  He will be able to buy soil amendments and fertilizers, among other things.  In this way, he will be able to maintain his crop and can get a better harvest.  He can make his biggest dream a reality: to give his children a profession.

loans.use: to buy soil amendments and fertilizers, among other things.

loans.name: Kun

texts.en:
Kun is 63 years old and a widower with one child.  As a single father who supports his child alone, he grows rice and raises pigs as the core income business. This returns him about 34,000 KHR per day. 

Kun is a first-time borrower with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). He is seeking 2,200,000 KHR to buy pig feed and more piglets for raising. He hopes that he can grow and fatten his pigs in a healthy condition so that he can sell them at a good price. In this way, he can upgrade his business as well as his living condition.

loans.use: To buy pig feed and more piglets for raising.
