location.town: Kampong Cham province, Cheung Prey district

loans.name: Heab

texts.en:
Heab is 29 years old and blessed with one kid. She lives in the Ponhea Krek district, Kampong Cham province, where she does her agribusiness of cassava farming and growing rubber tree seedlings. This is the business that she has had for several years.  

This is the second microloan for Heab with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). She has fully repaid back her past loan wisely to upgrade her lifestyle better than before. Now, she is seeking 2,500,000 KHR [Cambodian riels] in order to buy fertilizer for her crop. She hopes that she can make more income, better than before.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer for her crop

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Ponhea Krek district

loans.name: Mao's Group

texts.en:
Mao, 40, is married with two children. She is residing in a rural village of the Moung Russey district of Battambang province. Both of her children are dependents and still in school. To support the family, she has been farming rice, and sometimes, her husband works as a paid worker. The current business earns them about 36,000 KHR [Cambodian riels] per day to meet the family’s needs.

Mao just began with VisionFund for this loan cycle. Now she is leading her group to ask for a loan. As the leader, Mao is going to use her portion to buy fertilizers and pesticides for her farmland. She hopes to make more rice to increase her family’s income to make a better living.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and pesticides for her farmland.

loans.name: Chreb

texts.en:
Chreb is 44 years old and has three kids who are in school. She strives for a living via rice farming and sells duck eggs. She has been involved in the current business for several years. 

With VisionFund (Kiva’s partner), she is in the first loan cycle, and is seeking an education loan to pay the school fee for her daughter. She hopes that her daughter can get a job after she graduates.

loans.use: To pay the school fee for her daughter.

loans.name: Edna

texts.en:
Edna works hard to support her family. Edna is married and has a food-vending business in the Philippines.

Edna requested a 9,000 PHP [Philippines pesos] loan through NWTF to purchase ingredients like spices, vegetables, seasoning, meat, etc., for her business.

Edna has been in this business for 10 years now.

Edna would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase ingredients like spices, vegetables, seasoning, meat, etc., for her business

loans.name: Armen

texts.en:
Armen is from Vanadzor town. He has been providing shooting services for different ceremonies (weddings, birthdays, etc.) for already five years. Besides shooting, Armen is also providing mounting and editing work of videos. People usually use Armen's service since he is very attentive and skilled in the service he provides. 

Now, this hardworking young man needs financial support for being able to purchase tools for providing better quality service. The tools that he owns are too old and need to be changed. He has now been approved for a loan within the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF international. The start-up loan program provides business start-up loans with soft conditions to informal businesses that do not have access to credit products. The loan will be a hug support for Armen, as he will be able to continue his business and will be able to sustain his family's living. 

Armen lives with his wife, mother and grandmother, and is the only breadwinner of the family.

loans.use: to pay for tools for providing shooting services for different ceremonies (weddings, birthdays, etc.).

loans.name: Ana

texts.en: Ana is 53 years old and married with two children. She works hard to provide for her family. Ana runs a general store in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 5,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries to sell. Ana has been running the general store for seven years and also earns an income from farming rice. Ana hopes to save money to further expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Wilfreda

texts.en:
Wilfred, 48, is a married woman with five children. Three are still in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. 

Wilfreda has a business selling silver jewelry in the Philippines. Wilfreda has been in this business for four years.

She requested a PHP 19,000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase more silver jewelry to sell to her customers. In the future, Wilfreda would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more silver jewelry to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Sitsope Group

texts.fr: SITSOPE est un groupe de 29 femmes dynamiques qui mènent de diverses activités génératrices de revenus dans le quartier de Bè à Lomé. Agée de 33 ans, Clémentine responsable du groupe est une femme mariée avec 2 enfants en charge. Depuis 2006 elle a démarrée son activité par  la vente du sel dans son quartier. Actuellement elle se focalise  dans la vente des épices et s'approvisionne au grand marché de Lomé deux fois par semaine compte tenu de la faiblesse de son fonds de roulement. Elle souhaite augmenter son stock et sollicite ce crédit pour s approvisionner en produits  de première nécessité ce qui lui permettra d'augmenter son fonds de roulement et diminuer sa fréquence d'approvisionnement.
texts.en:
SITSOPE is a group of 29 dynamic women who conduct various income-generating activities in the district of Bè, in Lomé. Clémentine, age 33, is the member who is responsible for the group. She is married with two dependent children. 

She started her activity in 2006 selling salt in her neighborhood. Nowadays, she sells spices and buys her stock at the Grand market of Lomé twice a week due to her modest working capital. She would like to increase her stock. 

She is seeking this loan to stock up on staples, which will allow her to bolster her working capital and cut down on the need to replenish her stock too frequently.

loans.use: to buy two bags of salt.

loans.name: Chanthan

texts.en:
Living in a rural area located in Kampong Cham province’s Srey Sonthor district, Chanthan, 45, has five children in total. Chanthan and her husband are rice farmers, and they also grow cassava to earn additional income. The current business earns her about US$4 per day to support the family. 

Chanthan just began with VisionFund for this loan cycle. Now, she is applying for an education loan to pay for her son’s university tuition fee. She hopes this loan will enable her to send and keep her son in university, and she hopes that her child will have a good and bright future from his academic studies and make a better living in the future.

loans.use: to send and keep her son in university.

loans.name: Echo De Miniere 1, 2, 3 & 4 Group

texts.fr:
Smith est  le coordonateur de son groupe Echo de Miniere 1, 2, 3 & 4.  Il  n´est pas marie et il a  2 enfants. Il habite dans la region nord  d´Haïti de électricité est rare et de L´eau portable est très limité. Il dirige son commerce de produit divers pendants les 5 derniers années

Avant de ce commencer ce commerce il était Etudiant. Il espère que cet emprunt l’aidera à grandir son commerce. Des autres membres de Echo de Miniere 1, 2, 3 & 4 ont besoin d’un  emprunt pour le commerce tel que ventes produits cosmétiques, boissons gazeuses, boisson, pépé, chabon, produit alimentaires, etc. 

Il dit son but principal c’est d’avoir un plus grand commerce qui lui facilitera a voyager dans les autres pays.
texts.en:
Smith is the coordinator of his group Echo de Miniere 1, 2, 3 & 4. He is not married and he has 2 children. He lives in the northern region of Haiti where electricity is rare and drinkable water is scarce. He has been managing his business selling a variety of products for the last 5 years.

Before starting this business he was a student. He hopes that this loan will help him to expand his business. Other members of Echo de Miniere 1, 2, 3 & 4 need a loan for businesses such as selling cosmetics, soft drinks, drinks, pépé (secondhand American clothes), charcoal, foodstuffs, etc.

He says that his main goal is to have a bigger business which will make it easier for him to travel to other countries.

loans.use: to buy a variety of products such as shoes, cosmetics, etc.

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en:
Sarah is 26 years old and lives in the town of Lugazi in the  region of Mukono in Uganda. She has two children who are both currently in school. For the past five years, Sarah has been working hard to manage her produce business, which makes flour used for posho or porridge. 

To help expand her business, Sarah has requested a loan of 2,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more maize grains to increase stock, and will help Sarah to generate greater profits and increased income. Sarah hopes that in the future, she will be able to be self-reliant. 

Sarah is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP). The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Sarah who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to buy more maize grains to increase stock for making flour.

loans.name: Fred

texts.en:
Fred is 47 years old and lives in the town of Kayunga which lies in the region of Mukono in Uganda. He is married and has 5 children who are all currently in school. For the past 3 years, Fred has been working hard to manage his retail shop, which sells beans, maize flour, and rice.
To help expand his business, Fred has requested a loan of 2,500,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more household goods, and will help Fred to generate greater profits and allow for business expansion. Fred hopes that in the future he will be able to stock more quality products.
Fred is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP). The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Fred who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to buy more household goods.

loans.name: Melodie

texts.en:
Melodie wants to work in any business company in the future. She studied BS- Business Administration in Misamis University, Ozamiz City. 

In her previous semester, she borrowed a loan from GDMPC for her tuition fee. She is in her last year of her course and recently borrowed another loan to pay for the second semester school tuition fees. 

She hopes to have a better career in the future to be able to support her parents and siblings.

loans.use: to pay for the second semester school tuition fees.

loans.name: Apu Tiuno Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “APU TIUNO”; Este banco se ubicado en la comunidad de Collana, distrito de Livitaca, provincia de Chumbivilcas departamento de Cusco.

El socio es Genuario, el tiene 44 años de edad es casado, el socio altera sus actividades diarias dedicándose a la crianza y engorde de ganados, el socio lleva buen tiempo dedicándose a esta actividad el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su negocio, él socio cría a estos animales para luego venderlos a sus clientes que le solicitan, él socio es una persona responsable y empeñosa siendo de esta forma que el socio saca adelante a su familia.

El socio solicita el crédito para la construcción de un establo para sus animales.

Los otros socios se dedican a la ganadería, venta de bebidas y venta de lacteos.

La persona que sale con la cara tapada no pertenece al banco comunal.

El socio agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete  a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
These members are part of the “APU TIUNO” communal bank, located in the Collana community, within the Livitace district, in the Chumbivilcas province, and Cusco department.

Genuario is 44 years old, married, and raises livestock.  Things are going well for him, thanks to the daily effort he puts into his work,  and he has been doing this for some time.  He raises his animals and then sells them to his customers who request them.  He is a responsible, hardworking person and this is how he gets his family ahead.

He is asking for this loan to build a stable for his animals.

He is grateful to those who form part of this dream and is committed to making his payments on time.

The rest of the members raise livestock, sell drinks, and dairy.

The person with his face covered is not a member of this group.

loans.use: to build a stable.

location.town: comunidad de Collana / Distrito de Livitaca

loans.name: Anabel

texts.en:
This is Anabel. She previously accessed a 50,000 PHP loan that she used to purchase more quantities and varieties of grocery items and products needed in her business. Her earnings were a big help for her children’s education and in their personal, household and business expenditures. She would like to apply for another 50,000 PHP loan for her to buy groceries, toiletries, beverages and other products to add in her inventory. The more items displayed at the store, the better. More items to sell will result in better profit. Her profits from business will definitely help sustain her family’s daily needs and her children’s educational expense. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart. Anabel dreams that her business will grow bigger and hopes to have a better living. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business every week and draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the word of God she studies.

All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners who gather each week to study the word of God, build social capital, and repay micr finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for grocery items, toiletries and beverages needed in her business.

loans.name: Evangeline

texts.en:
Evangeline is a married woman with five children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Evangeline is 41 years old and has two children who are still in school.

Evangeline makes abaca fiber in the Philippines. Evangeline requested a 6,500 PHP [Philippines pesos] loan amount through NWTF to buy additional raw materials for her business.

Evangeline has been in this business for five years. In the future, Evangeline would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional raw materials for her business of making abaca fiber.

loans.name: Febei

texts.en:
Febei is 24 years old and is married with two children, one of whom is in school. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. 

Febei has a rice retailing business in the Philippines. She has requested a loan of 10,000 PHP through NWTF in order to purchase more stocks of rice to sell.

Febei has been in this business for two years. In the future, she would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more stocks of rice to sell.

loans.name: Venancia

texts.en:
Venancia is 45 years old, married, and has three children who are in school.

Venancia is in the agricultural business, fattening pigs in the Philippines. She has been pig fattening for four years now, and she has borrowed 10 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

Venancia requested a PHP 9,500 loan through NWTF to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

In the future, Venancia would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to higher education.

loans.use: to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Mary Grace

texts.en:
Mary Grace is 32 years old, married, and has one child.

Mary Grace works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 5,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase additional groceries to sell.

She has been running the general store for seven years and also earns an income from farming rice.

Mary Grace aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional groceries to sell.

loans.name: Ignacia

texts.en:
Ignacia works hard to support her family. She is married and has a vegetable vending business in the Philippines.
Ignacia requested a PHP 5000 loan through NWTF to buy more vegetables to sell in her vegetable stall.
Ignacia has been in this business for 6 years now.
Ignacia would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more vegetables to sell in her vegetable stall.

loans.name: Ralisatou Group

texts.fr:
Mme RAMATOU est responsable du groupe RALISATOU. Mariée, elle est mère de 03enfants. Le plus âgé a 11ans et le moins âgé a 02ans. 02 vont à l’école. Elle a 06personnes  en charge.
Mme vend des habits depuis 04ans. Elle s’approvisionne dans les marchés  de la ville. Ses clients sont les hommes et femmes.
Elle veut s’acheter  12douzaines d’habit.
Mme veut  réinvestir  ses bénéfices dans son activité. Elle ambitionne agrandir l’activité et assurer l’avenir des enfants.
texts.en:
Mrs. RAMATOU is responsible for the group RALISATOU. She is the married mother of three children aged 2 to 11, two of whom go to school. She supports six people. 

Mrs. Ramatou has been selling clothing for four years. She buys her stock at the local markets, and her customer base consists of men and women.

She plans to buy 12 dozen pieces of clothing. She wants to reinvest her profits in her activity. Her goals are to expand her business and provide for her children’s future.

loans.use: to buy 12 dozen pieces of clothing.

loans.name: Silvia Aracely

texts.es:
Silvia de 45 años de edad, es una persona casada; pero no esta  junto a su esposo, estudio hasta noveno grado.  Silvia se levanta a las 5:00 a.m. Junto a sus hija, juntas se dedican a actividades comerciales para llevarle el sustento a su casa.

Silvia  se dedica a la elaboración de comida típica, oficio que aprendió de su madre; que comercializa en  su residencia y en los  alrededores lo hace su hija hoy en día.

El préstamo que esta solicitando, es para comprar dos vacas que le venden para producir leche y elaborar queso y ofrecerlos a los cliente que llegar a comprar a su negocio, lo que incrementara sus ingresos para el sustento. 

En un futuro desea instalar, una tienda en su vivienda lo que ayudaria a mejorar los ingresos y poder tener una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Silvia, 45, is married but isn't with her husband.  She studied to ninth grade.  Silvia gets up at 5 a.m.

Silvia and her daughter are engaged in commercial activities so they can support the household.  Silvia makes traditional food, a job she learned from her mother.  She sells her food in her home and the surrounding areas.  Her daughter does this now.

The loan Silvia's requesting is to buy two cows to produce milk to make cheese that she'll sell to the customers who shop in her business.  This will increase her income to support herself.

In the future she wants to set up a store in her home to help improve her income and have a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy two cows to produce milk for making cheese

loans.name: Sambath

texts.en:
Sambath, 41, lives with her husband and three children in a village of Kampong Cham province’s Ponhea Krek district, Cambodia. To make a living, she and her husband have been farming rice, raising pigs and distilling alcohol for almost 20 years. She and her husband can earn about US$16 per day to meet the family’s needs.
 
Sambath just began with Kiva’s partner, VisionFund, for this loan cycle. Now, she is seeking a loan to spend on paying the tuition fee for son to study vocational training. She hopes that her son will have a special skill for a long-term income that will support the family.

loans.use: to pay the tuition fee for her son.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Ponhea Krek district

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To build his own house.

loans.name: Vanny

texts.en:
Age 40 and a mother of three children residing in Kandal province, Vanny is a local farmer who grows maize as the main source of income. It is the business that she has had for several years. To earn additional income, her husband catches fish to sell.

Vanny is a first-cycle client with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). She is seeking an education loan to cover the tuition fee for her son, who wants to pursue a bachelor's degree in English literature. She hopes that, with the loan, her son can pay more attention to his study without worrying about the financial burden for his study.

loans.use: to cover the tuition fee for her son.

loans.name: Koeun's Group

texts.en: Koeun is 48 years old and blessed with four children. For the sake of her family, she grows vegetables as the main source of income. The business that she has been with for ages earns her about 27,000 KHR per day. Koeun is a repeat borrower with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). As the leader, she will spend her entire loan portion to buy garlic chives and banana trees to earn additional income. She hopes that she can earn an even better income from her business.

loans.use: to buy garlic chives and banana trees for growing more produce.

loans.name: Equilibre De Ouanaminthe 1, 2, 3, 4 & 5 Group

texts.fr:
Marielourdes est le coordinatrice de son groupe Equilibre de Oaunaminthe. Elle est mariée elle a un enfant. Elle habite dans la région nord est d`Haïti ou de électricité n’est rare et de l’eau portable n’est très limite. Elle dirige son commerce de vente de produits alimentaire pendants les 10 dernières années. Elle espère que cet emprunt l’aidera a grandir son commerce.

Des autres membres Equilibre de Oaunaminthe 1, 2, 3, 4 & 5 ont besoin d’un emprunt pour le commerce tel ques ventes produits de cosmétiques, boissons gazeuses etc. Elle déclare que son défi principal est de devenir une plus grande commerçante dans le département du nord est. Elle dit son but principal c’est d’avoir un grand commerce qui lui facilitera a construire une grande maison avec l’aide d’Esperanza Int.
texts.en:
Marielourdes is the coordinator of her group Equilibre de Oaunaminthe. She is married and has a child. She lives in the northeastern region of Haiti where electricity is rare and drinkable water is scarce. She has been managing her business selling foodstuffs for the last 10 years. She hopes that this loan will help her to expand her business.

The other members of the group Equilibre de Oaunaminthe 1, 2, 3, 4 & 5 need a loan for businesses such as selling cosmetics, soft drinks, etc. She says that her main challenge is to become a bigger shopkeeper in the northeastern department. She says that her main goal is to have a large business which will make it easier for her to build a large house with the help of Esperanza Int.

loans.use: to buy foodstuffs.

loans.name: Lita

texts.en:
Lita is a native woman from the town of Ubay, Bohol. She earns a living by raising and selling hogs. Her business started more than two years ago. 

She is asking for a loan to buy additional pigs and feed to improve the quality of the pigs so that they can grow healthy and be sold on time.

In the future, Lita hopes to expand her hog-raising business and increase its profitability for her children’s education.

loans.use: to buy additional pigs and feed.

loans.name: Raul

texts.en:
Raul is a married man from the town of Ubay, Bohol. He is a father of 3 young children. He earns a living by selling dried fish. He started his business quite a few years ago. He is asking for a loan to buy more fresh fish to be dried in order to sell. The profits will be used for food for the family.
In the future, Raul hopes to expand his business and increase business profitability for his children’s education.

loans.use: to buy more fresh fish to be dried.

loans.name: Sophia

texts.en:
Sophia is 30 years old and lives in the town of Mukono, which lies in the region of Mukono in Uganda. She is married and has 2 children who are currently in school. For the past 3 years, Sophia has been working hard to manage her boutique, which sells clothes, shoes, and bags.
To help expand her business, Sophia has requested a loan of 2,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more stock, and will help Sophia to generate greater profits and educate her children. Sophia hopes that in the future she will be able to grow her business even larger.
Sophia is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP). The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Sophia who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to buy more stock for her boutique.

loans.name: Angela

texts.en:
This is Angela, 63, a resident of Tondo, Manila, Philippines. She is married to Quintelo, a driver, and they have children. She and her husband manage their household while operating the business. She is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Angela operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a variety store is a retail store that sells inexpensive items, often with a single price for all items in the store. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, 5 PHP-worth of cooking oil, or an egg. She earns by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling by the piece. She also sells burger for additional income. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of 500 PHP in sales every day.

She is requesting a 15,000 PHP loan to help her continue in the operation of her business. She will use the loan to buy groceries, toiletries and beverages to expand her product inventory.

Angela hopes that her business will continue to flourish and dreams that her youngest child will finish his studies.  She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God she studies.

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay micro-finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for grocery items, toiletries and beverages needed in her business.

loans.name: Edna

texts.en:
This is Edna. She previously accessed a 10,000 PHP loan that she used to buy more quantities of products such as meats, rice, vegetables, condiments and seasonings. Her earnings were a big help for the education of her child and in their personal, household and business expenditures.
She would like to apply for another 10,000 PHP loan to purchase raw ingredients and supplies needed in her business. Her profits from the business will definitely help her to sustain her daily needs and educational expenses of her child. She looks forward to this financial stability with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.
Edna dreams that her business will grow larger and hopes they will soon have their own house. She meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for raw ingredients and other products needed in her business.

loans.name: Iyubare Group

texts.fr:
Léonard  fait partie du groupe  Iyubare   et  habite à Gitega. Il  a 36 ans et est marié à Rose. Ensemble ils ont  5 enfants âgés  de  18 mois à  11 ans,dont 2 étudient.

Il fait le commerce des oignons  depuis 5 ans. 

C’est son premier   crédit à Turame. Avec le crédit KIVA qu’il  obtient, il va  augmenter son capital et acheter beaucoup d’oignons   à revendre pour gagner plus. 

Dans les prochaines  années, il voudrait  acheter des lopins de terres  et voir ses enfants  étudier.
texts.en:
Léonard is part of the group Iyubare and lives in Gitega. He is 36 years old and married to Rose. Together they have five children, from 18 months to 11 years old, of whom two are students. 

Léonard has been doing commerce in onions for five years. 

This is his first Turame loan. With the KIVA loan he is obtaining, he is going to increase his capital and purchase a lot of onions to resell, so as to earn more. 

In the coming years, he would like to purchase a plot of land and see his children educated.

loans.use: to purchase a lot of onions to resell, so as to earn more

loans.name: Humura Group

texts.fr:
Keziah fait partie du groupe  Huruma  et  habite à Bujumbura. Elle a 28 ans et est mariée à Elie. Ensemble ils ont 1 enfant  de 4ans, qui étudie.
 
Elle fait le commerce d’huile de palme  depuis 2 ans. 

Elle est à son cinquième  crédit à Turame. Avec le crédit KIVA qu’elle obtient, elle va  augmenter son capital et acheter une grande quantité d’huile de palme  à revendre pour gagner plus. 

Dans les prochaines  années, elle voudrait acheter une parcelle  et voir ses enfants continuer les études.
texts.en:
Keziah is part of the group Huruma and lives in Bujumbura. She is 28 years old and is married to Elie. Together they have one 4-year old child, who goes to school.

She has been selling palm oil for 2 years.

She is on her fifth loan with Turame. With the Kiva loan that she receives, she is going to increase her capital and buy a large quantity of palm oil to resell to make more.

In the coming years, she would like to buy a plot of land and see her children continue their studies.

loans.use: to increase her capital and buy a large quantity of palm oil to resell to make more.

loans.name: Muyange Group

texts.fr:
Charles  fait partie du groupe  Muyange  et  habite à Cibitoke. Il  a 46 ans et est marié à Julienne. Ensemble ils ont 4 enfants âgés  de  7 à  14 ans,dont 3 étudient.
Il a sous sa charge un enfant membre de la famille élargie, qui étudie.

Il fait le commerce de tomates     depuis 10 ans. 

C’est son premier crédit à Turame. Avec le crédit KIVA qu’il obtient, il  va  augmenter son capital et acheter beaucoup de tomates  à revendre pour gagner plus. 

Dans les prochaines  années, il voudrait  renouveler sa  maison et voir ses enfants  étudier.
texts.en:
Charles is part of the group Muyange and lives in Cibitoke. He is 46 years old and married to Julienne. Together they have four children, from 7 to 14 years old, of whom three are students. 

Charles has been doing commerce in tomatoes for ten years. 

This is his first Turame loan. With the KIVA loan he is obtaining, he is going to increase his capital and purchase a lot of tomatoes to resell, so as to earn more. 

In the coming years, he would like to renovate his house and see his children educated.

loans.use: to purchase a lot of tomatoes to resell, so as to earn more

loans.name: Francine

texts.en: Francine is 31 years old. She is married with four children and has been selling sorghum and bananas. With the loan, she would like to buy stock of maize and beans. She plans to save the profits to provide a better future.

loans.use: to buy stock of maize and beans.

loans.name: Tujijuke Group

texts.fr:
Fidès  fait partie du groupe  Tujijuke  et  habite à Bujumbura. Elle  a 35 ans et est mariée à Mossi. Ensemble ils ont 4 enfants âgés  de  3 à  20 ans, dont 3 étudient.

Elle fait le commerce de chaussures et des habits  depuis 5 ans. 

Elle est à son huitième  crédit à Turame. Avec le crédit KIVA qu’elle  obtient, elle  va  augmenter son capital et acheter beaucoup de paires de chaussures(200 paires)   à revendre pour gagner plus. 

Dans les prochaines  années, elle voudrait  acheter une parcelle et voir ses enfants  étudier.
texts.en:
Fidès is part of the group Tujijuke and lives in Bujumbura. She is 35 years old and married to Mossi. Together they have four children, from 3 to 20 years old, of whom three are students. 

Fidès has been doing commerce in shoes and clothing for five years. 

She is on her eighth Turame loan. With the KIVA loan she is obtaining, she is going to increase her capital and purchase many pairs of shoes (200 pairs) to resell, so as to earn more. 

In the coming years, she would like to purchase a plot of land and see her children educated.

loans.use: to purchase many pairs of shoes (200 pairs) to resell, so as to earn more

loans.name: Isidra

texts.en:
As a married parent of three children, Isidra works hard to support her family.
She has a food vending business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from a general store. Isidra is borrowing PHP 9,000 through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food vending business.
Isidra has been sustaining her business activities through her past 4 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food vending business.

loans.name: Vahram

texts.en: Vahram lives in Vanadzor with his mother. For the past six months, Vahram has worked as a taxi driver using his own car. He mainly drives in Vanadzor but sometimes also receives long distance fares. Despite his young age, Vahram is a good driver and has a lot of customers. They prefer to use Vahram's taxi because he drives very attentively and carefully. Vahram has applied for a loan to be able to remodel his taxi; the car is seriously damaged and Vahram isn't able to use it as a taxi at present. He has been approved for a loan within the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF International. The start-up loan program provides business start-up loans with soft conditions to informal businesses that do not have access to credit products. The loan will greatly assist Vahram by allowing him to continue working and gathering income for his family.

loans.use: to pay to remodel his taxi.

loans.name: María Milagro

texts.es:
Doña María de 35 años de edad, es  una señora muy trabajadora a pesar de que falta su compañero de vida, eso no le impide para ir superando, obstáculo tras obstáculo en la vida. Actualmente, vive solo con sus 3 hijos de edades 8, 11 y 13 años, ellos estudian en la escuela del cantón y ayudan en los quehaceres de la agricultura.

Doña  María de dedica a los quehaceres de la casa y además cultiva 7,000 metros cuadrados de frijol, ya que le ayudan sus hijos para el manejo del cultivo. Dicha actividad la aprendió de sus padres y la perfeccionó junto con su compañero de vida.

Con el préstamo se estará ayudando a María, para que pueda pagar la mano de obra, para lo que es, la recolección de los frijoles, ya que el tiempo está muy copioso con la lluvias y es muy riesgoso dejarlo mucho tiempo sin cosechar.

María quiere seguir trabajando en la agricultura, junto con sus hijos; pero además, quiere que sus hijos tengan una carrera universitaria.
texts.en: María, 35 years old, works very hard despite the death of her life partner. She still manages to overcome the obstacles life puts in her path. She lives alone with her three children, aged 8, 11, and 13. They go to school in the area and help her with small agricultural tasks. María takes care of her household and also grows broad beans on a plot of land of 7,000 square metres. Her children help her with this task. She learned agriculture from her parents and became an expert thanks to her life partner. With the loan, María will be able to hire people to help with the harvest, since the weather is very rainy and it would be risky to leave the produce in the open for much longer. María wants to keep being a farmer, and she appreciates her children's help. However, she also wishes for them to become university graduates.

loans.use: to hire people to help with the harvest.

loans.name: Dieu Seul Maitre De Savanne De Gras Group

texts.fr:
Daniel est le coordinateur de son groupe Dieu Seul Maitre de Sabanne de Gras. Il n'est pas  marié, Il  a 2  enfants. Il  habite dans la région nord  d`Haïti ou de électricité est rare et de l’eau portable est très limitee. Il dirige son commerce d'artisans depuis plus de 4 ans.
                                        

Avant de ce commercer ce commerce Il était  un professeur. Il  espère que cet emprunt l’aidera a grandir son commerce. Des autres membres de  dieu suel maitre  ont besoin d’un emprunt pour le commerce tel ques ventes produits de  cosmétiques, boissons gazeuses etc.

 Il déclare que son défi principal est de devenir un  grand commerçant  dans le département du nord, Il dit son but principal c’est d’avoir un grand commerce qui lui facilitera  a construire une  grande maison avec l’aide  d’Esperanza Int.
texts.en:
Daniel is the coordinator of his group Dieu Seul Maitre de Sabanne de Gras. He is not married. He has 2 children. He lives in the northern region of Haiti where electricity is rare and drinking water is scarce. He has been managing his business selling arts and crafts for more than 4 years.

Before starting this business he was a teacher. He hopes that this loan will help him to expand his business. Other members of Dieu Seul Maitre need a loan for businesses such as selling cosmetics, soft drinks, etc.

He says that his main challenge is becoming a great shopkeeper in the northern Department. He says that his main goal is to have a large business which will make it easier for him to build a large house with the help of Esperanza Int.

loans.use: to buy materials for arts and crafts.

loans.name: Omar

texts.fr:
Monsieur Omar, marié à deux femmes est père de huit enfants dont l’ainé est âgé de 22 ans et le cadet 7 mois. Omar s’active dans l’élevage où il a acquis une expérience de plus de 10 ans. Il fait de l’embouche bovine et a aménagé un espace dans sa maison. Il vient pour la première fois solliciter un crédit de 400.000 FCFA pour acheter deux bœufs et de l’aliment bétail. 
Omar s’occupe de la dépense quotidienne de sa famille. Dans les champs, il est aidé par son fils ainé.
Pour maximiser son profit, Omar a besoin de diversifier ses activités, pour cela il aimerait ouvrir une boutique d’alimentation générale c’est cela son vœu le plus cher.
texts.en:
Omar has two wives and is the father of eight children, the eldest of whom is 22 and the youngest seven months. 

Omar raises livestock and has more than ten years’ experience in this area. He fattens cattle and has also prepared an area in his house for business purposes. He is requesting this first loan of 400 000 CFA francs to buy two head of cattle and cattle feed.

Omar provides for his family’s daily expenses. His eldest son helps him in the fields.

To maximise his profit, Omar needs to diversify his activities. In order to do this, he would like to open a general food store - this is his greatest wish.

loans.use: to buy two head of cattle and cattle feed to fatten them, in order to resell them

loans.name: Rosalino

texts.en:
Rosalino operates a service-based business providing transportation in the community, which he has been doing for more than six years. He earns a good income to provide for their daily living.  His previous loan from GDMPC was used for motor registration and was successfully repaid. He always find ways to extend better service to his costumers. 

Rosalino is requesting another loan, which he will use to buy spare parts for repair and maintenance to improve his services.  He plans to use his revenue to acquire another motorcycle for expansion of business.

loans.use: to purchase spare parts for repair and maintenance

loans.name: Arame

texts.fr:
Madame Arame, une dame de 39 ans, évolue dans le secteur de la couture cela fait maintenant cinq ans. Elle est mariée et mère de 5 enfants dont l’ainé est âgée de 25 ans. Elle habite dans un village situé dans l’arrondissement la plus vaste de la ville principale. Entre la maison de son père et celle de son mari, il ne faut que trois minutes maximum de marche ; ce qui est un grand avantage pour elle car son atelier se trouve chez ses parents. Elle travaille le matin de 8 heures jusqu’à 14 heures et l’après midi, de 16 heures à 19 heures. L’atelier  sert de confection mais aussi de vente de tissus. Vu que la zone est enclavée, Arame a eu l’idée de vendre des tissus en même temps : acheter pour coudre sur place.
Grâce aux bénéfices, elle appuie son mari dans la gestion de la dépense quotidienne, paye la scolarité de ses enfants et  peut améliorer les conditions alimentaires de la famille.
Elle rêve d’avoir sa propre maison un jour.
texts.en:
Arame is 39 years old and has been running a sewing business for five years now. She is married and the mother of five children, the eldest of whom is 25 years old. 

Arame lives in a village in the largest district of the main town. Her father’s house is just a three-minute walk away from her husband’s house, which is a great advantage as her workshop is at her parent’s house. 

Arame works from 8am to 2pm in the morning and 4pm to 7pm in the afternoon. As well as using her workshop for sewing, she sells cloth. As the area is isolated, Arame had the idea of selling cloth at the same time, so people can buy it and have it made up on site.

Thanks to her earnings, Arame is able to support her husband with daily expenses, pay her children’s school fees and improve her family’s diet. She dreams of one day having her own home.

loans.use: to buy cloth to sew and resell.

loans.name: Michel

texts.fr: Monsieur  Michel est commerçant de profession qui habite dans un village de la région. Il a 02 ateliers au niveau de la ville de Thiès et évolue dans la commercialisation des pièces détachés et des moteurs d’occasion. Il a une expérience de plus de 15ans dans cette activité. Il pratique aussi de la maraichère dans son village. Il demande ce montant pour renforcer son fond de roulement et diversifier son activité afin de pouvoir augmenter ses revenus et améliorer les conditions de vie de la famille. IL souhaite aussi ouvrir un autre magasin de pièces détachées.
texts.en: Mr. Michel is a merchant by trade and lives in a village in the region. He has two workshops in the city of Thiès and has been working in the commerce of spare parts and used motors. He has over fifteen years of experience in this business. He also has a market garden in his village. He is asking for this amount of money to bolster his working capital and to diversify his business, so as to be able to increase his revenues and improve his family's living conditions. He would also like to open another store for spare parts.

loans.use: to purchase spare parts to resell

loans.name: Bonifride

texts.en: Bonifride is 36 years old. She has two children and they all go to school. She is planning to buy more sodas and beers for sale using the loan that she is requesting. The profits from the business will be used to provide food for her family.

loans.use: To buy more sodas and beers for sale.

loans.name: Librada

texts.en: Librada is 58 years old and single. She runs a pig-raising business in the Philippines. Librada has requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to purchase feed, vitamins and vaccines for her pigs. Librada has been raising pigs for three years now and has borrowed five times from NWTF to sustain her business. Librada would like to expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase feed, vitamins and vaccines for her pigs.

loans.name: Khim

texts.en:
Khim, a 43-year-old mother of two, lives in a rural village of the Borset district  where she and her husband have been farming rice for 25 years; her husband earns additional income as a construction worker. The current business earns them US$11 per day to support the family. 

This will be Khim's fourth micro loan with VisionFund. Her past loans, all repaid, helped her relieve the family's financial burden and improve their livelihood. Khim has requested this loan to pay for her daughter’s university tuition fees. She hopes it will help her daughter to stay in university until graduation.

loans.use: to pay for her daughter’s university tuition fees

loans.name: José Elías

texts.es:
José de 45 años de edad, es una persona que solo estudio hasta noveno grado, es casado, su esposa se dedica a los oficios domésticos. Se levanta a las 5:00 a.m. Junto a su esposa e hijo que estudia bachillerato,  quienes dependen de las actividades que él realiza.

 José  se dedica a la agricultura oficio que aprendió de sus padres,  para llegar a la parcelas camina 1 Km  y trabaja, mientras a su esposa se dedica a los oficios domésticos y luego en el transcurso de la tarde se dedica a trabajar en una ladrillera elaborando ladrillo, tejas, etc.

El préstamo que esta solicitando a Fundación Campo, es para  comprar una vaca lechera y poder  producir  leche para para la venta y así obtener más ingresos para el sustento de su familia.


 José planea poner un negocio de ladrillera, ya que conoce muy bien y siente que es un buen ingreso el que obtendría.
texts.en: José is 45 and never studied further than ninth form. He is married, and his wife tends to the household. He wakes up at 5 am every day. He has two dependents: his wife, and his son, who goes to school. José learned agriculture from his parents. He walks one kilometre every morning in order to get to his plot of land. In the afternoon he works for a brickmaker, making bricks, roof tiles, etc. He asks for a loan in order to buy a milk cow. He wants to sell the milk in order to earn more money with which to support his family. His goal is to set up his own brickmaker business, since he knows the trade very well and feels he would be able to derive a good income from it.

loans.use: to buy a milk cow.

loans.name: Kenyera Group

texts.fr:
Gloriose fait partie du groupe  Kenyera et  habite à Gitega. C’est une veuve de 44 ans .Elle a 3 enfants.

Elle fait le commerce de  bananes  depuis 10 ans. 

C’est son premier crédit à Turame. Avec le crédit KIVA qu’elle obtient, elle  va  augmenter son capital et acheter une grande quantité de bananes à revendre pour gagner plus.
texts.en:
Gloriose is part of the group Kenyera and lives in Gitega. She is a 44-year-old widow with three children.

Gloriose has been doing commerce in bananas for ten years. 

This is her first Turame loan. With the KIVA loan she is obtaining, she is going to increase her capital and purchase a lot of bananas to resell, so as to earn more.

loans.use: to purchase a lot of bananas to resell, so as to earn more

loans.name: Mugorore Group

texts.fr:
J. Claude fait partie du groupe  Mugorore et  habite à Cibitoke. Il  a 30 ans et est marié à Emelyne. Ensemble ils  ont 4 enfants  âgés de 3 à 10 ans dont 2 étudient.
 
Il fait le commerce de boutique et de bière  de banane  depuis 10 ans. 

C’est son premier crédit à Turame. Avec le crédit KIVA qu’il obtient, il  va  augmenter son capital et acheter une grande quantité de bananes pour produire beaucoup de litres  bière de banane et 75 kg de haricot, à revendre pour gagner plus. 

Dans les prochaines  années, il voudrait  construire des maisons à faire louer, acheter une vache et  voir ses enfants continuer les études.
texts.en:
J. Claude is a member of the Mugorore group and lives in Cibitoke. He is 30 years old and married to Emelyne. Together they have four children, who are aged between three and ten. Two of the children are in school.
 
J. Claude has been running a business selling banana beer and other goods for ten years. 

This is his first loan from Turame. With his Kiva loan, he will increase his capital and buy a large quantity of bananas to produce many litres of banana beer, as well as 75kg of beans, which he will resell in order to earn more. 

In the next few years, J. Claude would like to build houses to let, purchase a cow and see his children continue their studies.

loans.use: to increase his capital and buy a large quantity of bananas to make many litres of banana beer, which he will resell in order to earn more.

loans.name: Duterimbere I Group

texts.fr:
Françoise  fait partie du groupe  Duterimbere I et  habite à Gitega. Elle  a 41 ans et est marié à Jean. Ensemble ils ont 7 enfants âgés  de  2 à  17 ans.

Elle fait le commerce de farine de manioc  depuis 13 ans. 

Elle est à son vingtième  crédit à Turame. Avec le crédit KIVA qu’elle  obtient, elle  va  augmenter son capital et acheter  une grande quantité de manioc    à revendre pour gagner plus. 

Grâce aux gains de son commerce elle parvient satisfaire les besoins familiaux (se nourrir, se loger,…).
texts.en:
Françoise is part of the group Duterimbere I and lives in Gitega. She is 41 years old and is married to Jean. They have 7 children together, aged from 2 to 17 years old.

She has been selling manioc flour for 13 years.

She is on her twentieth loan with Turame. With the Kiva loan that she receives, she is going to increase her capital and buy a large quantity of manioc to resell to make more.

Thanks to the profits of her business she manages to meet her family's needs (food, housing,...).

loans.use: to increase her capital and buy a large quantity of manioc to resell to make more.

loans.name: Confiance Group

texts.fr:
Berchmans fait partie du groupe  Confiance et  habite à Bujumbura. Il  a 31 ans et est marié à Pascaline. Ensemble ils ont 2 enfants l’un a 9ans et l’autre 12 ans.

Il fait le commerce de  boutique(riz,haricot,...) et de la bière dans son bistrot   depuis 10 ans. 

Il est à  troisième crédit à Turame. Avec le crédit KIVA qu’il obtient, il  va  augmenter son capital et acheter beaucoup de caisses de bière, et beaucoup de kilos de riz, de haricot,… à revendre pour gagner plus. 

Dans les prochaines  années, il voudrait  construire une maison sur sa parcelle  et voir ses enfants  étudier.
texts.en:
Berchmans is part of the group Confiance and lives in Bujumbura. He is 31 years old and married to Pascaline. Together they have two children, 9 and 12 years old. 

Berchmans has been selling rice, beans, etc. in a store and beer in his bistro for ten years. 

This is his third Turame loan. With the KIVA loan he is obtaining, he is going to increase his capital and purchase many cases of beer and a lot of rice, beans, … to resell, so as to earn more. 

In the coming years, he would like to build a house on his plot of land and see his children educated.

loans.use: to purchase a great deal of beer, rice, and beans to resell, so as to earn more

loans.name: Cheche Jesus 1, 2 & 3 Group

texts.fr:
Eden est le coordinateur de son groupe Cheche Jesus. Il n´est marie pas mais il a 3 enfants. Eden habite dans la région d’Haiti où de l’éléctricité est rare et de l’eau est très limité. Eden a dirigé son commerce de Produits divers pendant les 6 dernières années. 

Eden voudrait utiliser cet emprunt pour investir dans le commerce. Il va acheter des objets divers tels que des chaussures, des vêtements, des produits cosmétiques et d'autres, son entreprise a grandi un peu depuis son dernier prêt, ce qui a contribué à soutenir leurs enfants de plus en motiver d'autres membres dans le groupe Cheche Jesus. 

Eden espère que cet emprunt l’aidera à agrandir son entreprise. Des autres membres Cheche Jesus ont besoin d’un emprunt pour tels commerces comme charbon et produits alimentaires. Eden dit que ses défis principal est d'agrandir son entreprise. Il dit que son but principal sont un homme d'affaires.
texts.en:
Eden is the coordinator of his group "Cheche Jesus". He is unmarried and has three children. He lives in the region of Haiti where electricity is rare and water is very limited. He has been running his business selling a variety of goods for the last six years. 

Eden would like to use this loan to invest in his business. He is going to purchase various items, such as shoes, clothing, cosmetic products, and more. His enterprise has grown a little since his last loan, which helped support their children, as well as to motivate other members of the group Cheche Jesus.

Eden hopes that this loan will help him to expand his enterprise. Other members of Cheche Jesus have need of a loan for businesses such as in charcoal and food. Eden says that his main goal is to become a businessman.

loans.use: to purchase various items, such as shoes, clothing, and cosmetic products to sell

loans.name: Cheche Jesus 4, 5, 6, 7 & 8 Group

texts.fr:
Moise est le coordinateur de son groupe Cheche Jesus 4, 5, 6, 7 & 8. Il n´est marie pas mais il a 4 enfants. Il habite dans la région d’Haiti où de l’éléctricité est rare et de l’eau est très limité. Il a dirigé son commerce de vente divers pendant les 6 dernières années. 

Moise voudrait utiliser cet emprunt pour investir dans le commerce. Il va acheter des objets divers tels que des produits cosmétiques, des chaussures, des vêtements, son entreprise a grandi un peu depuis son dernier prêt, ce qui a contribué à soutenir leurs enfants de plus en motiver d'autres membres dans le groupe Cheche Jesus.

Moise espère que cet emprunt l’aidera à agrandir son entreprise. Des autres membres Cheche Jesus ont besoin d’un emprunt pour tels commerces comme charbon, cosmetiques produits et produits alimentaires. Moise dit que ses défis principal est d'agrandir son entreprise.
texts.en:
Moise is the coordinator of his group "Cheche Jesus 4, 5, 6, 7 & 8". He is unmarried and has four children. He lives in the region of Haiti where electricity is rare and water is very limited. He has been running his business selling a variety of goods for the last six years. 

Moise would like to use this loan to invest in his business. He is going to purchase various items, such as cosmetics, shoes, and clothing. His enterprise has grown a little since his last loan, and this has helped support [his] children, as well as to motivate other members of the group Cheche Jesus.

Moise hopes that this loan will help him to expand his enterprise. Other members of Cheche Jesus have need of a loan for businesses such as in charcoal, cosmetic products, and food. Moise says that his main challenges include expanding his enterprise.

loans.use: to purchase cosmetic products to sell

loans.name: Patron San Pedro De Cuyo Chico Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “PATRON SAN PEDRO DE CUYO CHICO”; Este banco se ubicada en el distrito de Calca, perteneciente a la provincia de Calca y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Casiana ella es soltera y tiene 55 años y tiene 5 hijos; La socia trabaja en su negocio de tienda de abarrotes y también la socia se dedica al negocio de artesanía, la socia vende polos, chalinas y guantes, la socia vende productos de primera necesidad como arroz,azúcar,leche y aceite, la socia tiene un puesto en el mercado que es una tienda de abarrotes, la socia trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 6:00 p.m, la socia ya tiene 1 año en este negocio y le va muy bien, el sueño de la socia es ampliar el negocio de tienda de abarrotes. La socia solicita el crédito para comprar leche, azúcar, aceite y arroz.

Los otros socios se dedican al negocio de venta de agricultura, negocio de ganadería, negocio de tienda de abarrotes y negocio de venta de animales.


La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
These communal bank members belong to the communal bank 'Patrón San Pedro de Cuyo Chico', which is located in the district of Calca, in the province of Calca and the department of Cusco.

Casiana, one of the members, is single, 55 years old, and has five children. She sells groceries as well as handicraft such as jumpers, shawls, and gloves. The groceries she sells consist of first-necessity items such as rice, sugar, milk, and cooking oil. Her shop is a stall at the market. She works from 8 am to 6 pm and has had this business for one year. Things are going very well and her dream is to have a bigger shop. She asks for a loan to buy milk, sugar, cooking oil, and rice to sell.

The other members sell produce, raise animals, sell groceries, and sell animals.

Casiana thanks everyone who makes their dreams possible and promises to be punctual in her repayments.

loans.use: to buy groceries to sell.

loans.name: Mamacha Del Carmen-Vilcabamba Group

texts.es:
Gregoria y varios vecinos conforman el banco comunal “Mamacha del Carmen” la mayoria de los vecinos viven en la comunidad de Vilcabamba. La comunidad de Vilcabamba esta dentro del distrito de Caicay dentro de la provincia de Paucartambo del departamento del Cusco). Gregoria es una persona alegre y muy humilde que tiene 48 años de edad, es casada y junto con su familia viven en al misma comunidad, ella despues de hacer sus actividades del hogar y se dedica a la agricultura pues tiene varios terrenmos de cultivos donde tiene papa, cebada, trigo y otras cosas mas. En esta oportunidad Gregoria requiere el préstamo para comprar semillas y fertilziantes. 
 
Este banco comunal está conformado por varias personas que buscan a cada momento las oportunidades para salir adelante y con su esfuerzo diario entregar un mejor futuro a sus hijos. Los socios  se dedican al agricultura, artesanía, venta de comida, ganadería, crianza de animales menores y otros. (La persona que aparece en la parte inferior de la fotografia llego tarde a la reunion).
texts.en:
Gregoria and various neighbours make up the “Mamacha del Carmen” communal bank. The majority of the neighbours live in the community of Vilcabamba. This community is situated in the district of Caicay in the province of Paucartambo, in the department of Cusco.

Gregoria is a very happy and modest person. She is 47 years old and is married, and lives with her family in the same community. After doing her domestic tasks, she works in agriculture and has various plots of land where she grows potato, barley, wheat and other crops. On this occasion Gregoria needs the loan to buy seeds and fertilizers. 

The communal bank is made up of members who are always looking for opportunities to get on in life and provide a better future for their children through daily hard work.  The members work in agriculture, crafts, selling food, livestock, rearing small animals and other jobs. 

(The person in the bottom of the photo arrived late for the meeting.)

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizers.

loans.name: Nilo

texts.en:
Nilo is married and has one child. He provide motorcycle transportation services in the community. 

Nilo is requesting a loan from GDMPC, which he will use to cover the costs of motorcycle maintenance. He wants to improve the general living standards of his family in the future.

loans.use: to pay motorcycle maintenance costs

loans.name: Bahogwere Group

texts.fr: La cliente Cirhahongerwa est une présidente adjointe de l’association  d’affaire « Bahogwere», senior  entrepreneur expérimentée, dynamique, âgée de 40 ans  et mère de 7 enfants qui étudient tous. Son conjoint est un commerçant de divers. La cliente est une vendeuse de poissons. Elle installe ses marchandises au long de la rue et parfois elle est ambulatoire. Elle commença ses affaires avec l’assistance de son mari. Plus tard, elle bénéficia le prêt de l’IMF Hekima. Il y a 4 ans qu’elle exerce cette activité. Ce nouveau prêt va la servir d’acheter 3 cartons de poissons. Ainsi, elle souhaite étendre son projet de commerce et construire une maison pour ses enfants. L’insécurité dans les sites d’approvisionnement, le manque de chambre froide (frigo, congélateur) sont des défis pour l’avancement de ses affaires. Au finish, elle remercie fortement Hekima pour l’autonomisation des femmes entrepreneurs non bancables, surtout ; pendant ce moment critique de guerre à l’Est du pays.
texts.en:
This client, Cirhahongerwa, is an assistant president of the business association "Bahogwere". She is a senior entrepreneur, experienced, energetic, 40 years old, and the mother of seven children, who are all students. Her husband is a merchant selling a variety of goods. Cirhahongerwa sets up her merchandise on the roadside and sometimes she hawks her wares. She started her business with her husband's assistance. Later on, she benefited from a loan from the microfinance institution Hekima. 

This new loan will be used to purchase 3 boxes of fish. Thus, she would like to expand her business plans and build a house for her children. The challenges for advancing her business include the lack of safety at supply locations and the lack of refrigeration/freezers.

In conclusion, she thanks Hekima very much for promoting autonomy among unbanked women entrepreneurs, especially during this critical time of war in the country's east.

loans.use: to purchase 3 boxes of fish

loans.name: Wend Zoodo Group

texts.fr:
Mme CHANTAL est responsable du groupe WENDZOODO. Mariée, elle est mère d’ 01 enfant. Il est âgé de 28ans et ne va plus à l’école. Elle a 02 personnes en charge.
Mme est coiffeuse et vend divers marchandise (pagnes, chaussures, perles, mèches, etc.) depuis 25ans pour la coiffure et plus de 08ans pour les divers. Elle s’approvisionne au Mali et à Bobo. Ses clients sont les hommes et les femmes.
Elle veut s’acheter 01 sachet de mèche pour revendre lors des fêtes.
Mme veut   réinvestir ses bénéfices dans son activité. Elle ambitionne agrandir sa boutique.
texts.en:
Chantal is the head of the Wend Zoodo group. She is married and the mother of one child. Her son is 28 years old and no longer goes to school. Chantal supports two people.

Chantal is a hairdresser and also sells various items (traditional cloth pagnes, shoes, beads, hair extensions, etc.); she has been in these business areas for 25 years and more than eight years respectively. She buys her supplies in Mali and in Bobo and serves both male and female customers.

Chantal would like to buy one pack of hair extensions to sell during festivals.

Chantal would like to reinvest her profits in her business. Her ambition is to expand her shop.

loans.use: to buy a bag of hair extensions to sell during festivals.

loans.name: Ricarido

texts.en:
This is Ricarido, resident of Batasan, Quezon City, Philippines. Single, he works hard to provide for his everyday needs. He is also helping his family with their finances.

Ricarido operates a meat stall. He buys pork meat from suppliers that deliver the meat to respective market stalls. There are many patrons who prefer his products since they are assured of the freshness and cleanliness.  His regular customers are his neighbors and the local community.  He earns a minimum of 1,000 PHP in sales every day.

To help him continue operations of his business, he is requesting a 40,000 PHP loan. He will be utilizing the loan to buy more pork meat. 

Ricarido dreams that his business will continue to grow and hopes to make a better living. He meets up with his co-fellowship members to share stories of his work every week, and there he can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God he studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for more pork meat.

loans.name: Carlos Ivan

texts.es:
Carlos de 38 años de edad, es una persona soltera que estudio hasta bachillerato. Se levanta a las 5:00 a.m. junto a sus padres que dependen de las actividades que él realiza.

Carlos  se dedica a la agricultura oficio que aprendió de sus padres,  para llegar a la parcelas camina 2 Km  y trabaja junto a ellos durante la mañana y luego en el transcurso de la tarde y  noche se dedica a cuidar una finca.

El préstamo que esta solicitando, es para comprar una vaca y producir leche, para que su madre la venda  obteniendo un ingreso adicional.

Carlos planea,  en un futuro comprar mas vacas lecheras y producir mas leche para elaborar queso, crema , etc.
texts.en:
Carlos is 38 years old and is single. He studied as far as high school. He gets up at 5am along with his parents, who rely on the work he does. Carlos works in agriculture, which he learnt from his parents. He walks 2 km to get to the plots of land and works with his parents during the morning, then during the afternoon and evening he looks after a farm.

The loan he is asking for is to buy a cow to produce milk for his mother to sell, providing an additional income. In the future Carlos plans to buy more dairy cows and produce more milk to make cheese, cream etc.

loans.use: to buy a cow and produce milk for his mother to sell, providing an additional income.

loans.name: Shirley Carla

texts.es: La Señorita Shirley  tiene 20 años y es soltera,  estudia la carrera  de contaduría pública en un instituto muy reconocido de la ciudad de El Alto, trabaja,  la Señorita Shirley  para pagar sus estudios trabaja vendiendo productos de belleza, es promotora de productos, este es su primer crédito que ha tomado con la institución,  la Señorita Shirley  va a usar este préstamo para  distintos gastos  que implica el estudiar como pago de matrícula para sus estudios que durara el tiempo dos años,  la Señorita Shirley  enfrenta retos en su estudios que son falta de apoyo económico  por parte de sus padres y el tener que trabajar y estudiar es muy duro pero ella tiene ganas de seguir adelante superarse terminar su carrera y poder ejercer su profesión,  viven en la zona Alto Chijini.
texts.en:
Shirley is 20 years old and single. She lives in the Alto Chijini neighborhood. She is studying to be a Public Accountant in a well-known institute in the city of El Alto. Shirley works as a promoter selling beauty products to pay for her studies.

This is Shirley's first loan with the institute which she will use to pay the various expenses that study entails including her tuition. Her schooling is for two years. Shirley faces challenges in her studies such as the lack of financial support from her parents. Also having to work and study is very difficult. But she has the desire to get on and finish her schooling and work in her profession.

loans.use: to pay tuition for her studies.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase clothing, shoes, cosmetic products, etc. to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase a ladder, rollers, scrapers , etc.

loans.name: Norma

texts.en:
Norma is 60 years old and married, with three children. Norma works very hard to provide for them.

Norma runs a general store in the Philippines.  She has requested a PHP 17,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional goods to sell in her general store.

Norma has been in this business for 11 years.  She sells a variety of items, such as canned goods, soft drinks, snack foods, sugar, soy sauce, vinegar, eggs, etc. 

Norma would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more goods to sell in her general store

loans.name: Verediyana

texts.en:
Verediyana is 53 years old. She is married, with four children. 

She sells foodstuffs, and she has been in the business for the past ten years. With the loan, she wants to buy more beans, sorghum, and peas for sale. The profits from the business will be used to make more savings.

loans.use: to buy more beans, sorghum, and peas for sale.

loans.name: Mareta

texts.en:
Mareta lives in Vanadzor town with his husband. Mareta's husband is a taxi driver, and she is an accountant with 25 years of experience. For the last few years, Mareta has been working as an accountant in a local school and also has a few agreements with local private enterpreneurs and LTDs for whom she provides accounting services. 

As a very skilled and experienced accountant, Mareta's service is much-demanded in the region. Realizing the importance of new training in an accounting program, Mareta has applied for this loan. She wants to participate in that training and enlarge her professional knowledge. The loan will also be used for purchasing a printer and scanner, which she needs for her work.

Mareta has now been approved for a loan within the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF International. The start-up loan program provides business start-up loans with soft conditions to informal businesses that do not have access to credit products. 

The loan is very important for Mareta, and she hopes for lenders' support.

loans.use: to pay for a printer, scanner and training in an accounting program.

loans.name: Auraliz

texts.es: La señora Auraliz es originaria de la ciudad de León, casada y madre de dos hijos. Tiene 48 años de edad. Es de oficio comerciante, se dedica al negocio de  pulpería. Inicio esta actividad hace pocos años, sin embargo todos sus clientes la visitan por la variedad de producto que les ofrece. Actualmente cuenta con un negocio bien surtido, que con el apoyo de su esposo ha logrado salir a delante económicamente. Su meta próxima es mejorar las condiciones de su negocio y apoyar a sus hijos. Solicita un crédito para comprar: arroz, frijoles, aceite, azúcar, shampoo, entre otros, con el fin de brindar una variedad de productos muy solicitados por sus clientes. Estima que este crédito le será de ayuda ya que aumentara su nivel de ganancias y sobre todo incrementará sus ventas. Su plan futuro es obtener cada vez más, una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Auraliz comes from the city of León and is married with two children. She is 48 years old. She works as a retailer, running a grocery business. She only started this business a few years ago but her customers all come to her because of the variety of products she has for sale. Now she has a well stocked business which she has been able to move forward financially with the help of her husband. Her next goal is to improve her business environment and support her children.

Auraliz is asking for a loan to buy rice, beans, oil, sugar, shampoo and other items, with the aim of providing a variety of products which are highly sought after by her customers. She thinks this loan will help her as she will increase her level of profits and above all increase her sales. Her plans for the future are to continue to improve her quality of life.

loans.use: to buy rice, beans, oil, sugar, shampoo and other items.

loans.name: Sophal

texts.en:
Sophal is 56 years old and married. She lives in the Kandal Stoeng district of Kandal province. 

To overcome the family’s hardship, she grows rice as her main business. She earns extra income via working at construction sites.  This is the business that she has had for several years. 

Including this loan, Sophal is a fifth-time borrower from VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). The past loans, which she has repaid back completely, have enabled her to relieve her family’s burden and improve her living better than before. Additionally, she is able to keep her kids in school. 

For this cycle, she wants to support the education costs for her daughter, who is studying in a local university and taking Khmer Literature as her major. She hopes that her daughter can get a good job after graduation

loans.use: To cover education costs for her daughter

loans.name: Madina

texts.en:
Madina is 36 years old and lives in the town of Mukono, in the region of Mukono in Uganda. She is married and has three children, with two of them currently in school. 

For the past five years, Madina has been working hard to manage her boutique, which sells dresses, trousers, skirts, and shirts. 

To help expand her business, Madina has requested a loan of 3,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more stock, and will help Madina to generate greater profits and restock the shop towards the festive season. 

Madina hopes that in the future, she will be able to open another outlet.

loans.use: to buy more stock for her clothing business.

loans.name: Asociacion Aadesco Group

texts.es: El CAPS AADESCO se ubica en la comunidad Valle de la Laguna, en el departamento de Masaya. Este CAPS abastece de agua potable a mas de 436 usuarios de la comunidad del Valle de la Laguna de Apoyo, beneficia a mas de 2,500 habitantes entre mujeres, hombres, ancianos y niños. El CAPS atraviesa por una situación difícil ya que la bomba existente es muy antigua y no está bombeando a su capacidad para abastecer a los usuarios; están recibiendo menos cantidad de agua del que normalmente reciben, debiendo acudir a puestos de agua mas lejanos para abastecerse, situación que pone en riesgo la salud de los habitantes, por ello la junta directiva del CAPS solicita este crédito para la compra e instalación de una nueva bomba sumergible que permita bombear mas agua en menor tiempo, asegurando el vital liquido las 24 horas del día a los habitantes de la comunidad.
texts.en:
The "AADESCO" CAPS (Community drinking water and sanitation committees) is located in the community of Valle de la Laguna de Apoyo and provides services for over 2,500 women, men, seniors and children. The committee is in a difficult situation as the water pump they use is very old and is not pumping to it's capacity to supply it's users. It is receiving less water than usual so it has to turn to sources of water that are further away for it's supply. This puts the health of the people at risk.

Therefore the Board of Directors of the CAPS is requesting this loan to buy and install a new submersible pump. It will pump more water in less time and ensure this vital liquid 24 hours a day to the citizens of the valley.

loans.use: to buy and install a new submersible pump.

loans.name: Andrea

texts.en:
This is Andrea. She previously accessed an 17,000 PHP (Philippines Pesos) loan that she used to buy RTW (ready to wear) products and merchandise items like polo shirts for men and women, dresses, and shirts to expand her product inventory. Her earnings were a big help in their personal, household, and business expenditures.
 
She would like to apply for another 20,000 PHP loan to buy RTW products and merchandise items like polo shirts for men and women, dresses, and shirts to expand her product inventory. Her profits from her business will definitely help her to sustain their daily needs. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

She hopes that her business will last for a long time and dreams of having their own house. She meets weekly with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business and draw strength and inspiration from studying the Word of God. 

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners who gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for RTW products and merchandise items like polo shirts for men and women, dresses, and shirts to expand her product inventory.

loans.name: Thierno

texts.fr: Thierno est un membre qui habite aux environs du Guichet. Il évolue dans le commerce de pièces détachées dans un garage de la place. Il fait aussi le commerce de divers produits comme les carreaux. Il est à son 1er prêt qui va lui permettre de renforcer son magasin de pièces détachées. Thierno est marié et père de famille, il a une expérience de plus de 3ans. Il commence sa journée à 8h pour la terminer à 19h du soir. Thierno souhaite diversifier son activité et augmenter ses revenus.
texts.en: Thierno is a member who lives near the branch office. He does commerce in spare parts in a local garage. He also does commerce in a variety of goods, such as tiles. He is on his first loan, which will enable him to bolster his spare parts store. Thierno is a married father with a family. He has over three years of experience. His day starts at 8 AM and ends at 7 PM.  Thierno would like to diversify his business and increase his revenues.

loans.use: to purchase spare parts to sell

loans.name: Thelma

texts.en:
Thelma works hard to support her family.  She is married and has a food vending business in the Philippines.

Thelma has requested a PHP 9,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional foods and ingredients for her business.

Thelma has been in this business for three years now.

Thelma would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more foods and ingredients for her business

loans.name: Seraphine

texts.en:
Seraphine is 37 years old. She is married with four children, aged between three and fifteen. She has been selling foodstuffs for the past months. She has decided to switch to the retail business after realizing that more customers demand the retail products. 

Therefore, she will use the new loan to buy more retail items such as sugar, salt, and soap for sale. The profits from the business will be used to renovate the house.

loans.use: to buy more sugar, salt and soap for sale.

loans.name: Ma. Ruby

texts.en:
Ma. Ruby works hard to support her family. She is married and has a furniture making business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for four years now.


Ma. Ruby requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional materials like wood, nails, varnish, etc. for her business.


In the future, Ma. Ruby would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to school.

loans.use: to purchase additional materials like wood, nails, varnish, etc. for her business.

loans.name: Dunda Mu Yesu Group

texts.fr: La cliente M'twali est un membre de l’association d’affaire «Dunda mu yesu», jeune entrepreneur expérimentée, dynamique, âgée de 35 ans, divorcée et mère de 5 enfants qui étudient tous. La cliente est une vendeuse de souliers. Elle installe ses marchandises au marché public et parfois à son domicile. Elle commença ses affaires avec l’assistance de son mari, avant qu’ils se séparent. Plus tard, elle bénéficia le prêt de l’IMF Hekima. Il y a 12 ans qu’elle exerce cette activité. Ce nouveau prêt va la servir d’acheter 40 paires de souliers. Ainsi, elle souhaite étendre son projet de commerce et acheter une parcelle pour ses enfants. Au finish, elle remercie fortement Hekima pour l’autonomisation des femmes entrepreneurs non bancables, surtout ; pendant ce moment critique de guerre à l’Est du pays.
texts.en:
This client, M'twali, is a member of the business association "Dunda mu yesu". She is a young entrepreneur, experienced, energetic, 35 years old, divorced, and a mother of five children, who are all students. M'twali is a vendor of shoes. She sets up her merchandise at the public market and sometimes as home. She started her business with assistance from her husband before they separated. Later on, she benefited from a loan from the microfinance institution Hekima. She has been in this business for twelve years. 

This new loan will be used to purchase 40 pairs of shoes. Thus, she would like to expand her business plans and purchase a plot of land for her children. 

In conclusion, she thanks Hekima very much for promoting autonomy among unbanked women entrepreneurs, especially during this critical time of war in the country's east.

loans.use: to purchase 40 pairs of shoes

loans.name: Etoile Group
