texts.fr: La cliente Vichy est une vice présidente  de l’association  d’affaire  «Etoile», senior  entrepreneur expérimentée, dynamique, âgée de 42 ans, divorcée  et mère de 3 enfants qui étudient tous.  La cliente est  une vendeuse de pagnes.  Elle installe ses marchandises au marché public  et parfois à son domicile.  Elle commença ses affaires avec l’assistance de projet Hekima (le  prêt de l’IMF Hekima).  Il y a 4 ans qu’elle exerce cette activité.  Ce nouveau prêt va la servir d’acheter 45 pièces de pagnes.  Ainsi, elle souhaite  étendre son projet de commerce et construire une maison pour ses enfants.  Au finish, elle remercie fortement Hekima pour l’autonomisation des femmes entrepreneurs non bancables, surtout ; pendant ce moment critique de guerre à l’Est du pays.
texts.en:
This client, Vichy, is a vice-president of the business association "Etoile". She is a senior entrepreneur, experienced, energetic, 42 years old, divorced, and a mother of three children, who are all students. Vichy is a vendor of 'pagnes' (the colorful cloth of western Africa). She sets up her merchandise at the public market. She started her business with Hekima plan assistance (a loan from the microfinance institution Hekima). She has been in this business for four years. 

This new loan will be used to purchase 45 lengths of 'pagne' cloth. Thus, she would like to expand her business plans and build a house for her children. 

In conclusion, she thanks Hekima very much for promoting autonomy among unbanked women entrepreneurs, especially during this critical time of war in the country's east.

loans.use: to purchase traditional cloth to sell

loans.name: Noemy Del Carmen

texts.es:
Noemy de 33 años de edad, debido a la condición económica de su familia, no le pudieron dar el estudio ya que era una familia bastante numerosa. Su esposo se dedica a trabajar en la agricultura, sus 4 hijos están estudiando en la escuela y están cursando primaria.

Ella se dedica a trabajar con su esposo en la agricultura, madrugando para prepararle sus alimentos y ademas en ocasiones le ayuda en la agricultura, por las tardes se dedica a vender pupusas en su casa y a la crianza de animales de granja, cerdos y gallinas de engorde, los que se involucran es su esposo.

Los fondos del crédito serán utilizados, para la compra de cerdos y gallinas de engorde; ya que se acercan la época festivas y se venden bien, ademas para la compra de concentrados para estos animales.

Ella espera para el futuro, sacar adelante a sus hijos para que puedan estudiar y poder construir una mejor vivienda para su familia.
texts.en:
Noemy is 33 years old. Due to the financial situation of her family and it being quite large, they were not able to give her an education. Her husband works in agriculture and her four children are studying at primary school.

She works with her husband in agriculture, getting up early to prepare their food for them and she also occasionally also helps him with the agriculture. In the afternoons she works selling tortillas in her house and rearing farm animals - pigs and chickens for meat, which her husband is involved in. 

The loan will be used for buying pigs and chickens reared for meat as the festive season is approaching and they sell well, and also to buy feed for the animals.

In the future she hopes to help her children get ahead so they can study and be able to build a better house for her family.

loans.use: to buy pigs and chickens reared for meat because the festive season is approaching and they sell well, and also to buy feed for the animals.

loans.name: Nov

texts.en:
Nov is a mother in her late 20s residing in Battambang province’s Moung Russey district. She has three kids to support, as one is in school and two are too young for schooling.

Nov is a local farmer who counts on a single agribusiness: rice farming.  She has been involved in her current business since she was 20 years old, and it has earned her about KHR 37,800 per day. With VisionFund (Kiva’s partner), she is not a first-time borrower. She has succeeded in using her past loan wisely to improve her living condition better than before. 

Now, she is seeking a new loan of KHR 1,500,000 to buy fertilizer and pesticide for her crop . She hopes that she can boost her crop yield better than before and gain a good income.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and pesticide for her crop

loans.name: Jonathan

texts.en:
Jonathan lives in Kilifi county that is located north of Mombasa on the Kenyan coast. He is 59 years old and he is a married man with eight children. He has been in business for more than ten years now and this business of buying and selling of bricks is what has been feeding his family. 

He knew Milango through friends who invited him to join so that he could make savings and be able to access funding to expand his business operations. The major challenge in the business has been high transportation and fuel costs. He now seeks a loan to buy bricks from other places for sale. The income that he will raise from the business will improve his standards of living  and also help him repair his residential house.

loans.use: to buy bricks from other places

loans.name: Hellen

texts.en:
Hellen lives in Kilifi county north of coastal town of Mombsa. She is 28 years old and she is married with five children that she takes care of. She owns a food cafe in town that she has been running for the last four years. 

Her business has been growing ever since she set it up. She started the business from the savings that she had made during the time she worked at a salon. She knew Milango through friends who asked to join them so that she could be able to access funding for her business. 

She now seeks a loan to buy cereals like maize and green grams (mung beans) for her business. The challenges that she faces in the business are prices and inflation rates. The income that she will raise from the business will go back in to her business.

loans.use: to buy cereals like maize and green grams (mung beans)

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy new clothes and jewelry to sell.

loans.name: Souleymane

texts.fr: Monsieur Souleymane est un homme âgé de 54 ans qui est marié et père de famille. Il est tailleur de profession et sollicite ce prêt  pour acheter une machine à coudre.  Il gère les charges quotidiennes de sa famille.  Souleymane a une expérience de plus de 25ans dans son activité ; il coud et vend des prêts à porter. Il commence sa journée à 8h pour la finir à 19h. A l’avenir il voudrait renforcer son parque de machines  à coudre et augmenter se s revenus afin de pouvoir améliorer les conditions de vie de sa famille.
texts.en: Mr. Souleymane is a 54-year-old man who is a married father with a family. He is a tailor by trade and is requesting this loan to purchase a sewing machine. He is managing the day-to-day expenses of his family. Souleymane has over 25 years of experience in his business; he sews ready-to-wear clothing to sell. His day starts at 8 AM and ends at 7 PM. For the future, he would like to bolster his stock of sewing machines and to increase his revenues in order to be able to improve his family's living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase a sewing machine

loans.name: Seynabou

texts.fr: Madame seynabou  est un e commerçante qui habite à quelques kilomètres du Guichet. Elle s’active dans la commercialisation des  produits pour bâtiment c’est à dire une  quincaillerie. Elle sollicite ce prêt d’un montant de 200 000 F pour acheter du ciment, plâtre, acide et diluant destinés à la vente. Elle loue aussi des chaises ; à l’ avenir elle compte acheter un réfrigérateur pour diversifier son activité et augmenter ses revenus. Seynabou a une expérience de plus de 10ans dans cette activité
texts.en: Ms. Seynabou is a merchant who lives a few kilometers from the branch office. She is active in selling building materials, that is, hardware. She is requesting this loan in the amount of 200,000 francs to purchase some cement, plaster, acid, and thinner to sell. She also rents out chairs. For the future, she intends to purchase a refrigerator to diversify her business and to increase her revenues. Seynabou has over ten years of experience in this business.

loans.use: to purchase cement, plaster, etc. to sell

loans.name: Las Comerciantes  (Cuenca) Group

texts.es:
El grupo de crédito Las Comerciantes está formado por 9 mujeres quienes se dedican al comercio de diferentes productos, siendo este trabajo el sustento de su vida y con eso aportan a la economía de sus hogares. Vive por la ciudad de Cuenca, esta ciudad se encuentra rodeada de grandes paisajes, esta bañada por 4 ríos, mantiene su arquitectura colonia por lo que en Diciembre de 1999 fue nombrada Patrimonio Cultural de la Humanidad.
Una de las socias de este grupo es la Señora. Rosa, hace un año forma parte del grupo de crédito Las Comerciantes, tiene 35 años de edad, es casada y fruto de su unión conyugal ha concebido 3 hijos de 7, 5 y 3 años de edad, sus dos primeros hijos están estudiando en una escuelita de la ciudad, su esposo es de profesión chofer, no tiene casa propia por lo que vive en una casa prestada.
Doña Rosa se dedica a la venta de ropa usada desde hace 4 años, su producto lo vende en días de ferias y tiene una gran variedad de ropa. 
El dinero de su crédito va a invertir en la compra de ropa usada  para ampliar su negocio. Su meta es de crecer en el negocio hasta tener una boutique.
La foto pequeña es de una socia que no pudo estar presente cuando se tomo la gfoto del grupo.
texts.en:
The "Las Comerciantes" loan group has nine members who make a living selling different products.  Their work is where they earn a living and, with it, they support their households.  This "Las Comerciantes" group is based in Cuenca, a city surrounded by great scenery, and which has four rivers.  The city has held on to its colonial architecture and, in 1999, was named a UNESCO World Heritage Site.

One member of the "Las Comerciantes" group is Rosa.  She joined the group a year ago.  Rosa is 35 years old, married and has three children, aged seven, five, and three years old each.  The two eldest children are attending one of the city's school. Rosa's husband is a driver.  The family does not own a home and so are living in a rented house.

Rosa has been making a living selling second-hand clothes for four years.  She has a great variety of clothes, which she sells on market days.

Rosa will use this loan to buy clothes in order to expand her business.  Her goal is for the business to become big enough to open a shop.

The group member in the smaller photo was not at the meeting when the group photo was taken.

loans.use: to buy used clothes.

loans.name: Gloria

texts.en:
Gloria is a native woman from the town of CPG, Bohol. She runs a sari-sari (variety) store. She sells various items like soap, canned goods, noodles and beverages.  Her business started quite a few years ago. 

She is asking for a loan to buy more stock, such as snack foods, soda, beverages and rice, to accommodate all her customers’ needs.

In the future, Gloria hopes to expand her business and increase business profitability to improve her livelihood status and have a sustainable source of income.

loans.use: to buy more stock, such as snack foods, soda, beverages and rice.

loans.name: Joel Elena

texts.en:
Joel Elena is 44 years old and has six children.  She is married, and two of her children are still in school.

Joel Elena is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 8,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Joel Elena has been raising pigs for two years now, and she has borrowed three times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Joel Elena would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy electrical spare parts

loans.name: Guram

texts.en:
Guram is 30 years old, single, and from the village of Ninotsminda. He lives with his parents and retired grandparents. Guram has recently returned from abroad where he lived for years and now is jobless. The only one who earns income in the household is Guram’s father, who sells car spare parts at the capital city open market. 

Now, Guram is requesting a loan to purchase chicks to start a poultry farm. He has already started constructing the shed where the hens will be kept. With the received amount, Guram will buy chickens, feed for them, and cages. He will sell eggs and invest the increased profit in the same business to enlarge his farm. 

The family will have an additional source of income from the poultry farming, and they will be able to increase their daily spending. Guram hopes for your generosity.

loans.use: to start a poultry farm

loans.name: Pun's Group

texts.en:
Pun, who is 29 years old, lives in a rural area in Battambang province’s Moung Russey district.  She has three children in total. 

Pun and her husband are rice farmers. They have been in this business for almost 10 years. The current business earns her about KHR 50,000 per day to support her family. 

Pun has been with VisionFund for four cycles and completely paid back her loans,  They have helped her improve her livelihood from cycle to cycle. 

Now she is leading her group to ask for a loan. Pun will use her portion to buy fertilizer for her farmland. 

She hopes this loan will enable her to grow her rice healthily and also to make more rice, to better off her family’s living standard.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer for her farmland

loans.name: Sophorn

texts.en:
Age 53 and a local farmer from Bovel district of Battambang province, Sophorn is a widowed mother of five children. Nowadays, she needs to cater to two children who are in school. Her main source of income is from one hectare of rice farming. This has returned her about 17,800 KHR per day from the business that she has had for ten years. 

This is the original loan for Sophorn with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). She is seeking 1,000,000 KHR in order to buy rice seed and fertilizer, and to pay for the plowing fee as well as the labor cost. 

She hopes that she can gain a good yield, better than before, so that she can keep her kids in school.

loans.use: to buy rice seed and fertilizer, and to pay for the plowing fee as well as the labor cost.

loans.name: Ni's Group

texts.en:
Ni, who is 43 years old, is a local villager from Battambang province, where she does her agribusiness. 

Her rice farming has returned her about KHR 30,000 per day to cover the basic needs of her family. This is the third loan for Ni with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner).  The past loans, which she has repaid completely, have enabled her to upgrade her living condition better than before. 

Now, in a group of two, she is a leader.  She is seeking KHR 1,400,000, whereas her co-borrower is applying for KHR 1,000,000. 

As the leader, she will spend her entire loan portion to buy fertilizer for her crop. She hopes that she can gain a good income better than before.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer for her crop

loans.name: Luz Angelica

texts.es:
Me llamo Luz Angelica, tengo 28 años y me dedico a vender playeras, chamarras, según sea la temporada desde hace 15 años.
Tengo una hermosa familia, vivo en union libre, tengo 3 hijos, uno de 11,7 y 4 años de edad; ellos estudian la primaria yo trato de salir adelante junto con el apoyo de mi pareja. 
Estoy solicitando el crédito para invertir en mercancia que me hace falta y seguir manteniendo mi negocio y no perder ventas. Mi principal meta es lograr comprar una casa.
texts.en:
"My name is Luz Angelica and I am 28 years old.  I have been making a living selling t-shirts and ponchos, depending on the season, for 15 years.

"I have a beautiful family: I have a partner and three children.  One is 11 years old, the next is 7 and the youngest is 4 years old.  The are attending primary school and I am trying to get ahead with my partner's support.

"I am applying for a loan to invest in merchandise that I need so that I can continue to keep up my business and not lose sales.  My main goal is to buy a house."

loans.use: to buy ponchos and t-shirts for the winter season.

loans.name: Son

texts.en:
Residing in Kampong Channang province, Son is 54 years old and married. For the sake of her family, she grows rice on a hectare and half and sells her handmade flat baskets. It is a business that she has been with for ages, and it has returned her about 12,500 KHR per day. 

This is not the first loan for Son with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). She has repaid back her past loan and used the money wisely to support her business as well as to keep her kids in school. 

Now, she has decided to request an education loan to cover the tuition fee of vocational training for her daughter, including Computer skills and an English program. 

She hopes that her daughter get find a good job after graduation.

loans.use: To cover the tuition of vocational training of her daughter

location.town: Kampong Chhnang province, Tek Phos district

loans.name: Leila Marina

texts.es:
Leila Marina es originaria del municipio de El Sauce, habita en el caserío La Tejera donde tiene muchos años de vivir.
Desde hace treinta años se dedica a la elaboración de dulces como antefrijol, arroz de leche y atolillo, oficio que aprendió de su madre donde hoy le agradece porque gracias a esto se gana el pan de cada día.
También ella en conjunto con su esposo tienen el negocio de la tejera que es un lugar donde se elabora el ladrillo y tejas que son materiales para la construcción de viviendas.
Cuentan con cuatro trabajadores los que se encargan de elaborar este tipo de materiales.
Doña Leila es una señora muy trabajadora que desde muy temprano desde las cuatro de la mañana se levanta a preparar la comida de los trabajadores y luego elabora los dulces para salir a vender a las diferentes calles de dicho municipio.
Los pobladores de este municipio adquieren estos productos por su buena calidad y por ser muy sabrosos lo que le han dado popularidad.
Doña Leila en este momento necesita de un financiamiento por lo que solicita a los inversionistas de Kiva para que a través de Ceprodel le apoyen con un crédito para Pago de mano de obra, compra de frijoles, arroz y azúcar debido a que viene la temporada buena para sus dos negocios donde los pobladores aprovechan su aguinaldo para la construcción de viviendas y los dulce para la celebración de la purísima.
texts.en:
Leila Marina is a native of the municipality of El Sauce. She has lived in the La Tejera neighborhood for many years. For the past 30 years she has been making sweets like antefrijol (custard made of beans), arroz de leche (rice pudding) and atolillo (rice custard). She learned how to make these from her mother and thanks to this she can earn her daily bread.

Also together with her husband, she has a business using a tile kiln to produce tiles and bricks used as construction materials in housing. They have four workers who produce these products.

Leila is a very hard-working woman who gets up at 4 am to prepare breakfast for the workers. Then she makes the sweets and goes out to sell them in the streets of her municipality. The locals buy these products for their high quality and good taste which has made them popular.

Leila needs a loan at this time. She is requesting this assistance from the lenders at Kiva through Ceprodel. She needs to pay for labor and to buy beans, rice and sugar. Her busiest season is coming where the locals take advantage of their Christmas bonus to build their houses and buy the sweets to celebrate "la Purísima" ( a Nicaraguan festival honoring the Virgin Mary).

loans.use: to pay for labor and buy beans, rice and sugar.

loans.name: Jennifer

texts.en:
Jennifer is 50 years old and lives in the town of Lugazi, in the region of Mukono in Uganda. She is married and has six children, with two of them currently in school. 

For the past ten years, Jennifer has been working hard to manage her boutique, which sells clothes and garments. 

To help expand her business, Jennifer has requested a loan of 3,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more clothes and materials, and will help Jennifer to generate greater profits and boost the income level of the family. Jennifer hopes that in the future, she will be able to become productive. 

Jennifer is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Jennifer who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to buy more clothes and materials.

loans.name: Jennifer

texts.en:
Jennifer helps her husband in operating their motorcycle transportation services to earn a living. She also works as a caretaker to earn additional income. 

Recently, after she had joined GDMPC, Jennifer borrowed a new loan to finance registration for her new motorcycle. She is hopeful to improve her business in order to provide a better living to her five children.

loans.use: to finance registration for her new motorcycle.

loans.name: Osman

texts.en:
Osman is 55 years old, married, and has three children. He has three additional dependents who live with him, and he supports their schooling. 

In 1989, Osman established his junk business. He began his business immediately after he completed his fifth form, and his parents did not have money to support him in furthering his education. Therefore, he decided to assist his friends in business until the time when he got some capital to establish his own business. 

Working seven days a week and 10 hours a day, Osman earns about SLL 2,500,000 a month. He is requesting a loan of SLL 5,000,000, which he will add  to his own capital and buy more bales of used clothing.  

He hopes that this loan will enable him to increase his monthly profits by about SLL 1,500,000. Osman has started suppling bales to his customers in the provences.

He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To add to his own capital and buy more bales of used clothing.

loans.name: Las Orquideas  (Cuenca) Group

texts.es:
El grupo de crédito Las Orquídeas está formado por un grupo de 8 amigas quienes laboran en diferentes actividades, las mismas que le permiten aportar a la economía de sus hogares y sacar adelante a sus familias, las socias son mujeres luchadoras que tratan de brindarles un mejor futuro a sus hijos. Viven por la ciudad de Cuenca, esta ciudad es reconocida por su belleza natural y arquitectónica, esta bañada por 4 ríos, esta ciudad es cuna de grandes artistas, pintores y atletas, cuenta con una variada gastronomía la cual cautiva el paladar de quienes la visitan.
Una de las socias de este grupo es la Señora. Sandra, se encuentra realizando su segundo crédito a lado de sus amigas quienes conforman el grupo de crédito Las Orquídeas, le gusta este tipo de créditos por la solidaridad que encuentra en cada una de sus integrantes.
La Señora Sandra tiene 31 años de edad, está casada  y en su unión conyugal ha concebido 2 hijos, su primera hija tiene 8 años de edad y está estudiando en una escuelita de la ciudad y su segundo hijo tiene 11 meses de edad, su esposo es de profesión docente y labora en esta actividad, la casa en la que viven es propia.
Doña Sandra es enfermera de profesión pero por el momento no se encuentra ejerciendo ya que está más al pendiente de sus hijos, pasa en casa al cuidado de ellos pero para aportar a la economía de su casa se dedica a la agricultura, sus cosechas las vende en la ciudad.
El dinero de su crédito va a invertir en la compra de semillas y abono para sus cultivos. Su sueño culminar sus estudios universitarios.
texts.en:
The Las Orquídeas communal bank is made up of a group of 8 friends who do various types of work. This allows them to contribute to their household economy and bring up their families. The members are hard-working women who are trying to provide their children with a better future. They live around the city of Cuenca, which is famous for its natural and architectural beauty and has 4 rivers running through it. The city is home to great artists, painters and athletes and has a varied cuisine which captivates the palate of everyone who visits. 

One of the members of the group is Sandra, who is taking out her second loan along with her friends who make up the Las Orquídeas communal bank. She likes this type of loan because of the solidarity she finds with all of the other members. Sandra is 31 years old and is married. She and her husband have had two children, a daughter aged 8 years who goes to a small primary school in the city and a son aged 11 months. 

Sandra's husband works as a teacher and they live in their own house. Sandra is a trained nurse but is not working at present as she is at home looking after the children. However, in order to contribute to the household finances she works in agriculture and sells her produce in the city. 

Sandra will use her loan to buy seeds and manure for her crops. Her dream is to finish her university studies.

loans.use: to buy seeds and manure.

loans.name: Theresa's Group

texts.en:
Theresa is a member of this group. She is single with two children who are both in school. Theresa has sold bags for eight years now. She uses the money from her business to cover home expenses. Her children's school fee payments are a challenge for her. Despite these challenges, Theresa is a hardworking lady who works endlessly to take care of the family single-handedly. 

Theresa’s group is applying for a total loan amount of 7,200 GHS (Ghana cedis) through ID-Ghana to buy bags, secondhand clothing, and barbering accessories. 

Theresa will use her 1,200 GHS portion of the loan to buy bags to sell to customers.

loans.use: to buy bags to sell to customers.

loans.name: Rosa Mistica Group

texts.es:
Rosa Mistica está en su 2° ciclo  del programa de comité de mujeres, donde todas trabajan y se ayudan por salir adelante. Están haciendo la encuesta de eliminación de pobreza, donde 8 se encuentran por debajo de la línea de pobreza, es decir que tienen ingresos muy bajos y que deben seguir esforzándose por mejorar.
Una de las integrantes es la Sra. Balbina quien pese a su trabajo duro y sacrificado no se cansa de luchar y tratar siempre de ir mejorando. Ella se dedica a la venta de remedios naturales (yuyos)  y comenta que tiene una clientela que siempre compra de ella todo lo que tiene. Es una persona muy entusiasta y que en el ciclo anterior mostró muchas ganas de superarse.
Balbina pide este crédito para poder invertirlo en la compra de remedios naturales para la venta para seguir invirtiendo en su trabajo e ir saliendo así de una mejor manera de la pobreza.
texts.en:
Rosa Mistica is in its second loan cycle with the women's program, and all the members work and help each other get ahead. They are participating in the poverty reduction survey, in which eight of the women live below the poverty line, that is, their income is very low and they must keep working hard to improve. 

Balbina, one of the members, never tires of striving and always looks to succeed despite her difficult, demanding job. She sells natural medicines and says her customers always buy what she has on hand. She is enthusiastic and, in the previous cycle, showed a great desire to succeed. Balbina has applied for a loan to buy natural medicines to sell so that she can invest in her business and raise herself out of poverty.

loans.use: to buy natural medicines to sell.

loans.name: Mujeres De Fe Group

texts.es:
El grupo llamado Mujeres de la Fe  está en el 4to, es un grupo muy emprendedor y que están creciendo de apoco, y con una expectativa de salir adelante por medio del trabajo en equipo y la ayuda mutua.
Una de ellas es Blanca, quien se dedica a la venta de bebidas en general, comenta que esta es la forma en la que ella puede ayudar a su familia, procurando poder cubrir los gastos del día a día y de esa forma velar por ellos para que no les falte nada. Pide de esta ayuda para poder comprar bebidas varias, como ser gaseosas, vinos, cervezas y demás, y agradece por esta oportunidad que recibe de seguir creciendo.
texts.en:
The group called Mujeres de la Fe [Women of the Faith] is in its fourth loan cycle. It is a very enterprising group and they are growing bit by bit with the expectation of getting ahead by means of teamwork and mutual help.

One of the women is Blanca, who makes her living mainly selling drinks. She comments that this is the way in which she can help her family, seeking to cover the day to day expenses and by this manner ensure that they do not lack anything. She asks for this help to be able to buy various drinks, like soda, wine, beer and more, and she is thankful for this opportunity that she receives to keep growing.

loans.use: to buy sodas, wine, beer and others for selling.

loans.name: Rosita

texts.en:
Rosita is married, with three children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur.  She is 45 years old and has one child who is still in school.

Rosita has a food-vending business in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 15,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy ingredients like coconut, rice, sugar, etc., for her food business.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

Rosita has been in this business for three years.  She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy ingredients like coconut, rice, sugar, etc., for her food vending business

loans.name: Ma. Evelyn

texts.en:
Ma. Evelyn is 53 years old and married with two children.

She earns a living by having a pig fattening business in the Philippines. Ma. Evelyn is borrowing PHP 30,000 through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Ma. Evelyn has been in pig fattening for five years and earns additional income from her general store.

She is working tirelessly towards the attainment of her dream of saving money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy sacks of maize, beans and rice

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy ladies' dresses, African dresses, and skirts.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy another donkey.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy potatoes and maize

loans.name: Saony's Group

texts.en:
Aged 29 and a villager from Battambang province, Saony is a mother of one little child who is too young for schooling. For her family, paddy rice farming and a pineapple plantation are the core income-generating activities which she has been involved in for 9 years.

This is the second loan cycle for her and the first loan cycle for her joint borrower.  She has paid back her past loan completely and wisely used her past loan to stabilize her living conditions in a gradual manner.

For this loan cycle, she and her co-borrower are seeking 1,000,000 KHR each. As the leader, she will spend her entire loan portion to buy fertilizer for her rice field. She hopes that she can boost her crop in a timely fashion and receive double yields.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer for her rice field

loans.name: Mao

texts.en:
Mao is 63 years old and a widowed mother of six children. Nowadays, she resides in Kampong Speu province where she grows her paddy rice as the main source of income. Besides this agribusiness, she can earn more income via working for others for a fee. This business has returned her almost $7 per day.  

This is the first loan for Mao with VisionFund(Kiva’s partner).  Mao applies for this loan in order to pay for education for her daughter who wishes to continue her study towards a bachelor's degree in English Literature. She hopes that her daughter can get good job after graduate.

loans.use: To pay for education for her daughter

location.town: Kampong Speu Province, Phnom Srouch District

loans.name: Emprendedoras De Katupyry Group

texts.es:
Emprendedoras de Katupyry se encuentran en su 3º ciclo, todas ellas forman parte del programa de eliminación de pobreza, con el cual ellas podrán conocer la situación económica en la que cada una está.
La Sra. Juana, quien en su última encuentra mostró estar en el nivel medio, con ingresos que debe ir mejorando. Ella se dedica a la elaboración y venta de productos de limpieza, que con mucho sacrificio y esfuerzo está saliendo adelante, cuenta que su trabajo es sacrificado pero que lo hace por ayudar a su familia.
La Sra. Juana pide este crédito para la compra de insumos para hacer sus productos de limpieza, lo que le permitirá seguir con su emprendimiento y mejorando sus ingresos.
texts.en: Emprendedoras de Katupyry are in their third loan cycle, all part of the program to eliminate poverty in which the institution can learn about the economic situation in which each member exists. Juana, who was found to be in the middle level in the poverty survey, should improve with her income. She is engaged in the manufacture and sale of cleaning products. With much sacrifice and effort, she is moving forward. She says her work is a sacrifice but it does help her family. Juana requests this credit to purchase ingredients to make her cleaning products, allowing her to continue her enterprise and improve her income.

loans.use: to purchase ingredients to make cleaning products.

loans.name: Virgen De Fatima Group

texts.es:
17 son las mujeres que forman este grupo, todas ellas son mujeres jefas de familia que se están esforzando por mejorar sus condiciones de vida. Forman parte del programa de eliminación de la pobreza, haciendo la encuesta de eliminación para poder crecer u mejorar.
Una de las integrantes es la Sra Jorgelina quien tiene una despensa bien surtida en la que trabaja todos los días desde muy tempranas horas y asi se gana el sustento de ella y de su familia. Comenta que su sueño es poder tener una despensa más amplia y poder convertirla en un mini super.
La Sra. Jorgelina Solicita de este crédito para la compra de productos variados para la venta como ser: carnes, escobas, desodorantes, elementos de limpiezas y demás para seguir con sus ventas, mejorando sus ingresos, y así saliendo de la pobreza.
texts.en: There are 17 women who comprise this group, all of them are female heads of household who are striving to improve their living conditions. They are part of the program of eliminating poverty, taking the survey of poverty elimination in order to grow or improve. One of the member is Jorgelina. She has a well-stocked small grocery store where she works every day from very early. This is the livelihood she earns for herself and her family. She says that her dream is to have a large store and turn it into a mini-supermarket. Jorgelina applies for this loan to purchase various items to sell such as meat, brooms, deodorants, cleaning products, and other products to continue her sales, improve her income, and escape poverty.

loans.use: to purchase meats, brooms, deodorants, cleaning products, and more for her store.

loans.name: Camilo

texts.es: Camilo agradece a todos los inversionistas por el préstamo y se siente contento, él pudo comprar semillas y abono para sembrar hortalizas como por ejemplo papa, cebollas, cebada y le fue muy bien, él continua viviendo en la ciudad de Paucartambo y continua participando en el banco comunal “Santa Ana” y esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar para comprar semillas y abono, él es una persona responsable y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas mensuales con mucha responsabilidad.
texts.en: Camilo thanks all the lenders for the loan, and he is pleased that he was able to buy seed and manure for his crops, which include potatoes, onions, and barley. He still lives in the city of Paucartambo and is a member of the Santa Ana communal bank. He now needs a loan to buy seed and manure. He is responsible and promises to make his monthly payments on time.

loans.use: to buy seed and manure.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase clothing and jewelry accessories to sell

loans.name: Maluay De Curiquinga  (Cuenca) Group

texts.es:
El grupo de crédito Maluay de Curiquinga está formado por 8 mujeres luchadoras que tienen un objetivo en común el cual es ayudar de cualquier forma a mejorar la estabilidad económica de sus hogares, de sacar adelante a sus familias y  brindarles más oportunidades de superación a sus hijos, son personas amables y gentiles que aun mantienen la cultura y tradiciones de sus pueblos. Viven por una comunidad perteneciente a la parroquia del Valle en Cuenca, lugar que tiene hermosos paisajes y variada gastronomía.
Una de las socias de este grupo es la Señora. Patricia, tiene 48 años de edad, está separada de su esposo pero en su unión conyugal ha concebido dos hermoso niños de 4 y 3 años de edad, no tiene casa propia por lo que vive en casa de su madre con quien comparte los gastos de su hogar.
Doña Patricia se dedica al cuidado de sus pequeños hijos pero para sacarlos adelante se dedica a la crianza de pollos los mismos que los vende en pie y pelados, lleva 3 años en esta actividad, también se dedica a la agricultura esto es para el consumo de su hogar y también vende en la ciudad. 
El dinero de su crédito va a invertir en ampliar su galpón de pollos y en alimento para sus pollos. Su meta es comenzar a criar cuyes y pollos por mayor cantidad.
texts.en:
The credit group Maluay de Curiquinga is made up of 8 determined women who share a common goal: to help improve the economic stability of their homes, to better care for their families, and to provide their children with more opportunities. These women are friendly and kind, and they also maintain the traditions and culture of their people. They live in a community belonging to the district "El Valle" in Cuenca, which is known for its beautiful landscapes and varied cuisine.

One of the members of this group is Patricia. She is 48-years old and separated from her husband but, while they were still together, they had two beautiful children who are now 3 and 4 years old. She does not have her own house, but lives with her mother with whom she shares the home's expenses. Patricia is dedicated to caring for her young children and, in order to do this, she works raising chickens, which she later plucks, and sells. She has been running this business for 3 years. She also grows produce both for her family's consumption and to sell in the city. She is going to invest the money from this loan in expanding her chicken coop and buying chicken feed. Her goal is to start raising a larger quantity of chickens as well as guinea pigs.

loans.use: to expand her chicken coop and to buy chicken feed.

loans.name: Lucia

texts.es:
La Sra. Lucia es la presidenta dde La Comisión vecinal Pro Agua Corriente Santa Teresita se formó hace más o menos un año, están  dando el servicio de distribución de agua a más de 40 usuarios, ubicado en la ciudad de Paraguarí, después de años sin contar con suficientes agua, se organizaron y  con ayuda de la municipalidad lograron  la excavación del pozo artesiano y mediante otras gestiones  lograron que la gobernación les  ayude con las maquinarías necesarias para la construcción del tanque.
Hoy la presidenta, la Sra. Lucia pide de este crédito para poder utilizarlo en la compra de cañerías, para hacer llegar el agua a las distintas familias del barrio, y de esa forma poder dar acceso a más personas, y agradece por esta oportunidad que todas estas familias reciben.
En la foto del grupo aparecen las Señoras Maria, Asuncion, y Miryan, quienes firman como codeudoras y forman también parte de esta comisión.
texts.en:
Lucia is the president of the local commission Pro Agua Corriente Santa Teresita that was formed about a year ago. They provide a water distribution service to more than 40 users located in the city of Paraguarí. After years without sufficient water, an artesian well was organized with the help of the municipality. They dug the well and constructed the necessary tanks with the government's help with providing machinery. 
Today, the president Lucia requests this loan to use in the purchase of pipes to get water to different families in the neighborhood and thus provide access to more people. She is thankful for the opportunity that all these families receive. 
In the group photo, Maria, Asuncion, and Miryan, who signed as co-obligors, who also form part of this committee, appear.

loans.use: to purchase pipes for the distribution of water.

loans.name: Mujeres Activas Group

texts.es:
Mujeres Activas está en su 1° ciclo  del programa de comité de mujeres, donde también todas están dentro del programa de eliminación de la pobreza, ellas están luchando por poder mejorar y salir adelante.
Una de las integrantes es la Sra. Genara quien en su última encuesta mostro un nivel de pobreza dentro del nivel uno, es decir, está con ingresos escasos, pero es consciente que a través del esfuerzo y el trabajo continuo podrá mejorar su situación de pobreza. Ella tiene una peluquería, y además de eso también vende bijouterie en su negocio, es una persona muy trabajadora y emprendedora, que lucha por salir adelante y mejorar su situación de pobreza.
Pide este préstamo para poder invertirlo en la compra de insumos para su peluquería, como ser tintes, shampoo, enjuagues, y demás, y así seguir con su trabajo, tratando de mejorar cada día.
texts.en:
The Mujeres Activas Group is in its first loan cycle with the Comite de Mujeres. As well, all the women are part of the elimination of poverty program. They want to improve their lives and make progress.

One of the members is Sra. Genera who in her last survey showed a level 1 poverty level which means that she has little income but understands that through effort and steady work she will be able to improve her situation. Genera has a hairdressing salon and also sells costume jewelry in her business. She is a hardworking, enterprising person who wants to get ahead and improve her poor economic situation.

She is seeking a loan to buy hairdressing supplies such as dyes, shampoo, rinses etc. so she can continue with her job and try to improve every day.

loans.use: Buy dyes, shampoo, rinses etc.

loans.name: Reyna Isabel

texts.es: Reyna de 26 años de edad habita en casa de su propiedad junto a su esposo. Reside en condiciones muy humildes y junto a su esposo van buscando las formas de ir mejorando sus condiciones poco a poco. Reyna es una mujer emprendedora quien hace dos año se dedica a la venta de pan francés. Todos los días se levanta muy temprano para salir a promocionar el delicioso pan que cada día le demandan más. Su deseo es mejoras las condiciones de su casa ya que el techo se encuentra deteriorado por causa del sol y las lluvias. Solicita este crédito a FUSAI para invertir en la compra de lámina galvanizada, teja, madera y pago de mano de obra. Espera poder contar con este apoyo ya que no cuenta con el capital para hacer el desembolso pero con lo que gana en el negocio puede pagar las cuotas que el crédito implica.
texts.en:
Reyna, who is 26 years old, lives in her own house with her husband. They live in very basic conditions and she and her husband are always looking for ways to gradually improve their conditions. Reyna is an enterprising woman who decided two years ago to start selling French bread. Every day she gets up very early to go out selling the delicious bread which is steadily growing in demand.

Reyna wants to improve the conditions in her home because the roof has deteriorated due to the sun and rain. She is asking for this loan from FUSAI to buy galvanised sheets, tiles and wood and to pay for labour. She hopes to get this support as she does not have the capital to cover the outlay, but she will be able to pay the resulting loan instalments with what she earns in her business.

loans.use: to buy galvanised sheets, tiles and wood and to pay for labour to repair the roof of her house.

loans.name: Jamoliddin

texts.ru:
Как и любой мужчина Чамолинддин хочет иметь свою семью, детей, хорошую работу и обеспеченную жизнь. Чамолиддин уже женат и растет двоих дочерей. Им по 5 лет и по 3 годика. Самому Чамолиддину 29 лет. Ему осталось найти хорошую работу и обеспечить жену и  детей, чтобы они не в чем не нуждались. 
   Чамолиддин решил начать свой бизнес. Он будет продавать парфюмерию. Чамолиддин рядом с домом начал строить маленький магазин. Недавно строительство магазинчика закончилось и Чамолиддин хочет скорее приступить к работе. Он продал свою машину и получил не много средств, но для приобретения необходимого количества продукции не достаточно, по этой причине он обратился за кредитом. Ему не хватает 3000$, чтобы начать свой бизнес. Чамолиддин надеется на Вашу помощь, для него это очень важно.
texts.en: Like any man, Jamoliddin wants to have his own family, children, a good job and a secure life. Jamoliddin is already married and is raising two daughters. They are 5 and 3 years old. Jamoliddin himself is 29 years old. All he has left to do is to find a good job to provide for his wife and children, so that they do not not need for anything. Jamoliddin decided to start his own business. He will sell perfume. Jamoliddin began building a small shop near his house. He recently finished the shop and wants to open his business as soon as possible. He sold his car for a small amount of money, which is insufficient to obtain the necessary amount of merchandise.  For this reason, he has applied for a loan. He needs $3,000 to start his business. Jamoliddin is hoping for your help, as it is very important to him.

loans.use: To purchase perfumes and open a perfume business

loans.name: Norman Weyhder

texts.es:
Norman  agradece a todos los inversionistas por el préstamo y se siente contento, él continúa viviendo en la ciudad de Paucartambo y sigue brindando servicios educativos y le va muy bien.
Él continua en el banco comunal “Santa Ana” y esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para uso personal  para educación de sus hijos y gastos del hogar.
texts.en:
Norman is grateful to all of the lenders for the loan, and he feels happy.  He continues living in the city of Paucartambo, and he continues providing educational services.  It is going very well for him.

He continues in the “Santa Ana” communal bank.  This time he needs the loan for personal use for his children’s education and for household expenses.

loans.use: to pay for his children’s education and for household expenses.

loans.name: Nenita

texts.en:
Nenita is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a pig fattening business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 14,000 through NWTF to buy feed, vitamins and other supplies for her pig fattening business.

Nenita has been in this business for four years. Nenita earns more income from abacca weaving.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

Nenita has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy feed, vitamins and other supplies for her business

loans.name: Cesillian

texts.en:
Cesillian works hard to support her family. Cesillian is married and has had a food vending business in the Philippines for seven years.

Cesillian requested a 17,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food production business.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

In the future, Cesillian would like to save enough money so that she could afford to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business.

loans.name: Francine

texts.en: Francine is 38 years old. She is married to a soldier. She sells clothes of different styles for both men and women. She has requested a loan to buy more trousers, blouses and dresses to sell. She plans to reinvest more in the business for a better future.

loans.use: To buy more clothes to sell

loans.name: Fernando De Jesús

texts.es: Fernando es un joven campesino de 24 años de edad que, desde que era niño su padre le enseñó todas las labores agrícolas, gracias a ello, hoy en día posee cultivos de arveja, papa criolla y fríjol, cuyas cosechas recolecta y vende en la plaza de mercado del municipio donde reside y, de esta manera genera los recursos suficientes para aportar a la economía de su hogar. Su actitud emprendedora, dinamismo y las ganas de salir adelante lo motivan a buscar nuevas alternativas que le permitan cumplir sus objetivos, por ello se motiva a solicitar el apoyo del crédito con el que desea comprar insumos agrícolas al por mayor (semillas, abonos, fertilizantes, pesticidas, entre otros), de esta manera podrá continuar con su labor, pues tendrá la posibilidad de recoger una cosecha más productiva y de buena calidad para que pueda ser vendida con mayor facilidad para recibir mejores ingresos y así, hacerle frente a los desafíos que se le presentan por los altos costos de los insumos y por la inestabilidad en los precios de los productos. El principal anhelo de Fernando es continuar con su labor y poder ampliar sus cultivos para convertirse en un gran productor y que su negocio sea rentable para que le garantice una estabilidad económica favorable que le ayude a brindar mejores condiciones de vida a su familia.
texts.en:
Fernando, 24, is a young farmer, whose father taught him all the farming chores at an early age. Thanks to that instruction, he now grows peas, potatoes, and beans. He collects the harvest and sells it at the city plaza market to earn enough money to support his family. His entrepreneurship, dynamism, and desire to succeed motivate him to look for ways to meet his objectives.

He has, therefore, applied for a loan to buy wholesale farming supplies (seed, manure, fertilizer, pesticide, and more) to continue working. He will have the chance to collect a bigger, high-quality harvest that he can easily sell for more money. He will be able to face the challenges of expensive supplies and variable market prices. 

Fernando's great desire is to keep working, expand his crops, and be a major producer. He wants his business to be profitable so that he can ensure that his family is financially stable and enjoys a higher standard of living.

loans.use: to buy wholesale farming supplies (seed, manure, fertilizer, pesticide, and more).

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to start an internet cafe.

loans.name: Anorlyne

texts.en: Anorlyne is happy that she was able to get a loan from Kiva. She repaid the entire loan amount without challenges and now she wants to buy sugar and maize flour to add to this business. She sees the business growing into a retail shop then into a wholesale business in the next five years. The income that she raised from the loan made her business grow and she was able to feed her family. The income that she will raise will improve her standard of living. The challenges that she faces in the business are the competition and the unstable market prices.

loans.use: to buy sugar and maize flour

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more charcoal for her business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay the tuition for her son's college education.

loans.name: Walter

texts.es:
Walter agradece a todos los inversionistas por el préstamo y se siente contento, él pudo comprar materiales de trabajo que los utilizo para reparar motocicletas y le fue muy bien, él continua viviendo en la ciudad de Paucartambo y continua participando en el banco comunal “Santa Ana” y esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar más materiales de trabajo como por ejemplo aceites, tuercas, empaques y otros repuestos. 

Walter es una persona responsable y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas mensuales con mucha responsabilidad.
texts.en:
Walter thanks all of the investors for the loan and he feels content. He was able to buy work materials that he utilizes for repairing motorcycles and it went really well for him. He continues living in the city of Paucartambo and continues participating in the "Santa Ana" village bank. On this occasion he needs the loan to buy more work materials like materials like oil, screws, gaskets and other parts.

Walter is a responsible person and he is committed to carrying out his monthly loan payments with much responsibility.

loans.use: to buy more work materials like oil, screws, gaskets and other parts.

loans.name: Fatou

texts.fr: Madame Fatou est une productrice  qui évolue dans le commerce. Elle habite dans un quartier de la commune, elle s’active dans la commercialisation de produits textiles et alimentaires.  Etant à son 3ème prêt, elle sollicite celui-ci pour acheter et vendre des tissus pour hommes et femmes et de l’huile  de palme qu’elle place à ses clients. Elle est mariée et mère de famille ; elle aide aussi son mari dans la gestion des charges familiales et les frais de scolarité de ses enfants. Elle a une expérience de plus de 10ans dans son activité.  Fatou commence sa journée à 8h pour la finir à 18h. A l’avenir elle souhaite augmenter ses revenus et améliorer les conditions de vie de sa famille.
texts.en:
Fatou is a producer who works in retail. She lives in a neighborhood of her town, where she works selling textiles and food items. She has requested her third loan to buy and sell palm oil and clothing for men and women, which she will offer to her customers. 

Fatou is a married mother, and also helps her husband take care of the household expenses and provide for their children’s education. She has more than 10 years’ experience in this business, and starts work at 8 am, finishing at 6 pm. In the future Fatou would like to increase her income and improve her family’s living conditions.

loans.use: To buy food products and textiles for resale to her customers

loans.name: Alicia

texts.es:
Alicia es de la ciudad de Pilar, ella tiene una despensa y comenta que se dedica a esta actividad  hace más de 5 años, es madre de una hija de 5 años, quien es su fortaleza, y por quien ella lucha incansablemente.
 Es una persona  muy trabajadora y emprendedora y con buena referencia en su barrio, que siempre es conocida por su trabajo y su lucha. Pide este crédito para poder invertirlo en la compra de insumos para su despensa, como ser verduras, carnes, frutas, panificados y demás.
Agradece por esta oportunidad que ella está recibiendo, que le será de mucha ayuda.
texts.en:
Alicia is from the city of Pilar, she has a convenience store and indicates she has worked doing this activity for more than 5 years, she has a 5-year-old daughter, who gives her strength and she works for her tirelessly.
She is a very hardworking and entrepreneurial person, with good references in her neighborhood, always known for her work and fight.  She requests this loan to invest it in buying products for her convenience store such as vegetables meat, fruits, bread and other.
She is thankful for this opportunity that she is receiving, which will be very helpful.

loans.use: to buy vegetables, meat, fruits, bread and other.

loans.name: Maria Magdalena

texts.es: María de 44 años de edad habita en casa propia junto a su esposo y dos hijos menores de edad. María y su esposo hacen todo lo posible para que sus hijos cuenten con las mejores condiciones de vida. Es una mujer emprendedora quien desde hace unos años se dedica a la venta de pan dulce de manera ambulante, dicho negocio es su principal fuente de ingresos y lo que le permite llevar el sustento a su hogar. Con el propósito de mejorar sus condiciones habitacionales solicita este crédito a FUSAI ya que desea mejorar el techo de su vivienda el cual se encuentra dañado a causa del tiempo y las lluvias. Con el crédito comprará polines, lámina galvanizada y pagará mano de obra. Espera poder contar con esta ayuda lo antes posible y así comenzar con las reparaciones respectivas.
texts.en:
María, age 44, lives in her own house with her husband and two minor children.  María and her husband do everything possible so that their children have the best living conditions.

She is an enterprising woman, who has been selling sweet breads in an itinerant manner for several years.  This business is her main source of income, and it allows her to support her household.

In order to improve their living conditions, she is requesting a loan from FUSAI.  She wishes to improve the roof of her house, which has been damaged by time and the rains.  She will use the loan to buy poles and galvanized metal sheets and to pay for the labor.  She hopes to be able to count on this help as soon as possible.  That way she will start with the repairs.

loans.use: to buy poles and galvanized metal sheets and to pay for the labor in order to repair the roof on her house.

loans.name: Jennifer

texts.en:
Jennifer works hard to support her family. She is married and has a vinegar vending business in the Philippines.

Jennifer requested a 29,500 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase additional containers of vinegar to sell.

Jennifer has been in this business for 12 years and earns additional income from running a general store.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

In the future, Jennifer would like to save enough money to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional containers of vinegar to sell.

loans.name: Florence

texts.en: Florence, 47, lives in Dansoman, Ghana, with her family. Supporting the family rests on both her and her husband's shoulders. Florence sells cooking oil and tomatoes (in tin and sachet) door-to-door in Dansoman. Florence is applying for a loan amount of GHS 1,400 through ID-Ghana to buy cooking oil and tomato and sell them over one month to customers. With her profits from the sales she has been able to pay school fees for her children. Her ambition is to own a wholesale shop.

loans.use: To buy cooking oil and tomatoes and sell them over one month to customers.

loans.name: Navegantes De Dalcas Group

texts.es: Marlene, quien en la fotografía aparece delante de pantalones verdes, camiseta animal print y un vestido verde con rosado encima, pertenece al Banco Comunal Navegantes de Dalcas  ubicado en  Dalcahue, Castro. En este Banco Comunal los socios son en su mayoría artesanos, hay algunos que venden joyas, son electricistas y venden ropa por catálogos. Marlene es artesana en lana chilota, además de impartir clases de telar, comenzó hace tres años en este negocio ya que antes trabajaba en un supermercado y estaba de lunes de domingo, lo cual la tenía muy angustiada ya que no podía compartir con su familia. Es por eso que decidió dejar su trabajo y emprender en el negocio de la artesanía de lana, que lo aprendió muy pequeña y así poder estar más cerca de su familia. Uno de sus desafíos más grandes es el poder impartir clases  de telar en todo Chile. El préstamo que solicita lo ocupara para comprarse un telar más moderno que el que tiene y además comprar más lana ya que tiene muchos pedidos de vestidos en lana, y está muy contenta y entusiasmada porque sabe que le irá muy bien. Le gusta trabajar junto a Fondo Esperanza, ya que se da la oportunidad de recibir dinero y poder compartir con distintas personas es una de las cosas que más le agradan siempre se hace el tiempo para poder compartir con los demás socios del Banco al que pertenece.
texts.en:
Marlene, who in the picture appears in the front, in green pants, animal print shirt and a green dress with pink top, belongs to the communal bank Navegantes de Dalcas [Navigators of Dalcas], located in Dalcahue, Castro. In this communal bank, the partners are mostly craftsmen; there are some that sell jewelry, some are electricians and some sell clothing catalogs. 

Marlene is an artisan of chilota wool, and also teaches loom classes. She began working in this business three years ago. Before that, she was employed at a supermarket and worked Monday through Sunday, which was very distressing because she could not share time with her family. That is why she decided to leave her job and enter in the business of woolen crafts, which she learned to make when she was very young. This way she is able to be closer to her family. One of her biggest goals is to bring loom classes to all of Chile. 

The loan that she requests will help her to buy a more modern loom than the one she has, and also to buy more wool since she has many orders for wool garments. She is very happy and excited because she knows that she will do very well. 

She enjoys working together with Fondo Esperanza [Hope Fund], because it gives the opportunity to receive money and to be able to share with different people. One of the things that she likes the most is that they always make time to share with the other partners of the bank.

loans.use: to buy wool and a loom.

loans.name: Yesenia Marisol

texts.es:
Yesenia de 40 años de edad, tiene estudios menores de educación básica, está acompañada con el cual tiene 2 hijos. Él es vigilante de un lubricentro ubicado en la ciudad, lleva varios años realizando dicha profesión. Tiene 3 hijos, de los cuales solo los menores viven en casa y están terminando sus estudios de bachillerato. El mayor está acompañado y se dedica al trabajo de campo como jornalero. Ella, junto con su esposo son quienes tienen que cubrir con los gastos de la casa y las necesidades básicas de sus hijos.

Yesenia se dedica al comercio de frutas y verduras, las cuales las compra al mayoreo en la ciudad y las vende en su comunidad. Se ha dedicado a esta actividad desde su juventud, cuando sus padres le inculcaron la necesidad de trabajar para ganarse la vida. Su esposo en sus días libres, se dedica a la agricultura y la ganadería, siembra maíz y maicillo,  tiene 3 animales, de los cuales solo una vaca ordeña y  obtiene leche para la venta. En la venta de verduras, Yesenia tiene que caminar largas distancias, caminando para lograr vender su producto, en algunas ocasiones su hija la acompaña en dicha labor. Trabaja desde primeras horas de la mañana hasta el atardecer.

El préstamo que está solicitando, es para comprar más verduras, para así poder aumentar sus ganancias y mantener a su familia más estable, en cuantos a sus necesidades básicas se refiere y que mejoran la calidad de vida de sus miembros.

Los planes de yesenia  a futuro, es obtener mayores ganancias para estabilizarse económicamente, junto con su familia y así poder gozar de una mejor calidad de vida. Esto lo logrará con trabajo constante y dedicación y el fruto de sus ventas.
texts.en:
Yesenia, 40, has a basic education. She has been in a relationship with someone with whom she has 2 children. He is a guard for an oil change center located in the city; he has been doing this profession for various years. He has 3 children, of whom only the younger ones live at home and are finishing their studies at the high school level. The eldest is in a relationship and makes a living doing fieldwork as a laborer. She and her husband are those who must cover the expenses of the home and the basic needs of their children.

Yesenia makes her living selling fruits and vegetables, which she buys in bulk in the city and sells in her community. She has been doing this business since her youth, when her parents instilled in her the need to work for a living. Her husband, on his free days, works in agriculture and cattle raising; he plants corn and sorghum. He has 3 animals, of which only one cow is for milking and he obtains the milk for selling.

When selling vegetables, Yesenia has to walk long distances, walking in order to achieve selling her product. On some occasions her daughter accompanies her in this work. She works from the early hours of the morning until sunset.

The loan that she is applying for is to buy more vegetables in order to be able to increase her profits and make her family more stable in their basic needs and that they improve their quality of life.

Yesenia's future plan is to obtain more income to stabilize herself economically, along with her family and therefore be able to enjoy a better quality of life. She will achieve this with constant work and dedication and the fruit of her sales.

loans.use: to buy more vegetables.

loans.name: Im's Group

texts.en:
Im is 31 years old, married, and has three children. He is from Moung Russey district of Battambang province. He grows rice and pineapples as the main source of income. He earns almost 29,500 KHR a day. 

Im is the leader of his group and is requesting his second loan from VisionFund for 1,000,000 KHR, which he will use to buy fertilizer for his crops. With his past loan, which he has repaid, he was able to upgrade his living conditions. His co-borrower is requesting a loan for 500,000 KHR. Im hopes that the fertilizer will boost his paddy rice with double yield in return.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer for his crops

loans.name: Niño Jesus Group

texts.es:
El grupo Niño Jesus está en el  ciclo número 2, donde también forman parte del programa de eliminación de la pobreza, donde aplican la encuesta de eliminación de pobreza, como parte de ese programa.
Una de las integrantes es la Sra Zunilda, quien es la presidenta del grupo, es una persona que se esa esforzando por mejorar su vida y la de su familia por medio de su trabajo. Entre el trabajo que ella hace cuenta que tiene su propia despensa, en la que desde tempranas horas del día atiende y da sus clientes buenos y frescos productos.
La Sra. Zunilda  Solicita de este crédito para la compra de productos en general para surtir su negocio, como ser bebidas, panificados, carnes y demás, lo que le ayudará a tener a concretar su plan de negocio, el cual le ayudará a mejorar sus ingresos.
texts.en:
The group "Niño Jesus" (Christ Child) is in its second loan cycle. All of the members are also participating in the poverty elimination program in which they had to take a survey as one of the requirements.

Sra. Zunilda is a member and also the president of this group. She is a person who strives to improve her life and that of her family through her work. Her job involves managing her own food pantry, beginning in the early morning hours. She attends to her customers and provides them with the best and freshest products.

Sra. Zunilda is requesting a loan so that she can buy general products to restock her business such as beverages, baked goods, meats, and other items. This will help solidify her business plan, which will in turn increase her income.

loans.use: to buy beverages, baked goods, meats, and other items to sell.

loans.name: Mann Du Ciel Group

texts.fr: La cliente Lucie est une trésorière de l’association  d’affaire « Manne du ciel », senior entrepreneur expérimentée, dynamique, âgée de 60 ans, veuve  et mère de 7 enfants qui ont déjà leurs foyers. La cliente est une vendeuse de pagnes. Elle installe ses marchandises dans un quartier animé, surtout au long de la rue. Elle commença ses affaires avec le prêt de l’IMF Hekima. Il y a 9 ans qu’elle exerce cette activité.  Ce nouveau prêt va lui servir d’acheter 15 ballons de pagnes. Ainsi, elle souhaite scolariser ses petits fils, étendre son projet de commerce et construire une belle maison pour sa retraite. Au finish, elle remercie fortement Hekima pour l’autonomisation des femmes entrepreneurs non bancables, surtout ; pendant ce moment critique de guerre à l’Est du pays.
texts.en:
This client, Lucie, is a treasurer of the business association "Manne du ciel". She is a senior entrepreneur, experienced, energetic, 60 years old, a widow, and mother of seven children, who already have their own homes. Lucie is a vendor of 'pagnes' (the colorful cloth of western Africa). She sets up her merchandise in a busy district, particularly along the street. She started her business with a loan from the microfinance institution Hekima. She has been in this business for nine years. 

This new loan will be used to purchase 15 bales of 'pagne' cloth. Thus, she would like to provide schooling to her grandchildren, expand her business plans, and build a nice house for her retirement. 

In conclusion, she thanks Hekima very much for promoting autonomy among unbanked women entrepreneurs, especially during this critical time of war in the country's east.

loans.use: to purchase 'pagne' cloth to sell

loans.name: Ararat

texts.en:
Ararat is married and has two children. He lives in Kapan city in Syunik region. Ararat is a cook and works in a restaurant. He is very skilled cook and the dishes made by him are very tasty. 

Ararat’s son has some problems with his health and he needs to pass a serious and detailed medical examination in order to get a diagnosis. He is requesting a loan for 70,000 Armenian drams, which he will use to pay for his son’s medical examination.

loans.use: to pay for his son’s medical examination

loans.name: Israyel

texts.en:
Israyel is 66 years old, married, and has one child. He lives in Ijevan city which is in Tavush region. Israyel operates a small food market, selling dairy products, bread, sweets, canned goods, juices, alcoholic drinks, and household products. All his family members help him  in order to earn a good income. His shop is highly busy during the day and he hopes to have more income near to the New Year’s period.

Israyel is requesting a loan for 300.000 Armenian drams, which he will use to enlarge his food shop’s assortment.

loans.use: to  enlarge his food shop’s assortment

loans.name: Evelyn Beatriz

texts.es: Evelyn de 33 años de edad habita en casa propia junto a su esposo y su pequeño hijo de 5 años de edad.  Evelyn se caracteriza por ser una mujer muy emprendedora ya que desde hace varios años logró establecer una pequeña tienda en su hogar de residencia en la cual vende variedad de productos como pan dulce, golosinas, arroz, azúcar, etc. Junto a su esposo quien trabaja como comerciante en el mercado de su localidad llevan la economía del hogar y juntos van sacando adelante a su familia. Con el propósito de hacer crecer su tienda solicita este crédito a FUSAI para invertir en la compra de productos de tienda (arroz, azúcar, frijoles, golosinas, pan dulce, etc.) para incrementar su inventario lo cual le permita cubrir una mayor demanda y de esa forma hacer crecer su ventas e ingresos que la lleven a cumplir su objetivo de mejorar su  calidad de vida y la de su hijo.
texts.en:
Evelyn, who is 33 years old, lives in her own home with her husband and their young 5-year-old son. Evelyn is a very business-minded woman, since she started a small store in her home many years ago. She sells a variety of products like sweet bread, snacks, rice, sugar, etc. She and her husband, who works as a shop-keeper in the local market, financially support their household and move their family forward.

With the goal of growing her business, she has requested this loan from FUSAI to invest in the purchase of products for her store (rice, sugar, beans, snacks, sweet bread, etc.) to increase her inventory. This will allow her to be prepared for greater demand and increase her sales and income, which will help her to achieve her goal of improving her quality of life and her son's quality of life.

loans.use: to purchase rice, sugar, beans, snacks, sweet bread, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay his school fee and to buy school materials

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay his tuition fee

loans.name: Josphat

texts.en:
Josphat is 51 years old, married, and has six children. He lives in Changamwe area in Mombasa County in Kenya. He operates a retail business, which he has been doing for more than five years. He started the business from his own savings and his business is feeding him and his family.

Josphat is requesting a loan from Milango, which he will use to buy soap, flour, and sugar for his business. The challenges that faces in the business include competition, unstable prices, and inflation. He wants to educate his children in the next five years and then save for himself.

loans.use: to purchase soap, flour, and sugar

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy cows

loans.name: Mauricio Antonio

texts.es:
Mauricio de 37 años de edad, solo estudio hasta el nivel intermedio de educación básica, se acompaño muy joven, su pareja  trabaja vendiendo tortillas que elabora con sus hijas mayores todos los días. Sus hijas ya no estudian solo la de 12 años va a séptimo grado, en la escuela de la comunidad a 2 km de su casa.

Mauricio, se dedica a realizar trabajos de campo en labores agrícolas, ya sean propias o asalariado, también trabaja como ayudante de albañil algunas veces dependiendo el trabajo; pero por lo general trabaja casi todos los días y así a trabajando siempre desde que era joven, trabajaba con su papa. 

Antes solo trabajaba Mauricio, pero se le hacia difícil a veces cubrir los gastos de vida de la casa, cuando la familia creció los gastos eran mas y empezó a trabajar, su señora para ayudar con los gastos de la casa a su esposo y sus hijas mayores se involucran ahora después de haber cursado de 9° en la escuela. La zona de trabajo del cliente, es  en la misma comunidad y se mueve solo en bicicleta             

El préstamo que esta solicitando es, para comprar materia prima para el negocio de  su esposa en la venta de tortillas: comprar maíz, leña y cosechar 7,000 metros cuadrados de maíz que tiene cultivada a un km de su casa, de esta manera su esposa, tendrá inventario para trabajar con sus hijas. Mientras, Mauricio trabaja como jornal y se aseguran de tener estabilidad económica y conservar sus clientes a quienes proveen de tortillas todos los días        

Para el futuro, tiene planificado aumentar la casa haciendo, un nueva habitación ya que sus hijas están grandes y a aumentado la familia y  ver si es posible que las hijas continúen sus estudios de bachillerato, aunque sea a distancia y puedan superarse profesionalmente.
texts.en:
Mauricio, age 37, only went to school up to the intermediate level of basic education.  He entered into a relationship when he was very young.  His life partner works selling tortillas that she makes with their older daughters every day.  His daughters no longer go to school.  Only the 12 year old goes to the seventh grade at the community school, which is two kilometers from their house.

Maricio does agricultural work for himself and as a salaried worker.  At times he also works as an assistant bricklayer.  He generally works almost every day.  He has been working this way ever since he was young.  He used to work with his father.

Before, Maricio was the only one that worked.  However, at times it was difficult to cover his household’s living expenses.  When the family grew, there were more expenses.  His life partner started to work in order to help her husband with the household expenses.  Now, his older daughters are involved after having finished the ninth grade in school.  The area where he works is in his own community, and he just uses a bicycle to get there.

The loan that he is requesting is to buy raw material for his wife’s business of selling tortillas.  He will buy corn and firewood.  He will also harvest 7,000 square meters of corn that he has grown one kilometer from his house.  This way, his wife will have inventory in order to work with their daughters.  Meanwhile, Mauricio works as a day worker.  They assure themselves of having financial stability and of keeping the customers to whom they provide tortillas every day.

In the future he plans to expand his house by building a new room.  This is because his daughters are older, and the family has grown.  He wants to see if it is possible for his daughters to continue their high school education.  Even though it is in the future, he would like them to be able to be successful professionally.

loans.use: to buy raw material for his wife’s business of selling tortillas.  He will buy corn and firewood.  He will also harvest 7,000 square meters of corn that he has grown one kilometer from his house.

loans.name: Le Rocher De Ouanaminthe Group

texts.fr:
Marlene  est le coordinatrice de son groupe Le Rocher de Ouanaminthe, elle est marié, elle  a 4  enfants. Elle habite dans la région nord est d`Haïti ou de électricité est rare et de l’eau portable est très limitee. Marlene dirige son commerce de vente de Tennis chaussures et d’accessoires pendant plus d’une dizaine d’ annee.


Avant de se commercer elle était  une couturiere et ecoliere a la fois, elle  espère que cet emprunt l’aidera a grandir son commerce. Des autres membres du groupe Le Rocher de Ouanaminthe ont besoin d’un emprunt pour le commerce tel ques: ventes produits cosmétiques, boissons gazeuses etc. Elle déclare que son défit principal est de devenir une grande commerçante  dans le département du nord est dit son but principal c’est d’avoir un grand commerce qui lui facilitera a construire une grande maison avec l’aide d’Esperanza Int.
texts.en:
Marlene is the coordinator of her group "Le Rocher de Ouanaminthe". She is married and has four children. She lives in northern Haiti, where electricity is rare and potable water is very limited. Marlene has been running her business selling tennis shoes and accessories for over ten years. 

Before starting off, she was a seamstress and a school teacher at the same time. She hopes that this loan will help her to expand her business. Other members of the group Le Rocher de Ouanaminthe have need of a loan for such businesses as selling cosmetics, fizzy drinks, etc. 

She says that her main challenge is to become a major merchant in the northern district and that her main goal is to have a big business facilitating the construction of a big house, with the help from Esperanza Int.

loans.use: to purchase shoes and accessories to sell

loans.name: Teresa De Jesus

texts.es: A sus 53 años de edad Teresa trabaja como comerciante de productos de belleza como lociones, desodorantes y productos por catálogo. La venta la realiza de manera ambulante y gracias a su carisma ha logrado ganarse la confianza de muchos clientes que cada día la prefieren más. Ha notado un pequeño aumento en la demanda de sus productos por lo que ha tomado la decisión de invertir en un  mayor inventario por lo que solicita este crédito a FUSAI la compra de variedad de lociones, cremas para la piel, desodorantes, etc. De esta forma espera hacer crecer su negocio e incrementar sus ingresos los cuales  le permitan dar a su hijo mejores condiciones de vida.
texts.en:
At 53 years old Teresa works selling beauty products such as lotions, deodorants and products from a catalog. 

She works as a mobile vendor and thanks to her charisma has managed to gain the trust of many customers who prefer her more every day. 

She has noticed a small increase in the demand for her products so she has decided to invest in broadening her inventory. 
Thus, she is requesting this loan from FUSAI to buy a variety of lotions, skin creams, deodorants, etc. 

She hopes to grow her business and increase her income which would enable her to give her child a better life.

loans.use: to purchase lotions, skin creams, deodorants, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous
