texts.es: La clienta vive en casa de un familiar con su esposo, ella se dedica a la crianza de pollos de engorde desde hace 3 años, comercializa sus productos en los diferentes mercados que se encuentran cerca de su lugar de residencia, con las ganancias que obtiene y con la ayuda de su esposo logran solventar algunos gastos de su hogar, la clienta esta solicitando un crédito para la comprar de concentrado y vitaminas para los pollos y seguir con su trabajo ya que esa es su única fuente de ingresos y asi poder tener junto a su esposo una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
This client lives in her family's home with her husband. For the past three years she has worked raising chickens, which she sells in different markets near her home. With the income that she earns, and with the help of her husband, she is able to support their home expenses. 

This client is asking for a loan to buy food concentrate and vitamins for the chickens, so she can continue working. Raising and selling chickens is her only source of income, and by improving her business she will be able to support herself and her husband with a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy food concentrate and vitamins for his chickens

loans.name: Sol De Oro Group

texts.es: El banco de emprendimiento SOL DE ORO, está compuesto por nueve integrantes siete mujeres mujeres y dos varones,  todos ellos se dedican a distintas actividades, la presidenta del banco es la señora Cristina, en la foto la persona que esta sentada de chompa megra y blusa roja,  tiene 57 años,  ella se dedica a la venta de edredones a crédito,  ella vende visitando instituciones públicas y privada mercados de la ciudad ofreciendo su productos,  este préstamo es su primera secuencia dentro de la institución,  la señora Cristina va a usar este préstamo  para la compra de edredones  al por mayor ya que tiene muchos pedidos por estas fiestas de fin de año,  la señora Cristina a utilizar los beneficios en seguir mejorando su negocio, su deseo para su negocio es  poder abastecerse  de variedad de  producto ya que tiene mucha venta y es donde tiene que aprovechar para así tener más ingresos económicos, se siente agradecida por esta oportunidad que le brindan en la otorgación del crédito.
texts.en:
The "Sol de Oro" (Golden Sun) communal bank is made up of nine members: seven women and two men. They all make a living by working in various activities. 

The president of the group is Cristina, who is the one in the photo wearing a black sweater and a red blouse. She is 57 years old and makes a living by selling quilts on credit. She sells them by visiting public institutions and private markets in the city to offer her products. This is her second loan with this institution.

Cristina will use the benefits to continue to improve her business. Her dream for her business is to be able to stock up on a variety of products since she has many sales and needs to capitalize on this to improve her income. She is grateful for this opportunity that she has received from the granting of this loan.

loans.use: to purchase quilts in bulk.

loans.name: Bineta's Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe a été crée le 21 Décembre 2009 à l'inauguration du banc villageois. Il est composé de 24 femmes très solidaires et dont la plus part d'entre elles pratiquent le petit commerce comme activité. 

Debout à droite de la photo et levant la main droite, TAGUE, la représentante du groupe est âgée de 50 ans. Elle est veuve et mère de 07 enfants dont 03 garçons.  

Avec le prêt reçu, elle achète de l'arachide et du mil à 200 f le kg  pour stocker et revendre au bout de 04 mois à 275 frs le kg. 

Les bénéfices générés par l'activité lui permettent d'entretenir sa progéniture avec une partie et d'épargner l'autre pour préparer leur avenir.
texts.en:
This group was created on December 21, 2009 when the 'banc villageois' was inaugurated. It comprises 24 women who have a high degree of solidarity. Most of them have small-scale businesses. 

Standing at the right in the photo with her hand raised, TAGUE is the group's representative. She is 50 years old, a widow, and the mother of seven children, including three boys. 

With the loan in hand, she will purchase peanuts and millet at 200 francs per kilo in order to build up an inventory to resell at 275 francs per kilo four months later. 

The profits generated by her business will enable her to take care of her offspring, as well as save money and prepare for their future.

loans.use: to purchase peanuts and millet to resell

loans.name: Dilbar

texts.ru: Дилбар личность с большой буквой. Она пережила многие трудные периоды жизни с гордо поднятой головой. Ей 38 лет. Она замужем и имеет 4 детей. Дилбар является основной кормилицей своих детей, так как ее муж трудовой мигрант в Российской Федерации. Родители ее мужа живут вместе с ними. Они пенсионеры. Для обеспечения большой семьи, Дилбар была вынуждена организовать свой бизнес. Она начала свой бизнес купле продажей детской одежды. Постепенно она развевала свой бизнес. Данное время она продает обувь в магазине. Она уже 5 лет занимается бизнесом. Дилбар хочет пополнить свой оборотный капитал. Она запрашивает займ на сумму 5000 сомони для покупки обуви. Она ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en: Dilbar has a big personality. She has survived many difficult periods of life with her head held high. She is 38 years old. She is married and has 4 children. Dilbar is the main breadwinner for the children, as her husband is a migrant worker in Russia. Her husband's retired parents live together with them. To provide for such a large family, Dilbar has to open her business. She began her business in buying and selling children's clothing. Over time, she has grown her business. Currently, she sells shoes in a store. She has 5 years of experience in the business. Dilbar wants to replenish her working capital. She has requested a loan of 5000 Somons to buy shoes. She awaits your kindness.

loans.use: To buy shoes to increase her working capital

loans.name: Ararat

texts.en:
Ararat is 62 years old, married, and has one child. He lives in Sevan city in Gegharkunik region.  Ararat has worked at the different banks as a gold expert. For 10 years he did the same job in the Russian Federation at one of the major banks. He returned to his hometown and is now retired and receives a pension. 

Ararat wants to repair his house since over 20 years have passed when it was last repaired. He is requesting a loan for 1,000,000 Armenian drams, which he will use to repair his house and provide his family with comfort.

loans.use: to repair his house

loans.name: Mohamed

texts.en:
Mohamed is 26 years old and single.  In 2012, Mohamed established his food market. He began his business because he wanted to improve himself. Working seven days a week, 15 hours a day, he earns about 500,000 SLL a month. 

Mohamed is requesting a loan for 4,000,000 SLL, which he will use to buy more drinks, provisions, water, sugar, etc. to sell. In the future, he plans to build a bigger shop and to become an international businessman.

loans.use: to purchase more drinks, provisions, water, sugar, etc.

loans.name: Susanna

texts.en:
Susanna is married and has two children. She lives in Yerevan. From rented space in one of the city markets, Susanna bakes different sweets and cookies. She sells in nearby small shops and also receives individual orders for cakes. The income that she gets from her bakery business helps her husband to sustain the family’s daily costs. 

Susanna would like to enlarge her business and is requesting a loan from SEF International, which she will use to purchase materials and tools needed for cooking. She has been approved for a loan within the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF International. The start-up loan program provides business start-up loans with soft conditions to informal businesses that do not have access to credit products. The loan will be a great support to Susanna as she will be able to increase the production of cookies and earn more income for the family.

loans.use: to purchase materials and tools for cooking different types of cookies

loans.name: Bumairam

texts.ru: Бумайрам 48 лет, замужем, воспитывает 2 детей. Супруг и младший сын находятся в России на заработках, работают строителями, ежемесячно отсылают деньги семье в Кыргызстан, но отправленных денег недостаточно для проживания семьи и Бумайрам решила не сидеть сложа руки, а развить животноводческую деятельность. Благо у Бумайрам это получилось и получилось неплохо. Бизнес свой она начала еще 15 лет назад с покупки скота на 2,000 сом KGS. Благодаря упорному труду Бумайрам, в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется: 6 дойных коров, 10 овец и 5 лошадей, а также имеет земельный надел размером 0,72 ГА, на котором выращивает кукурузу. Ежемесячный доход составляет 8,000 сом (KGS). Бумайрам входит в группу "Жаштык", в эту группу входят еще 2 человека. Бумайрам является вторым членом группы. В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Бумайрам обратилась в Микрофинансовый банк «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 20,000 сом (KGS) на покупку овец для увеличения поголовья скота. Доходы от кредита Бумайрам планирует вложить в дальнейшее приумножение количества домашней скотины, и планирует накопить средства на покупку кошары для дальнейшего развития животноводства.
texts.en: Bumairam is 48 years old, married and raising 2 children. Her husband and younger son are working in Russia as builders, and send money back home to  Kyrgyzstan every month.  However, the money is not enough for a family and Bumairam has decided not to sit idly by, and to develop a livestock business. Thankfully, this worked out okay. She started her business 15 years ago with the purchase of cattle for 2,000 KGS. Thanks to her hard work, Bumairam's household has 6 dairy cows, 10 sheep and 5 horses, as well as a plot of land measuring 0.72 hectares, which she uses to grow corn. Her monthly income is 8,000 KGS. Bumairam is a member of the group "Zhashtyk", which includes 2 other people. Bumairam is the second member. In order to further grow her business, Bumairam has appealed to the Microfinance Bank "Bai - Tushum and Partners" for a loan in the amount of 20,000 KGS for the purchase of sheep for breeding. Bumairam plans to invest the income from the loan into further increasing the amount of livestock, and plans to save enough money to purchase sheepyards to further expand her business.

loans.use: to buy sheep

loans.name: Ana Carolina

texts.es:
Ana de 36 años de edad,  estudio hasta cuarto grado, es casada, su esposo es agricultor, han procreado 3 hijos de 20, 25 y 17 años de edad, de las cuales 2 están trabajando y una está estudiando.

Ella se dedica al comercio, posee una pequeña tienda, en la que vende antojitos y productos de primera necesidad, tiene 3 años de dedicarse a esto. Lo aprendió ella sola, ya que necesitaba ingresos para su familia, su negocio lo tiene en su casa y en ocasiones sale a vender a las casas, con ella venden dos de sus hijas.

El préstamo que está solicitando, es para comprar productos para su tienda, para que su tienda crezca mas en productos y que tenga mejores ingresos para ella y su familia y tener una mejor condición de vida para su familia.

Su sueño es que su tienda crezca y sea  una de las mejores en el cantón y que su familia tenga más ingresos y una mejor condición de vida para ella y su familia.
texts.en:
Ana, 36 years old, studied through the fourth grade. She is married and her husband is a farmer. They have had 3 children who are 20, 25 and 17 years old, 2 of whom are working and the other of whom is studying.

She makes her living in sales. She has a small store, in which she sells snacks and basic needs. She has been doing this for 3 years. She learned it on her own, because she needed income for her family. She has her business at home, and sometimes sells door to door. Two of her daughters sell with her.

The loan she is applying for is to buy products for her store, so that her store can stock more products and she can have better earnings for her and her family, and so that her family can have better living conditions.

Her dream is for her store to grow and be one of the best in the canton, and for her family to have more income and better living conditions.

loans.use: to buy products for her store, so that her store can stock more products and so that she can have better earnings.

loans.name: Kin

texts.en: Kin is 45 years old and married with five dependent children. All the children are financially supported by her and her husband. The oldest daughter is enrolled in a university and studying accounting. Kin owns a grocery stall and also grows rice. Additionally, she buys rice for resale. Kin and her husband have been in business to support their family for over 20 years. As they are short of money to support their daughter's higher education costs, Kin and her husband have decided to borrow funds from VisionFund Cambodia to support their daughter's four-year studies. Kin really hopes that after her daughter graduates from her university she can find a good job and have a good future.

loans.use: to pay for her daughter's higher education costs

location.town: Kampong Speu Province, Ou Dong District

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more soap for her business.

loans.name: Lasha

texts.en:
Lasha is from the Terjola district, West Georgia. He is 31 years old, married, and lives with his wife and two children. Lasha earns a living through bread distribution. He buys bread in the early morning from the local bakery and then distributes them to local food markets. His earnings are modest, and he doesn’t manage to save money. 

Lasha will start a bakery with the received loan. His wife is good at baking and wishes to sell the products to the local people. Lasha will purchase construction materials and renovate a small store that is located near his house. He will also purchase an oven and raw materials to bake various kinds of cookies. He will sell the cookies along with the bread and generate an income. Lasha hopes that his business will be lucrative and he will be able to improve the standard of living for his family members in the future. He hopes for your generosity.

loans.use: to start up a bakery

loans.name: Kelly

texts.es:
Kelly es una joven de 27 años de edad, comerciante en un estado civil en unión libre, madre de 3 hijos y con un grado de educación secundaria completa. Ella es comerciante ya que actualmente tiene una pequeña pulperia con la cual ayuda a su compañero de hogar a generar ingresos para el fortalecimiento de la familia y los gastos de sus hijos. Su compañero de hogar trabaja en una ONG por lo que tiene que pagar mientras el no está a tiempo completo a un hermano para que le de asistencia y mantenimiento a sus cultivos de café. Su trayectoria con el rubro de café es bastante amplia ya que son 11 años de dedicarse a este negocio siendo su conyugue quien le enseñara con el cual ha podido llevar a cabo muchos proyectos.
Sus planes para el futuro son los de poder crear otro negocio como lo es la venta de productos agrícolas ya que su compañero de hogar es agrónomo y quiere sacar provecho de ello. Su sueño como toda madre es primeramente la salud sus hijos, brindarles la oportunidad de asistir a la universidad para que puedan seguir el ejemplo de sus padre de ser una persona estudiada y preparada para poder tener mejores oportunidades de empleo, mejores ideas de negocios las cuales puedan llevar a cabo. Por lo que ella hoy día solicita financiamiento para la compra de insumos agrícolas para poder asistir sus cultivos de café como; abono, foliares, herbicidas, fungicidas con los cuales asegurara y protegerá su cosecha de café para esta temporada.
texts.en:
Kelly is a 27 year old merchant in a civil union, a mother of 3 children and a secondary school graduate.

She is an entrepreneur and has a small grocery store with which she helps her domestic partner generate income to strengthen their family and pay for their children's expenses. 
Her partner is working at an NGO so while he is not full time, they have to pay a brother to help them in the maintenance of their coffee crops. 

Her career in the field of coffee is quite broad as she has spent 11 years engaging in this business with her partner who has taught her so that she has been able to finish many projects.


Her plans for the future are to able to create another business with the sale of agricultural products as her partner is an agronomist and she want to take advantage of that.

Her dream, like all mothers, is firstly the health of her children. Then to give them the opportunity to go to college so they can follow the example of their father,to be well educated and well-prepared in order to have better job opportunities and better business ideas which they can bring to life.

So today she is requesting funding for the purchase of agricultural supplies to help their coffee crops, such as, fertilizer, foliar herbicides, fungicides which ensure and protect their coffee crop this season .

loans.use: to buy farming supplies to help her coffee crops.

loans.name: Hilder

texts.en:
Hilder is 27 years old and lives in the town of Masindi in Hoima region of Uganda. She is married and has two children who are both currently in school. For the past five years, Hilder has been working hard to manage her retail shop, which sells various food items 

To help expand her business, Hilder has requested a loan of 3,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more food staffs such as milk,bread and sugar to sale, and will help Hilder to generate greater profits and to become a wholesaler. Hilder hopes that in the future she will be able to become a well known supplier in town. 

Hilder is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Hilder who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to buy more food staffs such as milk,bread and sugar to sale,

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy sand, cement, gravel and cinder blocks.

loans.name: Karen

texts.en:
Karen, a young and prosperous 32-year-old farmer, lives with his wife, small son and parents in the village of Geghamavan, which is in Gegharkunik region.  Karen’s father, who is disabled, does not work, nor does his wife or mother. 

Karen earns his family’s living on his plot of land where he cultivates potatoes, has four cows, four calves, a bull, two heifers, forty chickens, and six sheep. From their house Karen’s mother and wife sell milk, meat, eggs and potatoes. 

Karen is now requesting a loan of 800,000 Armenian drams in order to buy a car which he and his family need very much for everyday use.

loans.use: to buy a car which he and his family need for everyday use

loans.name: Jose Arturo

texts.es:
José Arturo tiene 57 años de edad, vive junto a su esposa en el distrito de Zaña, su población se dedica a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería a una hora con cuarenta y cinco minutos de la ciudad de Chiclayo, costa norte del Perú.

Con el apoyo de su esposa se dedican a la crianza y venta de animales menores patos, pavos, cerdos en la parte posterior a su domicilio desde hace 5 años, ocasionalmente ofrece servicios de cómo electricista.

El ha solicitado un préstamo de 1 500 nuevos soles para terminar la construcción de una habitación de su vivienda para posteriormente alquilarlo y de esta manera tener ingresos adicionales para su familia.
texts.en:
Jose Arturo is 57 years old and lives with his wife in the Zaña district, where the people there are farmers, sell livestock, and work as merchants.  It’s located one hour away from the city of Chiclayo, on Peru’s northern coast.

He and his wife have been raising and selling small animals such as ducks, turkeys, and pigs behind their house for five years.  Occasionally he also works as an electrician.

He is asking for a loan of 1,500 Soles so he can finish building a room onto his house and then rent it out and generate additional income for his family.

loans.use: to build a room.

loans.name: Fariza

texts.ru: Фариза молодая и целеустремленная девушка. Ей 19 лет. Она не замужем и живет вместе со своими родителями и сестрами. Фариза родилась и выросла в бедной семье. Ее отец трудовой мигрант в Российской Федерации. Она после окончания средней школы не смогла поступить в университет, так как ее родители не имели денег оплатить за учебный договор. Она училась в средней школе отлично. Фариза организовала свой бизнес скотоводством 3 года назад. Она постепенно развевает свой бизнес и свои навыки по введению бизнеса. Мать Фаризы очень трудолюбивая женщина. Она помогает Фаризе откармливать скота. Недавно отец Фаризы приехал в Таджикистан поведать свою семью и родных. Теперь он должен уехать обратно в Россию, но не имеет денег для покупки авиабилета. Фариза обратилась за займом для покупки авиабилета для своего отца. Она ждет вашу доброту. Она очень нуждается вашей поддержке.
texts.en: Fariza is a young and ambitious girl. She is 19 years old. She is not married and lives with her parents and sisters. Fariza was born and raised in a poor family. Her father is a migrant worker in Russia. After high school, she could not attend university, as her parents did not have enough money to pay for her tuition. She was a perfect student in high school. Fariza began a livestock business 3 years ago. She has gradually grown her business and developed her skills in introducing the business. Fariza's mother is a very hardworking woman. She helps Fariza fatten cattle. Recently, Fariza's father returned to Tajikistan to visit family and loved ones. Now he has to go back to Russia, but has no money to buy the ticket. Fariza has applied for a loan to buy a ticket for her father. She awaits your kindness. She really needs your support.

loans.use: To buy an airline ticket for her father

loans.name: Sovan's Group

texts.en:
Sovan is a young mother of one schoolchild, living in  the Thmor Koul district of Battambang province. To earn a living she grows paddy rice, which is her main source of income. She also works for others for a fee to earn additional income. Sovan has been involved in her current business for more than 10 years. 

This is not the first loan for Sovan with VisionFund (Kiva’s Field Partner). She wisely managed her past loan, which was fully repaid successfully on time. Now she leads a group consisting of five borrowers requesting a new loan. The total amount of the group loan is 2,700,000 KHR, of which 700,000 KHR is Sovan's portion. She will spend her loan portion to buy fertilizer for her crop. She hopes that she can gain a good yield from her crop so that she can make more income to better her lifestyle.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer for her crop

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy more bags of groundnut and onions for her business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more slippers for her business,

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more caustic and palm oil

loans.name: Bertrice

texts.en: Bertrice is a Cameroonian woman who is 45 years old and married with four children. The oldest is twenty and in university while the youngest is ten and in primary school. She has been in this business for the past twelve years which makes her very experienced, stable and her business very profitable. Her business is likely to succeed because it is located in an urban area with many potential customers. This loan will help increase her turnover by fifty percent. Her standard of living will be improved as well.

loans.use: to buy cloth and material.

loans.name: Nodar

texts.en:
Nodar lives in the Khelvachauri District. He is 62 years old, married and lives with his wife, two grown sons and a daughter. Nodar’s daughter is a tailor and gets a monthly salary. Nodar is, at the moment, unemployed. He runs a small-scale agricultural business and breeds a milk cow. The family makes cheese and sells it to community members. Nodar has a citrus garden and seasonally sells fruit to retailers.

Nodar decided to start a business as their existing income isn’t enough for the family and their living conditions are poor. His loan request was approved in the frame of a new joint initiative of Kiva and Credo. The start-up loan program envisages the provision of business start-up and restartup credits with soft conditions to country vulnerable poor, who do not have access to credit products, being regarded as “high risk borrowers” because of low income. With the received credit, Nodar will purchase a car and serve local people as a taxi driver. The income of the family will increase and Nodar will be able to improve the living conditions of the family in the future.

loans.use: to buy a car and start a taxi business

loans.name: Katongore United Farmers Group

texts.en:
Katogole United Farmers is located in Katongole trading center. The group is comprised of peasants and small scale business owners.

Angelica is married and has seven children, three of whom attend school. She is a coffee farmer and also raises goats. She is requesting a loan for 1,000,000 UGX, which she will use to buy fertilizers and pesticides to spray her coffee to prevent pests and diseases. She will use the rest of the money to buy more goats to raise and pay school fees for her children.  With the loan, Angelica hopes to produce 100 bags of coffee per season and construct a permanent home for her family.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and pesticides

loans.name: Reina Isabel

texts.es: Doña Reina se encuentra muy feliz porque gracias a su primer financiamiento ella pudo invertir en sus cultivos de café comprando los insumos necesarios para aplicar como: formula cafetalera, abono, foliares, urea entre otros que son necesarios e importantes para mantener sus cultivos sanos y con un excelente follaje. Doña Reina también pudo destinar parte de los insumos a 3 manzanas de maíz que tenía cultivadas pudiendo dar asistencia y mantenimiento a las mismas que al final del mes de octubre pudo sacar una cosecha de 24 cargas y venderla a muy buen precio con lo que pudo cancelar su primer financiamiento y con la frente en alto al cumplir con su compromiso poder solicitar un segundo financiamiento para poder cultivar la postrera y generar mayores ingresos los cuales podrá destinar al mantenimiento de sus cultivos de café con los cuales tiene la fe y la esperanza de obtener una excelente cosecha que le permita mejorar sus condiciones de vida y las de su familia.
texts.en: Reina feels very happy. Thanks to her first loan, she was able to invest in her coffee crop by purchasing necessary supplies such as: fertilizers, foliar feed, urea, and other items to apply. These are necessary and important for maintaining healthy crops with excellent foliage. Reina was also able to use some of the supplies on 3 manzanas of corn that she had cultivated, allowing her to give them some care and maintenance. At the end of the month of October she was able to harvest 24 loads and sell them at a very good price. With this she was able to pay off her first loan and, with her head held high from fulfilling her obligation, request a second loan to cultivate a final crop of corn. The crop will generate further income that she will be able to put towards maintaining her coffee crops. She has faith and hope that with an excellent harvest she will be able to improve living conditions for her and her family.

loans.use: to prepare the land to cultivate a final crop of corn.

loans.name: Mary's Group

texts.en: Mary is the leader of this group. She is married, and has two children. She lives in the coastal part of Ghana, where buying and selling is very active and profitable. Mary has been selling underwear (bras, pants, singlets etc.) for 6 years. She hopes that this loan will help her to expand her inventory. She says that her main challenge is achieving to become a bigger merchant, but she is working hard to do just that. Her main goal is to have the largest business in her area. The other members of this group have a need for a loan for their businesses selling second hand clothing. They are requesting a loan in the amount of GHS 1800 to improve their businesses.

loans.use: to buy more underwear (bras, pants, singlets etc).

loans.name: Zepherine

texts.en:
Zepherine is 40 years old and lives in the town of Kabale in the  region of Fort Portal in Uganda. A married father of six children, one of whom is currently in school, for the past eight years Zepherine has been working hard to manage his bar and restaurant, which sells food and drinks. 
 
To help expand his business, Zepherine has requested a loan of 2,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda to buy more items for the shop. This will help him to generate greater profits and promote his business. 

Zepherine is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP), which primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Zepherine who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to buy more items for the shop

loans.name: Regina

texts.en:
Regina is 35 years old and married with three children. With three children currently in school, Regina works very hard to provide for them.

Regina runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional stocks to sell in her general store.

Regina has been in this business for 10 years and sells a variety of items such as soft drinks, canned goods, milk, bath soap, detergent soap, sugar, etc. 

She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

In the future, Regina would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy additional stocks to sell in her general store

loans.name: Susanna

texts.en:
Susanna is 50 years old and lives in the city of Vanadzor, Armenia in the province of Lori. She lives with her daughter who is already grown-up but not yet employed. Their small family lives only on the earnings of Susanna, who for over 20 years has had her own clothing business. Susanna was running the same business for several years in Russia, but has since moved back again to Vanadzor. She continues her business in a rented shop in the central part of their city. She sells men's and women's clothing and shoes. The products for sale are purchased from the wholesale market in Yerevan. Susanna sometimes also purchases clothing and shoes from Turkey. 

Susanna is asking for a loan of 450,000 Armenian drams in order to enlarge her business and shop assortment.

loans.use: to enlarge her business and shop assortment.

loans.name: Maria

texts.es: Maria es una confeccionista que ha sido apoyada por Kiva  en créditos, que invirtió en telas y accesorios decorativos, con los que confeccionó productos que  su clientela solicitó, dejándola  así muy satisfecha. Con este apoyo su negocio ha logrado crecer y  sus hijos también han alcanzado logros de educación profesional. En la actualidad está aplicando a un credikiva, mediante el cual comparará un 80% en telas y el un 20 % restantes en accesorios, pues se acercan épocas de gran despliegue mercadológico y usualmente las ventas se incrementan para hacer de su credikiva una inversión de éxito. Ella expresa a sus financiadores de Kiva “ Muchas bendiciones y que sigan ayudando al empresario colombiano”
texts.en:
Maria is a seamstress who has been supported by Kiva loans. She has invested in fabric and decorative accessories, with which she has sewn products that her clients requested, leaving them very satisfied. With this support, her business has grown and her children have achieved professional education.

Currently, she is applying for a loan, which she will use by spending 80% of the loan on fabric and the remaining 20% on accessories. The season for rolling out new marketing plans is approaching, and sales usually increase, which will make her loan successful.

She would like to send a message to Kiva lenders: "Many blessings and please continue supporting Colombian business owners."

loans.use: to spend 80% of the loan on fabric and the remaining 20% on accessories.

loans.name: Ruzanna

texts.en:
Ruzanna lives in the village of Ddmashen which is in the Gegharkunik region. After graduating pedagogical college she got married and for several years she did not work and took care of her children. Now she works at the school as a teacher. Her husband works in the military sphere. Her elder son studies at the police academy. Several years of saving money have allowed them to repair their house and the managed to buy some furniture, but still they have no furniture for the guestroom.
She is asking for a loan of 250,000 Armenian drams to finally to buy furniture for their guest room.

loans.use: to buy furniture for their guest room in order to make their living conditions better.

loans.name: Razia

texts.en: Razia is a 38-year-old lady and enjoys doing the work of hand embroidery. She started doing work with her daughters. Her embroidery patterns are very popular in her territory. She has three children. She is motivated to provide her family with the basic necessities of life including food, clothes and education. In order to meet the growing demand for embroidery she needs to buy more frames, needles and thread of different colors so she requested a loan of PKR 30,000 from Kashf Foundation. In this way she can manage the orders of her customers on time. She is in her third loan cycle with a good credit history.

loans.use: to buy more frames, needles and thread of different colors.

loans.name: Farzana

texts.en:
Farzana is a 39-year-old married woman and the mother of four children; all are school-going. She has been running a business selling clothing for many years. She purchases a variety of clothing from the main city and then sells it to the people of her vicinity. She has become famous for selling good quality clothing in her community. 

To purchase a variety of clothing from the wholesale market, Farzana requested a Murabaha (Muslim-appropriate loan)  of PKR (Pakistani rubles) 25,000 from Kashf Foundation. It allowed her to buy stocks of different clothing for the winter season, taking into account the choices and tastes of her customers. She dreams of giving a good and quality education to her children through all her hard efforts in her business.

loans.use: to buy stocks of different clothing for the winter season, taking into account the choices and tastes of her customers.

loans.name: Greta

texts.en: Greta is from Gugarq village where she lives alone. Over the last three years, Greta has earned her living by providing clothing for resale. In particular she purchases clothing supplies from Gyumri and Yerevan, and resells them in neighboring villages. The income from this activity is very important for Greta and she would like to enlarge it. By applying for this loan, Greta is asking to purchase a new stock of clothing. As winter is already coming, people demand warm clothing. Greta has now been approved for a loan within the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF International. The start-up loan program provides business start-up loans with soft conditions to informal businesses that do not have access to credit products. The loan will greatly assist Greta to continue her retail business and satisfy her clients' needs.

loans.use: to pay for a new stock of clothing to resell to customers.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase rice, imported veritable oil, and other items for her business.

loans.name: Abida

texts.en: Abida is a 39-year-old married woman and the mother of three children. She decided to support her family for a better future, so she began stitching clothes in her house ten years ago. She stitches for the people living around her house and uses the income to support her entire family. However, due to the lack of availability of funds she is unable to meet the daily demands of her customers. For this reason she contacted Kashf Foundation and applied for a loan of PKR 25,000. She intends to use this loan amount to buy more spools of thread in different colors along with packs of zippers and buttons. She is in her fifth loan cycle with a good credit history. She wishes to expand her business in the near future.

loans.use: to buy more spools of thread in different colors along with packs of zippers and buttons.

loans.name: Christelle

texts.en:
Christabelle is a young Cameroonian, aged twenty four and married, without a child. She has been in this business for the past ten months which makes her experience and her business profitable. 

Her business is likely to succeed because it is located in an urban area with many potential customers. This loan will help increase her turnover by seventy-five percent. Her standard of living will as well increase

loans.use: to buy  clothes and shoes for resale

loans.name: Zeetoon

texts.en: Zeetoon is a 43-year-old married lady who has been running a small general store in her community for many years to contribute to the family income.  She offers a variety of grocery items at a reasonable price and has retained many customers who regularly shop at her store. She makes enough to provide for her family. She is the mother of four, two of whom are school going. Her husband is a driver by profession and doesn’t earn enough to support his family alone. To make her store fully stocked she requested a murabaha (a shariah-compliant method of microfinance) of PKR 30,000 which she utilized to buy rice, sugar and flour from the market at lower rates. In this way she was able to meet the increasing demand consistently. She wishes to utilize part of her revenues to increase her business capital.

loans.use: to buy a stock of rice, sugar and flour.

loans.name: Kelin Mariela

texts.es: Kelin a sus 21 años de edad es una mujer emprendedora y muy agradecida en primer lugar con DIOS por haber dado la oportunidad de abocarse a una institución como lo es la cooperativa COMIXMUL, misma que tuvo la confianza, seguridad y credibilidad como pequeña productora de poder apoyar. En su primer financiamiento el cual gracias a los fondos KIVA aprovecho al máximo con los cuales ella pudo comprar los insumos como el abono, formula 18-46-0 y la urea, mismos que son necesarios para poder asistir sus cultivos de granos básicos. Gracias a esta atención brindada a sus cultivos ella pudo sacar una excelente cosecha con la cual pudo cumplir con su compromiso y pudo por medio de las ganancias sembrar 2 manzanas más de maíz las cuales no han sacado la cosecha y ya es tiempo para la segunda siembra por lo que no cuenta con el efectivo para realizar el debido mantenimiento. Kelin ha solicitado nuevamente el apoyo a la cooperativa COMIXMUL por medio de los fondos KIVA un segundo financiamiento con el fin de cultivar su postrera y esperar que el precio del maíz en la zona y en el mercado local y nacional mejore para poder vender sus 2 cosechas completas y así recibir lo esperado.
texts.en:
Kelin, at 21 years of age, is an entrepreneurial woman who, first of all, is very grateful to God for having given her the opportunity to head to an institution such as the COMIXMUL cooperative, who had the trust, security and credibility to support a small-scale producer.

Thanks to Kiva Funds, she took full advantage of her first loan, which she used to buy inputs such as compost, formula 18-46-0 and urea, which are necessary to be able to tend to her basic grain crops. Thanks to the attention provided to her crops, she was able to get an excellent harvest, with which she was able to fulfill her commitment and, with her earnings, was able to plant 2 additional plots of corn. She has not yet harvested these crops, and it is already time for the second planting, which is why she does not have the cash to carry out the necessary maintenance.

Kelin has applied again for the support of the COMIXMUL cooperative through Kiva funds, for a second loan in order to do the final planting. She hopes that the price of corn in the area and on the local and national market improves so that she can sell her 2 complete harvests and receive what she hopes for.

loans.use: to prepare the land to plant the last of the corn.

loans.name: Los Paccollos Group

texts.es: Dominga y varios vecinos conforman el banco comunal “Los Paqollos” y la mayoría de los vecinos viven en la comunidad de Marcachea. (La comunidad de Marcachea está ubicado dentro del distrito de Paucartambo en la provincia de Paucartambo del departamento del Cusco). Dominga es una persona alegre y muy humilde que tiene 43 años de edad, es casada y junto con su familia viven en la misma comunidad, ella después de hacer sus actividades del hogar y se dedica a la agricultura pues tiene varios terrenos de cultivos donde tiene papa, cebada, trigo y otras cosas más. En esta oportunidad Dominga requiere el préstamo para comprar semillas y fertilizantes. Este banco comunal está conformado por varias personas que buscan a cada momento las oportunidades para salir adelante y con su esfuerzo diario entregar un mejor futuro a sus hijos. Los socios se dedican al agricultura, artesanía, venta de comida, ganadería, crianza de animales menores y otros.
texts.en:
Dominga and several neighbours make up the communal bank "Los Paqollos" and the majority of them live in the community of Marcachea (Marcachea is located in the Paucartambo district in the province of the same name in the Cusco region).

Dominga, 43, is a happy and humble person, she is married and lives with her family in this community. After doing her housework, she works in agriculture as she has several plots of land where she grows potatoes, onion, wheat and other things.

On this occasion, Dominga requires the loan to buy fertilisers and seeds.

This communal bank is made up of various people who are looking for the opportunity to succeed and who work hard every day to provide a better future for their children. The members work in agriculture, crafts, food sales, animal husbandry and others.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilisers.

loans.name: Las Marias Group

texts.es:
Las Marias es un grupo nuevo, que está en su primer ciclo, ellas están formando parte del programa de eliminación de pobreza para poder conocer la situación de cada una y de acuerdo a ello poder trabajar y luchar por mejorar esa pobreza.
Una de las integrantes es la Sra. Adela, quien se dedica a la venta de productos argentinos, como ser productos para la casa y también de prendas variadas. Ella es una persona bastante luchadora y que quiere salir adelante, además de eso tiene un espíritu de lucha.
Adela pide de este préstamo ya que quiere invertirlo en la compra de prendas e insumos para la venta, ya que así podrá seguir trabajando e invirtiendo en su microemprendimiento que es el sustento de su familia.
texts.en:
Las Marías is a new group in its first loan cycle.  They're participating in the poverty-elimination program so they can ascertain their situations and be able to strive to overcome that poverty. 

One of the members is Adela, who sells products from Argentina as well as products for the home and a variety of garments.  She's a very determined person with a fighting spirit who wants to get ahead.

Adela's requesting this loan to invest in buying garments and supplies to sell because she wants to continue working and investing in her small business, which supports her family.

loans.use: to buy garments and supplies

loans.name: Yamileth Beatriz

texts.es: Yamileth de 21 años de edad habita junto a su grupo familiar y es una joven muy emprendedora y visionaria. Yamileth trabaja como empleada en variedad de eventos brindando información y en la parte logística. De esta forma se gana la vida y colabora con la economía del hogar. Habita en vivienda familiar y desea ayudar a su familia en la reparación de la casa que un futuro será su herencia. Necesita reparar el techo y repellar las paredes ya que con las lluvias se han dañado y requiere reparación lo antes posible. Solicita este crédito a FUSAI para invertir en la compra de los materiales como; lámina galvanizada, polines, arena y cemento. Yamileth expresa tener la capacidad de pagar las cuotas que el crédito implica.
texts.en:
Yamileth is 21, lives with her family and is a very entrepreneurial and visionary young lady.  Yamileth works as an employee in a variety of events providing information services and logistics.  This is how she earns a living and contributes to the economy of her home.

She lives in the family home and wants to help her family do repairs to the house that in the future will be her inheritance.  The roof needs to be repaired and the walls fixed because they have been damaged by the rain and need to be repaired as soon as possible.  She requests a loan to FUSAI to invest in buying materials such as galvanized sheets, joists, sand, and concrete. Yamileth indicates she will be able to pay for the installments related to the loan.

loans.use: to buy galvanized sheets, joists, sand, and concrete to repair the roof and walls of her residence.

loans.name: Faida

texts.en:
Faida, a  Kiva borrower who describes herself as God-fearing, operates a retail stall where she sells fruits and other groceries. She describes her family challenge to be shortage of water. 

Faida will use this Kes 20,000 loan to buy a water tank to store clean water for domestic use. This will benefit her seven family members. She hopes that in the future, she will have easy access to water. This will be her third loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: buy a water tank

loans.name: Shehnaz

texts.en:
Shehnaz, a 39-year-old married woman who sells milk, is very experienced in this work and has attained a good number of customers. She has become famous for providing good-quality milk and earns enough to contribute to her family's income. Shehnaz has gradually improved her business with the support of the Kashf Foundation. She also sells animals on a seasonal basis to generate extra income. 

Shehnaz is now requesting her fifth loan for PKR 25,000 to purchase another cow. She is hopeful that this loan will bring positive changes to her business.

loans.use: to purchase another cow.

loans.name: Nasreen

texts.en:
Nasreen is 44 years old and married. She operates a business selling milk. She is very experienced and has a good number of customers.  She also sells animals on a seasonal basis to generate extra income. Nasreen has become famous for providing good-quality milk and makes enough to contribute to her family's income. 

Nasreen is requesting her second loan from Kashf Foundation for 30,000 PKR, which she will use to purchase another cow. She is hopeful that this loan will bring positive changes to her business.

loans.use: to purchase a cow.

loans.name: Claudia Lisseth

texts.es: Claudia de 23 años de edad reside en casa de su propiedad junto a su esposo. Juntos trabajan duro para llevar el sustento a su hogar y mantener los gastos diarios. Claudia se dedica a la elaboración y venta de ricos cocteles preparados a base de conchas, camarones, limón, tomate, cebolla y chile. Sus productos son muy demandados ya que son de buena calidad y a muy buenos precios. Su deseo es mejorar su negocio ya que cada día los clientes son más y a veces no logra cubrir la demanda de sus clientes. Por lo anterior solicita este crédito a FUSAI para invertir en su negocio ya que es su principal fuente de ingresos y es muy aceptado en la comunidad donde reside. Con el Crédito comprará conchas, platos cocteleros, camarones y aderezos. Expresa que con lo que percibe del negocio logrará cancelar la deuda del crédito.
texts.en:
Claudia, 23, lives in her own home with her husband. They work hard together to sustain their home and meet their daily expenses.

Claudia makes and sells delicious cocktails made with conchs, shrimps, lemon, tomato, onion and chilli. Her products are very desirable as they are good quality and the prices are good. Her ambition is to improve her business as she has more customers every day and sometimes can't keep up with the demand.

Therefore, she is requesting this loan from FUSAI to invest in her business as it is her main source of income and is accepted in her community. With the loan, she will buy conchs, cocktail dishes, shrimps and dressings. She comments that with the expected income from the business she will be able to repay the loan.

loans.use: to buy conchs, cocktail dishes, shrimps and dressings.

loans.name: Ricardo  Jose

texts.es: Ricardo es un joven trabajador, que lucha a diario para salir adelante en la vida, tiene su pequeño negocio de vulcanización y venta de llantas, Ricardo no tiene hijos aun, pero tiene planes de casarse en este año; es por eso que acude a solicitar el apoyo de crédito para poder hacer un pequeño anexo de cuarto y reforzar la humilde casita en la que actualmente habita, para ofrecerle a su futura esposa una vivienda digna, gracias al financiamiento podrá comprar los materiales como cemento, hierro, bloques, perlines, laminas de zinc y piedrines.
texts.en:
Ricardo is a young labourer who works daily to succeed in life. He has a small vulcanisation and tyre sales business.

Ricardo does not have children yet, but he plans to get married this year. This is why he is requesting help with a loan to be able to build a small extension and reinforce the humble home he currently lives in. He wants to offer his future wife a respectable home and thanks to the finance he will be able to buy building materials like cement, iron, bricks, purlins, corrugated zinc sheets and stone.

loans.use: to buy building materials like cement, iron, bricks, purlins, corrugated zinc sheets and stones.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase wholesale clothing such as underwear, t-shirts, sportswear, blouses, and others.

loans.name: Shehnaz

texts.en:
Shehnaz is 21 years old and married.  She has been running a business of animals’ sales and purchase for many years. 

She buys animals such as baby goats and calves at low prices, brings them up, and then sells them near the occasion of Eid-ul-Azha (a religious event in Muslim countries). She also deals in the work of selling milk to generate an extra amount of income. She has gradually improved her business with the support of the Kashf Foundation.

Currently she has requested a loan of PKR 40,000 to buy two more calves. She is in her third loan cycle, with a good repayment history.  

She hopes to grow her business and dreams of providing a better standard of living to her family members through all her hard work in her business

loans.use: to buy two more calves.

loans.name: Zareena

texts.en:
Zareena is 27 years old and married. She has been running a business of animals’ sales and purchase for many years. 

She buys animals such as baby goats and calves at low prices, brings them up, and sells them near the occasion of Eid-ul-Azha (a religious event in Muslims countries). She has gradually improved her business with the support of the Kashf Foundation.

Currently she requested a loan of PKR 30,000 to buy two more baby goats. She is in her third loan cycle, with a good repayment history.  

She hopes to grow her business and dreams of providing a better standard of living to her family members through all her hard work in her business.

loans.use: to buy two more baby goats.

loans.name: Lydia

texts.en:
Lydia is a Kiva borrower. She describes herself as courageous. She operates a retail shop where she sells groceries and other items. 

She describes her family's challenge to be a shortage of water. She will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy a water tank to store clean water for domestic use. This will benefit three family members. She hopes that in the future, she will have easy access to water. 

This is her third loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to buy a water tank for clean water at home

loans.name: Treeza

texts.en: Treeza is 43-year-old married woman and the mother of four children. She had a difficult time after her husband's business failure and decided to initiate her own business to support her family for a better future. Two years ago, she began doing stitching work in her house. She is familiar with stitching techniques and counts a good client list. However, due to lack of availability of funds, she is unable to meet the daily demands of her customers. That is why she applied for a loan of 15,000 PKR to purchase more spools of thread, packs of needles and elastic material. These purchases will allow her to meet the demands of her customers without delay. It’s her 3rd year with Kashf Foundation, and she has shown good repayment behavior.

loans.use: to purchase more spools of thread, packs of needles, and elastic material.

loans.name: Tanveer

texts.en:
Tanveer is 48 years old and married.  She has been stitching clothes for many years. 

She stitches for the people of her community and uses the income to support her entire family. However, due to a lack of availability of funds she is unable to meet the daily demands of her customers. 

For this reason she has requested a loan of PKR 30,000 from the Kashf Foundation. She intends to use this loan to buy more spools of thread in different colors, along with packs of laces, zippers and buttons.  This will help her to create a means of increasing revenues so she may able to generate a healthier source of income. 

She is in her third loan cycle with a good credit history.

loans.use: to buy more spools of thread in different colors along with packs of laces, zippers, and buttons.

loans.name: Jacqueline

texts.en:
Jacqueline is 31 years old and lives in the town of Lira in Uganda. She is married and has three children, with two currently in school. 

For the past five years, Jacqueline has been working hard to manage her retail shop, which sells household needs. 

To help expand her business, Jacqueline has requested a loan of UGX 3,000,000 from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more essential home products for her shop.  It will help Jacqueline to generate greater profits and take good care of her children. 

Jacqueline hopes that in the future she will be able to increase her capital. 

Jacqueline is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Jacqueline who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to buy more essential home products for her shop

loans.name: Leonardo

texts.es: Leonardo está agradecido por el préstamo pues le fue muy bien y no tuvo ningún inconveniente para pagar su crédito. Con las ganancias pudo obtener algunos beneficios para ayudar a la casta familiar, el continua dedicándose a la agricultura y le va muy bien entonces desea continuar en el banco comunal “Santa Ana” y por lo tanto en esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar semillas, él es una persona responsable que va cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas mensuales con mucha responsabilidad.
texts.en: Leonardo is grateful for the loan. He did very well and had no problem paying off his loan. With the profits, he could get some benefits to fulfill the family's basic needs. He continues to dedicate himself to agriculture and is doing very well. He wants to continue with the communal bank "Santa Ana" but, at this time, he needs a loan to buy seeds. He is a responsible person who will comply with the payment of his monthly installments with great responsibility.

loans.use: to buy seeds.

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane is 43 years old and lives in the town of Lira in Uganda. She is married and has five children, with three currently in school. 

For the past 10 years, Jane has been working hard to manage her produce business, which sells all types of agricultural products. 

To help expand her business, Jane has requested a loan of UGX 3,000,000 from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase more types of agricultural products to sale, and it will help Jane to generate greater profits and more stock for her business. 

Jane hopes that in the future she will be able to provide cilients with what they require. 

Jane is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Jane who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.


"

loans.use: to buy more agricultural products to sell

loans.name: Ana Vilma

texts.es: Ana de 45 años de edad es madre de dos hijas de 22 años y 12 años de edad. Reside en casa propia junto a sus hijas ya que hace algunos años se separó de su esposo quedando ella sola responsable del hogar. Ana trabaja muy duro para sacar adelante a sus hijas ya que para ella es lo más importante en la vida y es por ellas que todos los días se levanta muy temprano para dedicarse a la elaboración y venta de pan dulce. Su deseo es hacer crecer su negocio y de esta forma dar mejores condiciones de vida a sus hijas. Por lo anterior solicita este crédito a FUSAI para invertir en la compra de harina de pan, levadura, huevos, mantequilla, etc. Confía que con esta inversión logrará mejorar las ventas y por ende sus ingresos los cuales le permitirán mejorar su calidad de vida y la de sus hijas.
texts.en:
Ana, 45, is the mother of two daughters aged 22 and 12. She lives in her own home with her daughters as she separated from her husband a few years ago and has remained the sole provider for her home.

Ana works very hard to support her daughters as they are the most important part of her life. It is for them that she gets up early every day to work baking and selling sweet bread. She wants to expand her business and provide a better quality of life for her daughters in this way.

Therefore, she has requested a loan from FUSAI to invest in buying bread flour, yeast, eggs, butter, etc. She confides that this loan will allow her to improve sales and as a result her income will allow her to improve her quality of life and that of her daughters.

loans.use: to buy bread flour, yeast, eggs, butter, etc.

loans.name: Anna

texts.en:
Anna is 50 years old and lives in the town of Lira, Uganda. She is married and has five children, three currently in school. For the past 10 years, Anna has been working hard to manage her restaurant. 

To help expand her business, Anna has requested a loan of 3,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy products that will be used for the restaurant and will help Anna to generate greater profits and pay school fees for her children. Anna hopes that in the future she will be able to have a bigger restaurant. 

Anna is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP). The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Anna who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to buy products that will be used for the restaurant.

loans.name: Georgina

texts.en: Georgina is a Kiva borrower. She operates a retail shop where she sells drinks. She describes her family challenge to be lack of access to reliable source of cooking. She will use the KES 60,000 loan to buy a gas cooker to enable her family to cook efficiently. She hopes that in the future, she will have a strong and reliable business.

loans.use: to buy a gas cooker.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en:
This is a 33-year-old business woman. She is single and has two children, ages five and eight years old. In 2007, she established her drinks and provisions business. When she dropped out of school, she started up a business to help her provide for her children's livelihood. Working seven days a week and 12 hours a day, she earns about SLL 900,000 every month from this business. 

She would like a loan in the amount of SLL 4,500,000. She requires a loan in order to purchase more drinks and provisions. She hopes that this loan will enable her to increase her monthly profits by approximately SLL 500,000. From the proceeds of the business, she will be able to admit her children in one of the recognized private schools, hoping that they get quality education so that they can take care of her in future. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to purchase more drinks and provisions.

loans.name: Oscar

texts.es:
Oscar tiene 34 años de edad, vive junto a su esposa y su hijo en el distrito de Morropon, su población se dedica a la agricultura sobre todo el cultivo de mangos, palta entre otros, comercio y ganadería, este distrito se caracteriza por sus bosques de algarrobo, a dos horas de la ciudad de Piura, costa norte del Perú.

El brinda servicio de mano de obra no califica en las fincas de sus vecinos, ha solicitado un préstamo de 1 000 nuevos soles para la compra de herramientas de trabajo para poder seguir brinda este servicio, y una segunda parte para cambiar el techo de su casa comprando calamina y protegerse de las lluvias que se aproximan en los siguientes meses.
texts.en:
Oscar is 34 years old and lives with his wife and son in the Morropon district.  The people there are farmers and raise mangos and livestock.  This district is known for its carob tree forests and is located two hours from the city of Piura on the northern coast of Peru.
 
He does general labor on his neighbors’ farms and he is asking for a loan of 1,000 Soles to buy tools for his work and also replace the roof on his house to protect himself from the rain in the coming months.

loans.use: to buy tools and fix his roof.

loans.name: Kamataris Twimukye Group

texts.en:
Annet is a widow, age 32 years, and from Biharwe, a suburb in Mbarara municipality. She dropped out of school and got married when she was young. At the age of 30 with 3 children, her husband passed away, leaving her with no source of income to support the family.

She acquired a loan of 800,000 and started fruit vending in the market in order to survive and cater to the needs of her children. This business grew and helped her sustain her family. 

Her business progressed with the help of Ugafode microfinance loans, and this motivated her to mobilize her colleagues in the market to form a development group called Kamataris Twimukye group. This group has made their businesses prosper, and they are requesting a loan of 2,400,000 UGX to help them increase their business working capital to improve their standards of living. She will use the loan to book more fruits and vegetables from farmers such that she will have a constant supply.

loans.use: to pay for fruits and vegetables to sell.

loans.name: Ludovic

texts.en: Ludovic is a Cameroonian, aged 37 and married, with seven children. The oldest is 19 and in high school, while the youngest is 2 and in nursery school. Ludovic has been in this business for the past four years, which makes her very stable and experienced. This loan will increase her turnover from 750,000 to 950,000 XAF. Her standard of living will be improved as well.

loans.use: to buy raw food to cook and sell

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy fertilizer for higher yields

loans.name: Miguel Ángel

texts.es:
Miguel de 60 años de edad, estudio hasta 3 grado, está casado su esposa se dedica a los oficios domésticos, han procreado 3 hijas de 35, 20 y 28 años de edad, viven en el extranjero, de él dependen sus 2 nietos.

Él se dedica a la ganadería desde hace 40años y a la agricultura, por medio de su papá aprendió este oficio; ya que su papá es agricultor. También, sus nietos se involucran con él su horario es de 7 a12.

El préstamo que está solicitando, es para su esposa que se encuentra enferma y la otra parte para comprar una novilla.  

Su deseo es, que su esposa se mejore y tenga una mejor condición de vida en su negocio y su vida personal.
texts.en:
Miguel, 60, studied to the third grade. He is married and his wife is engaged in household chores. Miguel has fathered three daughters aged 35, 20, and 28 years, living abroad. His two grandchildren depend on him.

He has raised cattle and worked in agriculture for the last 40 years. He learned this craft from his father because he was also a farmer. Also, his grandchildren work with him on his 7 to 12 schedule.

The loan he is requesting is partly for his sick wife and also to buy a heifer. 
He desires to get his wife better and to have a better life personally and in his business.

loans.use: to purchase a heifer and to care for his sick wife.

loans.name: Jemimah

texts.en: Jemimah lives in Mariakani, Kenya. She is 28 years old and a mother of one. She sells vegetables at the village market and she has been doing this business for the last five years. She started the business from saving a thousand shillings. She learned about Milango through friends and now she seeks a loan to buy vegetables to sell in her business. She has goals in life to buy a plot and own property of her own. The major challenges that she faces in the business are price fluctuations and inflation rates that affect her income.

loans.use: to buy vegetables

loans.name: José Leonardo

texts.es:
José de 59 años de edad, es acompañado, su esposa se dedica a los oficios domésticos, 2 de sus hijos viven con él,  los demás ya están casados, también con él viven sus nietos.

José se dedica a la agricultura, desde que tenía 10 años, el trabajo lo aprendió por medio de su padre; se decidió por este trabajo ya que su padre lo inculco desde pequeño, también es jornalero, su trabajo queda a media hora de su casa, viaja a pie, con él se involucra un hijo el cual le ayuda en los cultivos

El préstamo que está solicitando, es para comprar dos novillas para engordarlas y desarrollarlas productivamente, mejora su condición de vida ya que tendrá mejores ingresos a futuro.  

Su deseo es, que las dos novillas que compre, tengan un buen desarrollo y que a un futuro tengan una fuente de ingresos  para él y su familia.
texts.en:
José, 59, lives with his wife who is engaged in domestic chores. He has two children who live with him as the others are already married. He also has grandchildren living with him.

José has been making his living from agriculture since he was 10 years old. He learned how to do this work through his father instilling it in him since his childhood. José also is a day laborer. His work is a half an hour from home. He travels on foot with his son who helps him in the fields.

The loan he is requesting is to buy two heifers to fatten and raise them productively. He wants to improve his living conditions and have more income in the future. 

He hopes that the two heifers he buys will develop well and that he will have a future source of income for himself and his family.

loans.use: to purchase two heifers to fatten and raise.

loans.name: Balqees

texts.en: Balqees, 35, is a vigorous, married woman and the mother of seven children. She has had a business doing hand-embroidery for the past six years. She makes beautiful patterns for the people of her community. Her designs are much in demand and she has managed to consolidate a clientele that allows her to contribute to the expenses of her home. To help her to continue her operations, she has requested a loan of 25,000 PKR to buy spools of threads in different colors and packs of beads, sequins and stones for embellishment. In this way, she will be able to cater to more customers consistently. She is hopeful to increase her income by targeting more customers. It’s her sixth year with Kashf Foundation. Balqees dreams for her children's bright future and wishes to spend the part of profit on the betterment of her family members.

loans.use: to buy spools of threads in different colors and packs of beads, sequins and stones.

loans.name: Zaitoon

texts.en:
Zaitoon, 28, is a vigorous married woman. She has had a business doing hand-embroidery for the past five years. She is passionate about her work, and client demand is strong. But business challenges, combined with family expenditures, frustrate her nearly every day. Her husband is a laborer but his income is not enough to support his family well. Zaitoon’s embroidery patterns are very popular on her street, and she is the best earning resource in her household. 

She is a mother of four children. She wants to grow her business. She requested a loan of 20,000 PKR to buy raw materials such as thread, sequins and pearls in large quantities to meet the increasing demand. She shared her dream of running a training center for girls of her village and is also interested in opening her own shop in the market to display her work.

loans.use: to buy raw materials such as thread, sequins and pearls.

loans.name: Hasan

texts.en:
Hasan is 26 years old, married and has a child, age 2. His family lives at Masazir village of Abseron region.
Hasan’s wife takes care of the baby and doesn’t work in a job outside the home.
Hasan is an electrician. His equipment is broken and for the time being he is unable to work. He applied for a loan in the amount of 1150 AZN (Azerbaijan New Manat) for the term of 12 months. With this loan he will repair his equipment and will resume his work.
He is thankful to Komak and Kiva organizations for the aid. Hasan wants to hire a few assistants in the future.

loans.use: he will repair his electrician equipment

loans.name: Perpétua

texts.pt:
Perpétua  tem 37 anos de idade, divorciada e mãe de 03 filhos dos quais d0is maiores de idad todos  frequentando Escolas públicas. A sua base de sustento é o negócio, ela trabalha das 08h até as 20h todos os dias vendendo pipocas.
Ela vai usar o empréstimo para comprar uma máquina de fazer pipocas para poder  aumentar a produção e consequentemente as suas receitas.
O seu maior sonho é se tornar uma empresária no ramo dos  transportes porém, ela tem o desafio de acumular poupanças para conseguir comprar a primeira viatura.
texts.en:
Perpétua is 37 years old, divorced and the mother of 3 children, 2 of whom are of age and all of whom go to state Schools. Her income comes from her business: she works from 08h00 to 20h00 every day selling popcorn.

She will use the loan to buy a popcorn machine to be able to increase the quantity of her production and consequently her income.
Her biggest dream is to become a businesswoman in the transport industry, however her challenge is to amass enough savings to be able to buy her first vehicle.

loans.use: buy a popcorn machine to be able to increase the quantity of her production

loans.name: Paulina

texts.pt:
Paulina tem 36 anos de idade, solteira e mãe  de 01 filha .A sua base de rendimento é o negócio. Ela trabalha todos os dias vendendo eletrodomésticos na sua casa e tambem por encomendas. Viaja mensalmente duas ou mais vezes para  comprar produtos na Africa do Sul.
Com o empréstimo pretende comprar  cadeiras e panelas  para revender em sua casa.
O seu maior sonho é de construir uma loja de forma a fazer o seu negócio num lugar fixo  e com boas condições.
 Seu desafio é de pagar o seu empréstimo dentro do periodo pré-estabelecido de forma a pedir outro, Bem como pagar a escola da sua filha.
texts.en:
Paulina is 36 years old, single and the mother of 1 daughter. Her income comes from her business. She works every day selling white goods from her home and also by mail order. She travels every month, usually two or more times to buy products from South Africa.

With this loan she plans to buy chairs and pots to resell from her home.

Her biggest dream is to build a shop so that she can run her business from a fixed location with good conditions.

Her challenge is to pay back her loan within the pre-agreed term so that she can ask for another one as well as paying for her daughter's school fees.

loans.use: buy chairs and pots to resell from her home.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is 45 years old and lives in the town of Ntungamo in the Mbarara region of Uganda. She is a widow and has one child. For the past three years, Mary has been working hard to manage her retail shop, which sells home products. 

To help expand her business, Mary has requested a loan of 2,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more items for the business, and will help Mary generate greater profits and Increase family income. Mary hopes that in the future, she will be able to expand the business. 

Mary is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP). The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Mary who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to buy more items for the business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase live pigs and firewood.

loans.name: Juan

texts.es: Juan continua con la venta de productos de primera necesidad como por ejemplo arroz, azúcar, fideos, aceite y otras cosas más, él sigue teniendo el puesto de venta donde vende sus productos a vecinos, amigos, familiares y además personas. En esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar sacos de arroz, sacos de azúcar, fideos, tarros de leche, pan pues para incrementar el capital del negocio. Agradece y valora el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas mensuales con mucha responsabilidad.
texts.en:
Juan continues to sell household staples such as rice, sugar, noodles, oil and others from his sales stall. He sells to neighbors, friends, relatives and others.

Juan is requesting this loan to buy sacks of rice, sacks of sugar, noodles and containers of milk to increase the capital of his business. He says he appreciates and is grateful for the loan and that he promises to make his monthly payments very responsibly.

loans.use: to buy sacks of rice, sacks of sugar, noodles and containers of milk.

loans.name: Jose Feliciano

texts.es: Don José es originario de la ciudad de León, casado y padre de seis hijos, los cuales uno de ellos aún está a su cargo. Tiene 60 años de edad. Es de oficio mecánico, se dedica al taller de mecánica automotriz. Este negocio lo inicio hace muchos años, el cual le ha generado ingresos para garantizarle educación a su hijo. Actualmente cuenta con un negocio de servicios amplios para sus clientes. Solicita un crédito para comprar equipos y productos como: amortiguadores, aceite, lubricantes, entre otros con el fin de garantizar un servicio de calidad. Estima que este crédito ayudara a crecer su negocio y a obtener mejores ganancias, sobre todo garantizarle mejores condiciones de vida a su familia. Su plan futuro es mejorar cada día mas su negocio y ofertando mejores servicios.
texts.en:
Jose is a native of the city of Leon.  He is married and is the father of 6 children, one of whom is still in his care.  Jose is 60 years old.  He is a mechanic who has an automotive workshop.  He started this business many years ago, and with it he generates the income he needs to pay for his child's education.  At this time, he has a business that offers a variety of services to his customers.  

Jose is requesting a loan to buy equipment and products such as: shock absorbers, motor oil, lubricants, and other items, so that he can provide good quality service.  He thinks that this loan will help him to grow his business, generate greater earnings, and most importantly, ensure better living conditions for his family.  His plan for the future is to improve his business every day, offering better services.

loans.use: to buy shocks, motor oil, lubricants, and other items

loans.name: Artur

texts.en:
Artur lives in Vanadzor town with his wife and three little children. He has worked as a taxi driver for 5 years already, running his own car. Artur's wife isn't working outside the home, as she has to take care of the household and children, so the only breadwinner in the family is Artur. As a very hard-working  man, Artur does his best to gather a good income and provide normal living conditions for his family. 

Artur is requesting this loan to renovate his car and continue his taxi driving business. Artur has been approved for a loan within the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF International. The start-up loan program provides business start-up loans with soft conditions to informal businesses that do not have access to credit products. The loan is very important for Artur to be able to continue driving a taxi and ensure a better life for his three children.

loans.use: to pay for renovation of his taxi

loans.name: Zedekiah

texts.en: Zedekiah is a Kiva borrower. He describes himself as a focused person. He operates a motorcycle transport business where he transports customers using his bicycle to earn a living. He describes his family challenge to be lack of enough water storage facilities. He will use the 40,000 KES loan to buy a water tank to store clean water for domestic use. He hopes that in the future he will economically and socially sustain his business. This is his second loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to buy a water tank.

loans.name: Rama

texts.en: Rama received a Kiva loan and he was able to repay the loan fully without many challenges. He wants to expand the existing business and add more stock so that he can reach more clients. His business improved after the previous loan. He was able to pay school fees for his children and provided a better life for them and now he wants another loan to buy more cooking utensils, basins, etc. The extra income that he will raise will improve the standards of living and educate the children.

loans.use: To buy cooking utensils, basins, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy clothing to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more used clothes for her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a stock of shirts and skirts.

loans.name: Laurence

texts.en: Laurence is a Cameroonian, aged 38 and married, with five children. The oldest is 12 and in secondary school, while the youngest is 1 year old. Laurence has been in this business for the past four years, which makes him very experienced and stable and his business profitable. His business is likely to succeed because it is located in an urban area with many potential customers. This loan will increase his turnover by 15 percent. His standard of living will be improved as well.

loans.use: to buy kitchen utensils for resale

loans.name: Magdaline

texts.en:
Magdaline lives in Kilifi county north of Mombasa, Kenya. She is 29 years old, and she is married, with two children. 

She owns a small grocery store in town that she started six months ago. The business has been doing fine ever since she started. 

She now wants to move it to the next level by acquiring her own premises where she can do business. She knew Milango through friends who invited her, and she joined so that she could access funding for her small business.

She now seeks a loan to buy kale, cabbages, and potatoes. The major challenge that she faces is the competition from other traders and price instability. The extra income that she raises will improve her savings.

loans.use: to buy kale, cabbages, and potatoes

loans.name: Martina

texts.es:
Martina tiene 35 años de edad es madre soltera (Por Viudez) de 4 hijos, la mayor de las hembras estudia en secundaria, 2 niñas que estudian en primaria y el varón que es el único que se involucra en las actividades sobre el mantenimiento del café.
